Reviews.Title: “Old-world charm”
Reviews.Author: PieterS37
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip, but my wife, who loves Rome, was with me. The hotel has great charm and very helpful staff. Our room appeared to be bathed in golden light thanks to the color of the wallpaper. The mattress was average and overshot the bedframe on both sides; the shower (in the bath) was excellent. The sound insulation was not good, but the reception reacted swiftly when, two nights running, we complained about the noise from the neighbor 's TV. Breakfast is good and can be enjoyed inside and in a conservatory-style adjunct to the villa (or rather villas: the hotel is spread out over three of them, all close together). At times, the influx of breakfasters exceeds capacity. I heard from my colleagues that some of the rooms are very pokey, but the reception tries to switch complainants to better rooms. I also heard that the - free - internet connection was not good everywhere, but in our room it was fine. The location is in a quiet tree-lined residential street, but rather far from the metro and major sights, and about ten minutes walk from restaurants. However, all in all, atmosphere more than compensates for drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Julia M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the best district for staying in Rome. It’s located next to Coliseum and river in a very quiet and green zone. If you don’t like huge globalized stone-money-comfort-standard places – choose this one. It’s small and friendly, has it’s own little garden – so you can have a breakfast in the open air and have a bear and cigarette in the late evening among the orange trees. And it is decorated in light renaissance style, so you can fill the beauty of Rome even when you sleep  By the way we’ve fond the best way to walk around Rome like italiano vero – using the motorbike! You can leave it at the hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay in Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteLuykx
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful stay at Villa San Pio. The hotel is situated in one of the most beautiful areas of Rome, one of the residential parts of Rome. To go to the centre you better take the underground 2 stops to the colloseo, walking to the centre takes about 30-45 minutes. Overall the service was good, the staf was very friendly and helpful. Our room was traditional, clean and spacious enough! We liked our stay and we will definately return! Good value for money! Tip; go and have a walk to Piazza dei Cavalieri di Malta (which is 2 streets further) there will be waiting a surprise if you look through the key hole of the massive door :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family trip”
Reviews.Author: Benies98
Reviews.Content: Had one double and one quad with huge terraces. Both rooms had nice bathrooms and lots of space. Hotel breakfast was nice, lots of choices. Just far enough away from the hustle and bustle, yet close enough to walk to many sights. We were lucky enough to spend quality time with friends that live in the same neighborhood as Villa San Pio. Great location for us since my husband was running in his 1st marathon which started and finished at the Colosseum. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice for a combination work/leisure trip”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelertrainer
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of my husband's having a conference in Rome by inviting our daughter over her Spring Break to join us from college, and we spent four days in heaven. Of course Rome does that to one, regardless of where you stay, but having the Villa S. Pio there as a welcoming haven and an oasis of calm at the end of each day made it all that much better. Down to the lovely staff, the garden breakfast room (resembling a green house) and the spacious rooms....we were not disappointed. Our trip combined business, family, leisure and more...

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Marie B
Reviews.Content: Situated in one of the most charming area of Rome Villa San Pio is ideally located to be at the same time in the centre of Rome and in a quiet neighbourhood. It has a lot of character and the friendliness and the efficiency of the staff in general (and of Justin at the reception desk in particular) is a real added value. Everything is done to accomodate your requests.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ladybug269
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 8 nights at San Pia and I must say i really enjoyed it. I was there for business with a personal day on either end. San Pia is located in a really nice residential neighbourhood on Aventino Hill. At first glance it seems like its off to its self, but it is actually abut 15 minutes from FAO (hence alot of people coming fro FAO meetings stay here), 15 minutes from Circus Massimo, and 20 minutes from the Colloseam/Forum/Palatine Hill. Though i didn't do it, it is also possible to walk to the pantheon, trevi fountain, spanish steps, Santa Maria del Popolo and the shopping district around Via Corso (i would guess it would take about 40 minutes to get to the start of Via Corso, then the other sights are nearby aso you go up Corso towards Pizza Popolo). The hotel itself is lovely, very traditional in its styling. It is spotlessly clean and the service was perfect. The staff knew your name and were very friendly and helpful. My room was rather small, but perfectly functional. I had a king size bed (very little space on either side), bathroom with a shower, huge window, large patio with a table and chairs, TV (can't comment on this, didn't turn it on for my whole stay), mini-bar, safe and a vanity for my clothes. The bed was comfy, though a little hard as all european beds are. Shower was great. One side of the room was a huge windown and a door to the patio, as this was facing the street i was a little worried about noise and light (i am a ligt sleeper), but the room had these cool electronic blinds that covered all the window and teh door at night so you weren't bothered by the street lights. The room had free internet in the room and free wifi in the comon areas. Two minor annoyances - you had to get a new password every 36 hours which got annoying if you forgot and in my room the internet cable didn't quite fit into my computer and if i moved at all it fell out. That was frustrating while skyping with my family. Breakfast was included at the hotel and it was fine, decent selection, very european (ie no bacon and eggs or omelets or anything like that). I enjoyed it but found that after 8 days, i was pretty sick of eating the exact same thing every morning. The hotel has one elevator, and it is very small and very slow. I don't think you could get two people and their luggage in there at the same time. My one and only issue with the hotel (and its nothing they can really change so this didn't affect my rating, just thought people should be aware) is that like all old european buildings the walls are pretty thin, so if you face the street you can hear every car and motorcycle that drives by, and the street cleaners and garbage men, etc. Even worse though, is that you hear everything from neighbouring rooms. Truthfully, it could be that i simply had a loud neighbour, but it was enough to bother me. Especially as i was working and had to up early every day (and especially on my last night when i had to be up at 4am to catch my flight home). I probably should have called reception and asked them to talk to the man, but i didn't want to cause a fuss. One other thing to be aware of (which is probably the same for all hotels in rome) - there is a 2 euro/night tax added on to your room that you pay at the end. I had been told by colleauges that this had to be paid in cash, but mine ws just added on to my bill and i paid it all on credit card. So in summary - i loved the hotel: Positives: location, price, service, decor, patios, cleanliness, friendliness, free internet, free breakfast negatives: thin walls

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was on a honeymoon by myself here!”
Reviews.Author: Hannahlrobertson_11
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel as I heard it was in a nice, leafy area of Rome; so I could unwind after my 24 hour journey from Australia and relax for two days before starting Contiki. I emailed them before asking if I could have a room with a balcony. I knew, due to my family running hotels, that this request would be ridiculous in the Summer period, but I thought, due to the low season I would take a chance. A receptionist replied that she would do her best. Viola! I was greeted to an amazing European-style balcony. I was blown away by the area and the charm of the building- everything is typical historical, romantic Italian. Even the receptionist's name was Mario, and he was wearing a tux! Breakfast is buffet style and served in a charming dining room. I spent two days in the courtyard chasing the most friendly cat in the world, who I nicknamed Gatto (Italian for "cat"). On the last day I sat outside on my computer for two hours while he napped on my lap <3. Only problem I had with this place was the bed. It was a bit hard. But I'm not really picky about things like that....I slept 10 hours on the plane home from Rome, I can sleep anywhere. lol. All-in-all, a beautiful place to unwind and relax before my chaotic Contiki!

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil oasis close to Rome's heart”
Reviews.Author: AnndeF
Reviews.Content: Situated in Rome's most peaceful, verdant neighborhood, Villa San Pio offers a tranquil retreat from the city's noise and bustle. The setting inside and out is peaceful and romantic. Rooms are spacious and beautifully furnished. Ours overlooked a lush interior courtyard. The staff is friendly and helpful. And the location is ideal. What feels like a remote retreat is actually walking distance to the centro storico and tourist sights, and right next to the less touristy, lively Via Marmorata and the characteristic neighborhood of Testaccio, where you can soak up some true local flavor, and shop and eat as the Romans do. Via Marmorata, Viale Aventino and Via Ostiense are major thoroughfares, with range of public transit options to take you all around the city and beyond. Though we arrived last March during a transit strike and were able to walk wherever we needed to go, even Trastevere, without problem. There is also free parking on site. This is a particularly good location if you have a car, as it's easy to get out of town without going through the traffic of the Centro. It took less than half an hour to drive to Fiumicino on the morning of our flight home. If you are traveling to Rome off season, winter or early spring, the hotel also has some generous offers, making what feels like a luxurious splurge surprisingly affordable. We hope to make Villa San Pio our base whenever we travel to our favorite city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Reina E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked away in a charming residential neighborhood (be prepared to walk uphill if you take the bus). We had a bit of trouble finding it at first, and some confusion from being changed from Aventino to Villa San Pio due to renovations. Once we got our bearings, though, we loved staying off the main street. There is a beautiful garden and even some friendly cats passing through. The hotel is a quick walk to restaurants (5-10 min) and sights like the Collosseum and Forum (15-20 min). The metro stop is also a ~10 minute walk. Our room was clean and comfortable, although the shower was small. The staff were courteous and helpful. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valeva
Reviews.Content: The Villa S. Pio is the perfect Hotel! We get there since thirty years and we appreciate it very single time.The environment is romantic, quite and elegant.The staff is extremely kind. Rooms are big and clean, flawless. The breakfast is served in the garden: a myth. The neiborough, the Aventino, is one of the most Rome renowned, aside the circo Massimo and the Campidoglio. Down in Testaccio, a two minute walk, its plenty of buses, cabs and services. Not expensive, too!

Reviews.Title: “charming gem in Aventine Hills”
Reviews.Author: marian27x
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is tucked away in the quiet Aventine Hills neighborhood, which is about 20 minutes walk to major sights like the Forum and Colosseum. It's 5 minutes walk to a major bus station, which can take you to just about anywhere in Rome. The rooms are clean, simple, old world decor, shuttered windows, and birds chirping in the morning. No wifi in rooms, but free wifi in the lobby. We asked for a room with a balcony and got a room with a large terrace, overlooking the neighborhood. Very nice for morning stretches and meditation. The breakfast is plentiful with generous options like fruit, cold cuts, pastries, and yogurt. The coffee and cappuccino are wonderful! You can eat in the "glass room" and watch the resident cat strolling in the sun. The staff are friendly, though not always with a smile. They give tips on which bus routes to take. A cozy respite after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a decent area”
Reviews.Author: Snehvit
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa San Pio is actually a "hotel compound" - three villas in a pretty little garden, in a residential area in Rome. It is part of a local chain of hotels, Aventino S. Anselmo Hotels, apparently owned by the Catholic Church. It is quite basic, with a commmon reception area and a breakfast room. The hotel rooms are fairly spacious with nice bathrooms, but all the rooms are different - so it all depends upon what room you get. The rooms have minibars and a safe locker, and the bathrooms are equipped with hairdryers. The TV menu is large, but 98% are Italian programmes, and I needed assistance to find the BBCWorld and CNN. The bed was quite hard, but if that is to your liking, then it's fine. The breakfast was OK with a modest selection of fresh fruit, yoghurts, ham, cheese and hard boiled eggs, and bread and pastries. They provided a good selection of gluten free items upon request. And the coffee was excellent. It is posssible to have the breakfast served in your at no extra charge. During the day and evening the breakfast area served as a bar/coffee lounge. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and the hotel could arrange for pick up at the airport for about the same amount as a taxi would charge. If you arrive late in the evening og do not know Rome from before hand, this pick up service is very useful. It is possible to go by train to the station "Ostiense/Piramide", and from there it takes about ten minutes to walk (with luggage: take a taxi just outside of the station). The hotel is conveniently located for those who enjoy walking. it is within walking distance to both the Forum Romanum/Colloseum and Trastevere, but there are very few shops and restaurants "around the corner". Since the hotel provides no in-house restaurant, that is a draw back. On the other hand, it is an extremely quiet area and there is no street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, charming”
Reviews.Author: Bea409
Reviews.Content: The Villa San Pio is a little out of the tourist center of Rome, close to the Circo Massimo metro stop and to FAO, which I why I stayed there. It is easy walking distance from Testaccio, a neighborhood where there are plenty of nice restaurants. The Villa San Pio is actually three old Villas facing a garden, on a quiet street, with a lovely solarium where you can eat breakfast. Breakfast is ample, and includes coffee (only so-so) or cappucino (good). Beds are firm (which I like); internet works fine (which is essential for me), staff is friendly and speaks English. Nice bathrooms (no tub, but a good shower). You can get into town by metro (subway - a ten minute walk), or walk or take the subway one stop to Trastevere, another nice neighborhood for walking. So you aren't really that isolated from the touristy spots, and you are in a lovely neighborhood of attractive villas. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndrF
Reviews.Content: at arrival, the staff was very friendly and waiting time very low. They helped me immediately with parking and gave me a wonderful room which I paid lowerpice being a last minute reservation. I expcted a small room due to the last minute deal but i was given room 255 that has a private portion of the garden with table and chairs outside: wonderful! The garden is fantastic, being december it was full of flowers, orange fruits and lemons...great! room was nice and clean, heating system perfect, bathroom new and clean. they allowed me to keep my car in the garage one day more, veru friendship staff. The breakfast garden is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: genia1952
Reviews.Content: Second time I stayed at Villa san Pio in Rome. Great location, walking distance to Colloseum, Forum, Circus Maximus and downtown to the famous Via del Corso shopping district. The staff are very helpful and kind, especially Luigi, the concierge and Agipeto who was always cheerful and helpful. Great location for restaurants along Via Marmorata, concierge recommended and made reservations. Beautiful area to walk, lovely homes, quiet and felt very safe. Rooms are clean and comfortable, a little dated, beds wonderful, lovely terrace to sit and have a cocktail after a long day of walking, sightseeing and shopping! Lovely garden restaurant for breakfast and dinner. I loved it because it had a smaller homey appeal to it rather than the mega hotels. Would go back in Roman heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A Charming, elegant and quiet place to stay in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Esm7
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay if you want to be off the beaten path. In a charming neighborhood within walking distance to 2 subways, the Trevere River and Trastevere. The rooms were old Italian style, the bathrooms were big with a porcelain tub and the breakfasts were delicious and included in the price. There was free wireless and the staff was pleasant. I would recommend to business people and couples who are looking for peaceful and quiet accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance”
Reviews.Author: Suzmo
Reviews.Content: The Villa San Pio offers the perfect rest after a busy day touring Rome. We spent 6 nights in November and truly enjoyed our room, the breakfast, the staff and the cats! It has a lovely garden, and its location is close enough to the center of Rome, the forum, etc...to walk. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet place off city centre”
Reviews.Author: JRLWML
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in 1977 when it was a fairly basic bed and breakfast establishment - it was so quiet and peaceful that w have stayed there 31 times since. It's perched almost on op of the Aventine Hill. In the old days one had to go to Viale Aventino at the bottom of the hill to get an evening meal. Plenty to choose from down there but my the time one got to the top of the hotel afterwards one was hungry again. No more of that. The hotel has steadily improved over the years with renovation, air conditioning and the most welcome addition of a fine restaurant service in the evenings with excellent food. Our rooms have always been spotlessly clean, daily attention and clean sheets and towels every day in the heat of the summer. Room service is available until very late and the staff are unfailingly helpful and friendly. The grounds are pleasant, shaded and relaxing. The hotel might be said to be "off the beaten track" but it is away from the noise and bustle of the city and thee are two bus services a short walk away, one to Piazza Venezia and one to Termini, Rome's main railways and bus station. There are two associated hotels nearby - Hotel S Anselmo (rather upmarket) and Hotel Aventino. The company also has another hotel in the city. Try the website for these. There's also plenty to see at the top of the Aventine Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: Barb S
Reviews.Content: My husband and another couple stayed at the Hotel Villa San Pio for 5 nights in October, 2011! All four of us had a most enjoyable stay at this enchanting Hotel tucked away in the quiet Anselmo district. Our rooms were beautifully appointed with an Ancient Roman theme, and very clean. We loved using our terrace to sample the wine and cheese selected from a nearby Italian Deli. The breakfast buffet was superb with a wonderful selection of fruits, yogurt, bread, eggs and heated milk for our coffee. We also thoroughly enjoyed two evening dinners at the courtyard restaurant! If you have the energy and the time this Hotel is in an ideal location for walking to the Colosseum, and for exploring the city centre sights. We walked everywhere yet it was pleasant to return to the hotel and relax in this quiet neighbourhood. Staff were friendly and helpful with all requests! We would definitely stay at the charming Hotel Villa San Pio again!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Belinda Y
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed in the San Anselmo which was wonderful and decided to try Villa San Pio hoping it would be as good. It didn't disappoint. The hotel organised a car to collect us and even though our flight was late arriving, our driver was waiting. The refreshing juice given to us on arrival was a nice touch. The rooms are compact but functional. The shower is quite small, so not for those who are large. The garden/restaurant area is a lovely spot for breakfast or a quite drink at the end of a busy day. Breakfast is really good, with an excellent selection of fruits, pastries, meats, cereals, cheese and juice. This is such as great area as base for exploring Rome. The hotel is in a lovely neighbourhood, close to the metro but you can walk into the city if you've got the energy and time. Unlike some others, we found the staff very helpful and pleasant. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quiet and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Kevin658457
Reviews.Content: We booked a quadruple room with a massive terrace which was perfect for 2 adults and 2 teenagers and so was good value - also helped a lot by a good discount by booking/paying early (booked in January 2011 for an August 2011 stay). Nice style and location of the hotel in a mainly residential area and easy to walk down to the metro or catch a bus (buy the tickets that give you unlimited metro/bus rides for a number of days). August is also a quiet month in Rome which was great - down side is that weather can be very hot but we did not find it too oppressive.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it could have been”
Reviews.Author: Liz A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 days. First impressions were excellent, we were met with a cool drink on arrival which was very welcoming since it was so hot. We were showned to our room which also exeeded expectations. The area was lovely we were able to walk to most things or easily catch public transport. The things that let it down were the customer service touches. We met up with my sister and her husband during our stay but when they arrived were told they were booked to a different hotel although they had been confirmed for this one. This was sorted out then my daughter was arriving and her accomodation had been booked with ours for a single room. I was informed a couple of days before her arrival that they didn't have a single room available for the 2 days we had booked and that she would have to move rooms during her stay. I said this was unacceptable. I was not concerned what type of room she had but that it be the same room for her whole stay. The receptionist was not pleased about this but said she would see what see could do and was able to resolve it. Also during our stay 3 times we had staff inquire if we had dessert one night in the restaurant and each time we assured them no. It imerged a table had used the restaurant one evening and the staff had mucked up the tabs. Despite this we were quizzed yet again when checking out and this really ended our stay on a disappointing note.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a romantic trip to Roma”
Reviews.Author: doktordod
Reviews.Content: I slept in this hotel for a weekend; it has a perfect location, on top of Aventino hill, in a very chic area of roma; no tourist, a lot of green areas, very quiet and 10 minutes walking from Colosseo. The hotel is in a old villa, completely renovated; rooms are big as well as the bathroom . A big plus is the breakfast, you can have it in the garden, with old trees; it seems to be in countryside, not in roma. Well, it was really a nice surprise. Price is medium hig but, honestly, that s not a 3 stars but something more. If you are organizing a romantic trip, that s the good choice. If you come from Fiumicino airport, don t take Leonardo Express but the other train ( RF1) and the stop is ROMA OSTIENSE, then 10 minutes walking. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel-Quiet/Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: paddlepro
Reviews.Content: We spent the last night of our Italian trip at the Villa San Pio, as we had a morning flight out of Rome back to the USA. We got a great rate at the Villa San Pio, and were very happy the the property. The hotel also arranged a car to the airport for $40 Euro. The hotel is in a very quiet neighborhood of Rome near Circus Maximus and the Pyramid. My wife and I walked 5 minutes from the San Pio to the Metro, and were at Trevi Fountain in 10 minutes. Again...great location. No street noise at night. Seemed like an extremeely safe area. The hotel has free breakfast and a really nice outdoor space surrounded by lush vegetation for cocktails, dining, etc. In the rooms, the bathroom were very nice and the rooms themselves were clean. The mattresses were too hard for my taste, but not horrible. There is a mini bar and free safe that we used. This is a great choice for inexpensive, quiet, clean and very cute. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best if not the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: kornel22
Reviews.Content: I can only compliment the hotel and staff. Location perfect, if only you agree to walk to metro or even closer to the bus n 175, which takes directly to the city centre adding a sightseeing tour along the forum. Romms perfect, nicely decorated, with nice terraces. Clean, air con effective, baths with a touch of old fashioned design. Staff helpful, though because it is a very busy hotel do not expect to be the centre of attention. Breakfast good, in a nice garden, they also opened their own restaurant recently, though I did not have the occasion to try. Overall I can only recommend it for all wishing a nice stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “we always try to go back to the San Pio.”
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: We go to Rome yearly to visit our son and daughter-in-law. The service is excellent and the hotel is clean. Its in a quiet residential neighborhood which is very much to our liking.

Reviews.Title: “We have been staying at this hotel for over 10 years and intend to keep on doing so.”
Reviews.Author: Fareeda H
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff who provide a warm welcome to an intimate, family-run hotel. The rooms and baths are spacious and well-furnished in an elegant, Italian style. The garden and bar are pleasant places to pass the time. The location could not be bettered - the Aventine hill (where the hotel is) is one of the greenest areas of Rome and the hotel is within walking distance of many historic sights. Public transport is readily accessible (metro, rail and bus) and the hotel has off-street parking although on-street parking is plentiful. In the vicinity there are many excellent restaurants and well-known delicatessens while the hotel dining room serves some pleasant dinners. The buffet breakfast is varied and generous and caters to all tastes. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nascarfan51
Reviews.Content: Hotel is comprised of three buildings connected by covered pathways and gardens. Traditional furnishings and character make for a very enjoyable stay. Breakfast can be taken outdoors under the trees or in a glass gazebo. Staff is very helpful with directions and information.While somewhat pricey, the restaurant is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful - best place ever!”
Reviews.Author: jatkins999
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location. Very convenient to restaurants and the tube - super easy to use - but NOT in the middle of the craziness of Rome. Quiet and suburban...reminded me of the northwest quarter of DC, if you're familiar with that beautiful section. The gardens were gorgeous; the room superb; the service exemplary. We'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this special hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler0506
Reviews.Content: I researched several hotels in Roma but the recommendations on trip advisor took me to this special place. The Rooms are spacious and the service excellent. The staff is very willing to give advice on sight seeing in the city. This is a very European Hotel. A lovely mix of people. We were a family of three traveling and had one room with an extra bed. it was spacious and very comfortable. This hotel is in a residential area but close to the Coliseum. If you go up the hill away from the main road you will find lemon trees and a view of the city that's lovely. (take a right at the top of the drive...the real view is outside of an old church.) Turn left and you will find a gate where people can view a special secret through a "keyhole". We loved the rooms and being able to walk to several interesting local area restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome..Stay at Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: travelnicole
Reviews.Content: Tucked into the Aventino Hill neighborhood of Rome, Villa San Pio is a quite and welcomed respite from the bustling city center of Rome. Villa San Pio is charming and elegant. Our double room was large and comfortable the bathroom was huge by european standards. I enjoyed the soaking tub after a long day of walking around Rome. While not in the city center, this hotel is an easy 15 minute walk to all the sites and the nearest Metro is just a few minutes away. The hotel, at no additional charge, helped arrange a car to pick us up from the airport which was a nice way to enter Rome. Once you take the train and a taxi with your bags from the Termini station - you will be at the same price which was 50 Euros (for two). There is a restaurant on site which serves a complimentary breakfast buffet each morning. The cappuccinos were remarkably good here in the morning. I loved the lemon trees that fill the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyLouis
Reviews.Content: Situated away from the main tourist area, the San Pio is a charming oasis in otherwise chaotic Rome. staff is helpful and proactive in accommodating needs. Rooms are very clean and the restaurant food and staff is first rate. Only issue is that the free wi-fi does not reach the rooms so you must sit in the comfortable lobby to access it. Access is also limited by time, so a two or more day stay requires multiple log ins. I think it is a good hotel for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling service from the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Europe011
Reviews.Content: The room with a large king sized bed and two singles was ideal for us. A good bathroom (strange shower set up) was adequate. The breakfast was very average and unappealing. The receptionist was the most surly woman we met on our holiday of 5 weeks throughout Europe. She was rude and completely unhelpful and had no customer service skills whatsoever! On our last evening I requested a station wagon for our trip to the airport the next morning (we had 4 bags which we knew would not fit into a Mercedes). The next morning before breakfast I doubled checked that our car was on it's way, only to be informed that a Mercedes was ordered. I asked again for a station wagon or similar and they insisted a Mercedes would be fine. The car arrived and as I had pointed out, the bags did not fit and a ststion wagon arrived shortly after. Also, the room was too hot and I think the floor heating was on. The man at reception said he would look into it, but he did not. Two cups of tea cost us Euro 6. There was no complimentary tea or coffee on offer. This hotel was a complete rip off and I will definitely not be staying there the next time we visit Rome

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Italiantraveler1000
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed here 4 times, in a different part of the villa each time. Always a well furnished room with very nice bathroom. This time took advantage of the free internet available in the room. The gardens of the hotel truly create an oasis in the midst of bustling Rome. Lovely restaurant with very nice dinner and also good breakfast which is included.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean hotel in a quiet lovely neighborhood close to important Roman sites.”
Reviews.Author: kris081
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now and at another of this group of hotels (San Anselmo) one other time. We have always found the rooms spacious, clean and well furnished with a high level of service. I am very particular about bathrooms and have always been very pleased with the private baths in these rooms (cleanliness, shower facilities, water pressure, towels and so on). The breakfast is very satisfying with many choices. The restaurant is a wonderful combination of fine food and wine with thoughtful personal service. With the help of the terrific people at the front desk (particularly Luigi), we explored the neighborhood restaurants this trip and found some delightful, friendly restaurants with great food, as well as the specialty food shop Volpetti with a great selection of wines, cheeses, meats, breads and chocolates! The bus stop is just down the street and provides economical safe transportation all over the city, or it is possible to walk to the many beautiful sites in Rome. We have recommended this hotel to our friends and will continue to stay at this most comfortable welcoming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MeerkatYork
Reviews.Content: Quiet, well appointed hotel on the Aventine. Only 10 minutes walk from Ostiense Station which makes traveling from the airport easy and inexpensive. Small enough to provide good, friendly service, but large enough to support a good restaurant and breakfasts. Special Easter meal was a dream - especially the lasagne course.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: John020161
Reviews.Content: A lovely quiet place to stay. Up on the Aventine Hill in a smart residential area, it took us 10mins to walk to the Colosseum and roughly the same to the Campidoglio. It has a shaded court-yard and the breakfast room/restaurant is in a nice conservatory. The room we had was large with a good sized bathroom, fitted out in an elegant if rather ornate style.....my wife loved it..! The staff were friendly and helpful. We are fairly fit 50yr olds who like walking...so we walked everywhere. I would recommend the Roma Pass, as it meant we bypassed the long que at the Colesseum as well as the other access and travel benefits it gives you. If you want to visit the Vatican Mueseum (Sistine Chapel) book in advance as again you will just walk to the front of a very long que.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice gardens and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: QudsLocal
Reviews.Content: The hotel consists of about 3 villa's which are devided into hotelrooms. I had a very nice ground floor hotel room, close to the terrace in the gardens. Although I was on business, It was a very romantic hotel. Too bad my wife couldn't come with me. The staff is very nice and were very cooperative when i asked for a late check out. Also the staff at the terrace and restaurant was very very friendly, very un-roman, i would think

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Angela R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Villa San Pio for 8 nights, our room was fantastic with a jacuzzi, heated towel rack, a king size bed and a huge private balcony with furniture. The hotel had gorgeous gardens with lush trees and flowers. The location is perfect, on Aventine Hill which is a quiet suburban area but it is close enough to walk into the city along the river (roughly 15minutes to to Colloseum and 10minutes to Circo Massimo). However the local area (Testaccio) was a highlight of our trip with Markets, deli's and nice local restaurants away from the noisy and busy city center The breakfast was good with a selection of cakes, fruit, cured meats, cheese, eggs, bread and croissants. The only place we saw need for improvement was the woman at the reception who was always cranky and rude when we asked for help with anything. Otherwise the staff were very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families!”
Reviews.Author: runninglynnie
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because they had a quad room (only 1). Very clean, wonderful quiet location and within walking distance to the ruins/collesium. Continental breakfast was included and the cappucino was heavenly! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and safe area, reasonable walk to interesting spots”
Reviews.Author: Colwit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Via San Pio in mid-March 2011 (family with two older teenagers). The Hotel was lovely, and the room (though not enormous) was certainly large enough for all of us. A clean, modern bathroom and full length windows that opened made for a pleasant stay. The breakfast continental buffet was decent, with a selection of cheese, deli meat, hard-boiled eggs, buns, cereal, croissants, yogurt and fruit. The hotel is located in a very quiet area, and a reasonable walk to the colosseum. It is closest to the Pyramid metro stop (about a ten minute walk) and there are interesting local restaurants and shops just south of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis away from the bustle of the city”
Reviews.Author: FrancesPoole
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable 3 night stay at this hotel. Pleasant and helpful staff, good selection at breakfast, rooms were a good size if slightly dated. The hotel is set in attractive gardens and you can come back after a day of sightseeing and sit out and relax with a drink. The location is in a quiet residential street on the Aventine Hill - about half an hour's walk from the centre or a 10 minute walk from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, value and location !!!”
Reviews.Author: RJB50
Reviews.Content: Trust me, you can't beat the value for this little gem. The staff service is some of the best I've ever had and I travel on business a lot. Very quiet and a nice breakfast is included. It's great for business and still very romantic. When the weather is warm, ask for a room with a balcony. It's an easy walk to Circo Massimo subway stop and from there to all the usual Rome highlights. Walking distance for Ostiense station (from airport) as well, which saves you the time and expense of going all the way to Termini and then back. I have stayed here 3-4 times and will always return here when I visit Rome. Last - it's a 5 minute walk to Testaccio if you want to go clubbing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: OttawaRosie
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at San Pio - 6 days initially returning after a week away for 4 more days. We enjoyed the quiet location, the lovely garden, the comfortable room with a large bathroom that included a huge tub sitting on claw feet plus a shower. The staff is the most helpful I have experienced during many hotel stays in Europe. The location is perfect for walking almost anywhere in Rome center. Hope to go back again and again. The only improvement might be varying the items included in the buffet breakfast a couple of times a week especially since there are quite a few guests who stay at least a week..

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Rome”
Reviews.Author: kriboe
Reviews.Content: Got married in Rome and stayed one week at Hotel Villa San Pio together with 20 guests and had a very pleasent stay. Loved the garden and friendly service. Any requests did happen very easily. The breakfast was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Still wonderful - on 4th visit”
Reviews.Author: C-for
Reviews.Content: OK - - I coined it: "When in Rome - I only stay at the San Pio". Well - I have just returned form another 1 week stay there. My 4th or 5th ? Comment? It remains wonderful in every aspect. I had a lovely big room this time in the newly refurbished villa (rooms start with 5...). Staff are ever attentive and helpful. Rita, as always, is there with a warm smile and friendly / efficient manner. The breakfasts are great, tasty, good variety, and the coffee is to "die for" ! This time, for the first time, I ate one night (freezing cold outside) in the Hotel restaurant. Sunday night - with a few diners, candles on every table and lovely and warm in the glasshouse area. The food was great - really tasty. Best part was the Maitre D' (head waiter) - Stefano. He slowly and meticulously took us through all the menu options. Advised us we were eligible for the "conference meal" of a selected "primo and secundo" with complimentary wine and water (bottled) ! All for 18 euros a head ! Lovely guy. Great food. So - again... I can only advise you take up my mantra of: "When in Rome... stay at the San Pio" !! I hope you enjoy it as much as I do. C-for

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when you visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: jeadavies
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, staff, rooms location, the staff are so welcoming & welcome us, the rooms are quiet, elegant & comfortable, the breakfast rooms, in & out are great, the garden beautiful, the food is good, the location just so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Pleasurable Experience”
Reviews.Author: DJMc1
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Italy and couldn't have found a nicer place to stay. The staff is happy and friendly, the room lovely and comfortable, the location in a quiet, charming neighborhood not a far walking distance from a main street and public transportation and the Pyramid landmark...very centralized. A wonderful, tasty breakfast buffet each morning and dinner offered each evening, although I did not stay there for dinner,,,too many other places there in Rome to explore! The service was responsive and excellent -- they provide a limo service to the airport when we left at the same price a taxi would have cost, too. Would definitely want to stay there again if I am lucky enough to return.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Property - We Love This Hotel and Keep Returning”
Reviews.Author: rlk33853
Reviews.Content: Incredible is the word - from the staff - to the quiet orange and lemon grove where you can have a drink or breakfast - to the area surrounding the hotel - this hotel has it all. The rooms are fabulous, spacious and well appointed. Everyone from the front desk staff, to the bell boys cannot do enough for you. What this isn't is the Hilton or the Holiday Inn - it is a quiet intimate property with very personal service. As we had stayed here previously we asked for and got one of the balcony rooms which was an added bonus. The property is a 15 minute walk to the Colosseo and 30 minutes to the rest of the ancient city. Bus service is at the bottom of the hill and is easy to use. Use the local restaurants instead of the touristy ones - suggestions include Perilli, once again at the bottom of the hill - and of course Il Cantinone which is a couple of blocks behind Perrilli''s. Be prepared to do charades and be patient - but the end result will be fabulous meals that are not only reasonable but down right cheap. Try the local wines and beer - you will not be disappointed. Sightseeing - if you were not aware, you can now go underneath at the Colosseo and the tour includes the third level as well. Pay the extra 8 euros - it is well worth the money. We also purchased our Vatican tickets online @ www.vatican.va. You get to bypass the line since you have a pre-arranged time.

Reviews.Title: “Since our first visit in 2001, we still adore this place!”
Reviews.Author: mastalk
Reviews.Content: Truly a necessary part of our regular stays in Rome. Can't imagine being in that great city and not staying in this fabulous hotel. Elegant, spotless and comfortable rooms, incredibly helpful and gracious staff, fine restaurant and a location that truly makes it a peaceful oasis. Our constant thanks to the staff of the Villa San Pio for providing us with a hotel we always think of as our "home in Rome."

Reviews.Title: “Makes my list of top European Hotels”
Reviews.Author: chahn1866
Reviews.Content: In my book the San Pio is one of my top rated European hotels and I would recommend it to anymore traveling to Rome. Hotels in Europe can be a tough call if you are working with a budget. I have found a few over the years that make my list, Hotel Muget in Paris, Hotel Daniel in Munich and Hotel Aquabella in Aix. One drawback for San Pio, it's not in the heart of the tourist sites and there are very few restaurants in walking distance. Stop by the the front desk and ask them to call a cab. If your out for dinner, cabs in Rome can be hard to find. Ask your waiter if they could call a cab for your return to your hotel. The facility is very well maintained and the rooms are charming, 16 ft ceilings with a marble bath. They have a ample morning breakfast and also serve dinner in the evenings. There is a small bar open until midnight for late night drinks in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel experience in Rome :-)”
Reviews.Author: 5speednova496
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very charming and quiet neighborhood in Rome and so you don't have to hear a lot of traffic noise and in fact there is a lot of nice trees around and you can hear the birds in the morning. We got the deluxe room where you can sleep 3 people with the private back patio and it was fabulous. The room was very neat, clean and beautifully designed and for our rate we also had breakfast and it included the taxes. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful to us and we were very impressed with the speed and friendly service. Another plus about this hotel is the restaurant they have a very nice breakfast buffet in the morning and also very good food for your evening meal. Its also an extremely romantic and quaint place where you can enjoy the hustle and bustle of Rome but this is your romantic refuge at the end of the day to spend quality time with your friends and family. I travel a lot around the world and this was a very memorable and pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Neighborhood in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Audrey070
Reviews.Content: Arriving to Rome we were greeted by our driver, arranged by the hotel before our arrival, who drove us to The San Pio Hotel. Our room was spacious, clean and included all amenities. Aventino Hill is a quaint residential tree lined neighborhood. We enjoyed breakfast in the lovely garden or delivered to our room balcony, including delicious cappuccino upon asking. The hotel staff was patient and helpful in answering our questions, giving us directions, recommending restaurants and making reservations. Especially Luigi, who was quite feisty, finding us good local Italian food and teaching us Italian! Our evening in Trastevere, a lively "young" section with a small piazza and music was much fun. Even though we couldn't get a cab back at 1:30 in the morning we found Italian locals who were helpful in getting us bus tickets and getting us on the right bus to get back to our hotel, which turned out to be very easy. Even though we were not in the center of Rome we found it easy to get where we wanted to go by cab, bus or walking. We strolled the streets taking in all the aromas, sights, sounds and magic of Italy. After eating all the good foods the walk was pleasant and much needed. —Audrey and Ed, Philadelphia PA

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and charming hotel with beautiful gardens and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: noeway
Reviews.Content: My family and I (husband, two sons ages 16 and 8, and my mother) stayed at the Villa San Pio in late June. This was our first time at this hotel, and I hoped that--at such a good value--our experience would be good. The Villa San Pio exceeded our expectations! Our rooms were lovely and spacious, the outdoor gardens were lovely and quiet, and the breakfast was expansive and delicious. The quiet neighborhood setting was lush with trees and flowers!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great locations”
Reviews.Author: Gaffer057
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Villa San Pio. It's an idyllic hotel in a lovely location, Close to the main attractions, but far enough to be away from the hustle and bustle of Rome. The staff where very attentive and we'd certainly recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: SimonBath
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at Hotel Villa San Pio. We were delighted with our choice. Very nice staff, ver nice atmosphere and a good location. Not without blemishes but charming and a little oasis after tracking round Rome for a day. They recommended a great local trattoria so you can trust there judgement. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: glasbrew
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this interesting hotel, though the room we were given didn't really have a window. This actually wasn't a huge issue, but made for a very dark room. The staff were friendly and efficient and a touch formal in a kind of old world way. Service was fine and the grounds of the hotel were beautiful. The breakfast in the garden was wonderful and a terrific way to start the day. Also of note, the Aventino area although short of top drawer tourist attractions was actually very interesting, and happily light on other tourists. We stumbled onto a couple of amazing experiences just wandering around the area: one a church with the most amazing choir (with strings!) practising in the courtyard, and then very close by a small park with a terrific view over Rome (reminder that Aventino is a hill). And the Testaccio area is very close, with a number of interesting restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem - Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: rbsimmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 22/06/10 - 27/06/10 We received a welcome drink on arrival which was wonderful after a long drive. The porter helped my husband park the car and took our suitcases up to our room. Parking is free at the hotel. Hotel situated near metro and is close to the heart of Rome if you want to walk. It took us about 15minutes to get to the Colloseum. Our room was lovely and big with a comfy king size bed. The room is air conditioned and has a mini bar. The bathroom was huge with a double marble basin and lovely rain shower which my husband just loved. There is a small plasma TV with heaps of channels but only couple of English channels like CNN and BBC. There is internet in the lobby and free wifi if you have your own laptop in your room. Our room had a lovely wrap around balcony which overlooked Rome. The hotel was wonderful and we enjoyed it immensely. Breakfast is also included in the price and this consisted of breads cereal, hard boiled eggs, cold meats, cheeses juices etc and breakfast is served out I their lovely manicured gardens. This place is certainly worth more than a 3 star. I had better service here than I have had in a5 star hotel. I would definitely stay here again in a heart beat, I highly recommend. Could not fault them once.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and relaxing retreat away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: rudiKinloss
Reviews.Content: The service we received at the Hotel Villa San Pio was excellent. When we arrived at the the hotel we were met and helped with our luggage to our room. Staff were friendly & helpful with one exception a grumpy man at reception who was not very welcoming! (shame, but other staff made up for this). The room was spacious & clean with a flat screen TV, Air Conditioning & really good shower, mini bar & safe. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice, being able to relax in the beautiful walled gardens was a real bonus. With only a 15 min walk to the Metro, we found the location perfect. Good cafes, restaurants & gelatarias all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, just a chore to get to by foot”
Reviews.Author: VacationsAreSoFun
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, clean, classy hotel near ancient Rome, between the River and the colosseum. PROS: - Located in a safe, quiet, beautiful part of Aventino Hill - Friendly staff' - Beautiful grounds - Large, Clean Rooms - Large windows - Good A/C - Firm beds (subjective) - Quiet - Ethernet in Room, wifi in lobby - Restaurant on site - Breakfast buffet filling: *MEATS- Hard boiled eggs, dried italian sausages, hams *BREADS- Croissants, sliced breads, buns, with jams, jellies, nutella, butter *CHEESES- wide spread *Fruit Salad *Yogurts *Cereals *DRINKS- Water, apple juice, OJ, grapefruit *COFFEE- if you ask for coffee, you'll get your own 3 cup pot with steamed milk on the side. If you ask for cappucino, you get a big one. Cons: - On the expensive side - Long walk from Circo Maximo or Pyramid metro stations. There is a bus that comes closer, but we didnt' want to wait for it. Hard after a long day of walking all over Rome - Anything worth visiting or seeing is really a 15 walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: ladvisor
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Villa San Pio and I had a bad experience there. I had an item gone missing from the room and the hotel staff couldn't care less. They told me that since it wasn't money that was missing they didn't think it was their hotel staff and possibly someone else got in the room. If in fact it was someone other than the hotel staff it is even more disconcerting that security is so poor. Another thing you should be aware of about the neighborhood. In general it looks to be a quaint residential area. However, one of my friend's co-workers had her purse stolen as she was walking down the street and two men in a car ripped her purse off her shoulder as she hurled to the ground and had to go to the hospital. I had my wallet stolen in the Naples train station. Overall I would avoid Italy altogether. If you must go be extra cautious about your purse, wallet and possessions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Excellent Service....”
Reviews.Author: Ottawagal62
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa San Pio for three nights in July, in between apartment rentals. I found the service to be attentive, friendly and efficient the food very good and my room lovely and comfortable. As well, the hotel offered lovely shaded and sunny areas in the garden for reading or relaxation. Upon arrival I was welcomed with a cold glass of some fruity beverage - an excellent way to begin my stay. I made a range of demands on the front desk, including assistance booking tours, getting taxis and seeking advice - all requests were met with professionalism and efficiency. The restaurant staff was very kind and friendly, and this was very welcome as I was travelling solo, waiting for a friend to arrive who had been delayed. I enjoyed my time at the Villa San Pio and I would recommend it as good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in a leafy suburb of Rome...”
Reviews.Author: jennyjupiter
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay for one night, but ended up staying for 3 unexpectedly, but in 3 different rooms, Staff were accommodating and helped us extend our stay guaranteeing the initial price we were quoted of 120 euros. Having said that, we became quickly aware that prices do float depending on time and availability and that there were more rooms than we initially expected. The suburb is great with great restaurants nearby, also away from main tourist areas of Rome. We were really happy to get to this hotel from the airport avoiding passing from Termini train station. Breakfast was also really good, apart from the lack of freshly squeezed juice. Internet can be expensive if you don't have your own laptop. Overall, at the price we paid, it was a really good option for staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, relaxing stay with excellent service. An oasis of calm.”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller707
Reviews.Content: We loved this so much we are returning in August 2010. From the delightful receptionist Michael to the wonderful service of all the staff, our stay over 5 days was wonderful. We had a great room with a small terrace overlooking the well kept gardens. Breakfast taken on the outside terrace was a relaxing experience with a well presented buffet giving ample choice with as much tea and coffee as you wanted, replenished by the attentive staff. Easy access to the metro and walking distance to the main sights and the Trastevere area with it's local restaurants and bars. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A noisy experience”
Reviews.Author: wildabouthome
Reviews.Content: We spent three unfortunate nights at Rome's San Pio hotel in June. We occupied two rooms (partly at the weekend price of 240 Euro per room per night), one room for me and my husband and the other for our two kids. Apart from the very high price we had the company of a group of drunk Americans. They occupied several rooms in our passage and returned every night between 2 and 3 am drunk and load and visiting each others rooms. The hotel has old style doors that makes an earthshattering noise when slamming close, and these sounds was part of the remainder of our night. The beds are hard, the linen is cheap and the rooms were very poorly cleaned. The one morning upon returning from our morning excursion we found one of the beds unmade!! Frankly, the only possitive thing I can say is that the breakfast is good. It was the worst and most expensive hotel of our month-long trip to Italy. Please do not repeat our mistake!

Reviews.Title: “A garden oasis in the central Rome area.”
Reviews.Author: LHSDoha_Qatar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week. The hotel is lovely, full of character, clean, great breakfasts, plus helpful staff. The bedrooms are spacious with large shuttered windows, the marble bathrooms have huge tubs . The grounds are not extensive but have fruit trees and well tended areas to sit out in, including for the breakfast service. The surrounding area has leafy streets yet it is close to Pyramid metro and only 4 stops from the central Termini station. A great place to come back to and unwind after tramping the streets of Rome and the excellent Taverna Castia is 5 minutes walk away, just before the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of peace in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: PMwhf
Reviews.Content: This trip is probably the 6th or 7th time we have stayed at the San Pio or one of its sister hotels on the Aventino. It's 100% consistent - peaceful surroundings, good rooms (you should ask for a balcony), helpful staff and great value. Its a 5min taxi ride from the centre (€7) and 30/40 mins if you want to walk, which we do to burn off the pizza. 5 mins walk to the Metro line. They have a good restaurant (closed saturday) and the buffet breakfast is a great start to the day. The reception will sort out taxis etc no problem. Try the patisseria on Via di San Teodoro at the west end of Circo Massimo - great with coffee back at the hotel. If you want the noise and heat of the city 24/7 then this spot isn't for you, but if you like the detachment of staying in a smart quiet residential part of the city then this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimberleykristine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights while in Rome. We were lucky enough to get a room with a balcony which looked over all the orange and lemon trees in the courtyard. Were very impressed with the service, the location and the breakfast. We arrived from the metro and took a taxi (5 minutes) to the hotel. Its a little tricky finding the place and even the taxi driver got a little lost. I think most of the confusion is due to the one way streets and the unoticable entrance to the hotel. You can walk to and from the metro station in about 7-8 minutes. we found the metro to be great as it takes you to all the "hot spots" around Rome. We would definately stay here agin!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty setting, lovely staff, a little faded ...”
Reviews.Author: Farseer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights, arriving by car. Even with the help of SATNAV, it proved tricky - the one-way grid street system was problematical, and the directions on the website included access via a street which has now been blocked off. The area is the Aventine hill - green and leafy, and very quiet and peaceful. However, on arrival the wonderful smiling Agar took our cases, and then dashed off to find a long-term parking bay at a nearby convent for our car, as their car park was full - over and above the call of duty. The hotel is one of three or four, once privately-owned villas, all in the same square mile, and backing onto each other. The area is one huge garden, beautiful shrubs and trees, and well tended. The bar/restaurant area is shaded by greenery, and a delight to sit in with a cold drink. Our room was large, quiet and shaded, but needed a little care and attention. On the first day we managed to flood the shower room because the drain clogged; the bedroom curtains refused to close properly, and the paintwork in both rooms needed attention. In addition, the bed was hard. However, despite this, we still enjoyed the stay, mainly due to the friendliness of the staff, and the excellence of the breakfasts! The hotel also had a (not much advertised) terrace on the top floor, with views of the surrounding area, and we could catch the last rays of sun after a hard day's sightseeing. We didn't eat at the hotel - there is a lot of choice in the immediate surroundings, and we ate very well locally. It is well placed for the Colosseum, the Forum and Palentine Hill, and also two Metro stations, plus the 118 bus which takes you to the catacombs. It was also well placed for a quick(ish) exit from Rome, by car, to Fiumcino airport. All in all, we were pleased with our choice, which was based on previous advice on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe the best value for money"”
Reviews.Author: Johan_1967
Reviews.Content: This is certainly one of the best budget-hotels I stayed in in Rome. The rooms are comfortable and tastefully decorated. The location is wonderful, peaceful and quiet, nothing indicates that you're only a few minutes afway from the city center. The continental breakfast is good, the food is tasteful and there's plenty of it. This hotel delivers everything I expect in this budget, but the real gem is the staff. They're extremely friendly and helpfull, every request is kindly fullfilled (as long as you keep it decent that is). Would I reccomend this hotel? You bet I would. Johan

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_WI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in May 2010. It is in a great location close to the Colloseum and in a very nice, fairly quiet neighborhood. You can walk to all major attractions. The room was pretty big for Europe and ours had a huge terrace. Bathroom was big and updated. Bed was big but a bit hard for my tastes. Breakfast was included and was good-continental type. The staff was helpful and friendly. They have a car that will take you to the airport for Euro 55 which we used as it was an early flight. Taxis from airport to center are fixed price Euro 60 and to airport from center are Euro 40. Taxis to major attractions if you don't want to walk are not too bad from the hotel-E10- E20 I would say. I would stay here again in a second. The neighborhood doesn't have alot of traffic going past it and there are many restaurants within a 10-15 minute walk. The place is a bit pricey but that's Rome and you can't beat the location and cleanliness. If you have your own laptop internet is free but if you use their computer it's Euro 5 per hour which is robbery.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in hectic Rome”
Reviews.Author: WAneedsumsun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 9 days in Italy and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. It was so quiet and peaceful (in contrast to where we stayed in Florence, where we had to wear ear plugs). We had a room with a balcony and a beautiul marble bathroom. (Hair dryer was weak, bring your own if you have long or thick hair!) The breakfast was by far the best, with ample amounts of protein. And a beautiful garden room or patio to eat on. As other reviewers have noted, it is a bit hard to find. We did alot of walking!! Used bus #23 to get to the Vatican but did not have much luck finding the bus back late at night, so walked. Call or email early to get the best deal. We booked in March for the end of April and paid 224 E for the first night, and 165 E for the second night (triple room). The gal at reception said they change their rates weekly, and if they are filling up they charge a higher rate. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimW1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real 'find'. It is in a peaceful location on the Aventino hill, close to the Colosseum and Forum and with stunning views from the hilltop over the Tiber and Vatican. The hotel is a series of magnificent villas interspersed by tranquil gardens. The service was excellent and the restaurant a delight. I stayed during the 'volcanic ash' flight disruption and had to book 2 extra nights after checking out. This was no problem and the hotel was able to rebook me with minimum fuss. If I go back to Rome, this is where I will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: 44cuse
Reviews.Content: You will be fine at the Hotel Villa San Pio and on top of that you will be very happy. We were stuck in the ash cloud scenario leaving Lake Como and were scheduled to be flying through Munich. We made the call to go to Rome and got hooked with this hotel. At 150 Euros, it is not cheap...but nothing in Rome is. If you want cheap...you'll get it because Rome is like NYC and every other major city in the world where it is going to be expensive. What you get for 150 Euros is: 1. VERY good and friendly service. In the midst of this ridiculous ash cloud fiasco (the airlines want to fly and have proven they can and Eurocontrol is trying to do something bizarre), the staff here is dealing with people leaving, coming back, booking and not being able to show up...yet they are still friendly, helpful and informative without being frustrated t all. 2. Location: Wanna walk to the Forum? Check. Wanna walk to the Colosseum? Check. Wanna walk to Trastevere? Check. The Avantine is a GREAT neighborhood and it's quiet and you can get anywhere. Not for everyone, but we also walked to The Vatican, and as far as Piazza Poppolo and the Spanish Steps. Great location. 3. Rooms: Clean. Clean. And Clean. With great beds, and decent space for a European hotel. All in, this is absolutely a place I would recommend and would have no problem sending almost anyone here (don't end your friends that have no issue paying Four Seasons type pricing here. It's not that you can't...you could and most would find the place just fine. But don't expect Rita, Four Seasons at a place like this.) What you are getting is way above the star rating the San Pio has probably received. Awesome breakfast. For Americans this probably big deal. Yep, unbelievably...it's free (like most rates in Europe it includes breakfast) and it's pretty solid. Yogurt, fresh fruit, juices...plenty of water (something that is hard to get in Europe) and the rest of the pastry family. BONUS: If you are a runner, there is a great run from here that takes you through the Avantine and out towards the Forum and up to the Colosseum. Really good 30-60 minute runs from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A three star hotel at four star prices”
Reviews.Author: Number1Dublin
Reviews.Content: This place is about €70 too expensive for the service and accommodation they offer. Yes- the rooms are clean, airy and quiet but the service was fairly non-existent. Our polite request for a cup of tea and a latte one quiet afternoon was met with the kind of reluctant attitude you'd expect if we had made a ridiculous request at a busier time. If the place was cheaper, you wouldn't have much to complain about. The location is good - very central! However, I'd recommend you check out the sister Hotel Sant' Anselmo around the corner. It was booked out when we tried it but looked a lot nicer when we looked in one evening.

Reviews.Title: “It's Gorgeous!!”
Reviews.Author: Allenlee123
Reviews.Content: Bad Things First: For first timer... Please try to find this hotel in daylight... that was my mistake. I took it for granted that it is easy to find as the airport hotel reservation counter confidently advise me it should not be a problem. Bad advice if your walking alone and at night and carrying a heavy backpack. It took me 40 minutes circling the neighborhood to find it. It is also advisable to find food first especially if you're without transport and going to the hotel on a Saturday as the hotel restaurant is close on that day. The GOOD Thing? It's Super gorgeous!!! located in a quite housing area. Very nice neighborhood, Very safe walking alone. AND the room... OMG!! I got a double bed with carvings on the bed rest and paintings on the walls and the cute writing desk that looks classical... I've brought my own laptop so Internet connection in the room is FOC. The staff at the reception counter is an old guy that was waiting for me to arrive. I think i'm the last guest to arrive that day. He saw i look tired, as me if i'm alright and quickly call a second staff who arrived and guide me to the room all in less than 5 minutes. very good service. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: eylander
Reviews.Content: hi to you all! found this nice hotel on the net. booking was good and guys were helpful at the other side of the www. Online booking and email without any troubles. The hotel itself is very nice, room is decorated in italian style. everything is tidy and well prepared for the guest. Peaceful area, not far from the antique center, flowers and trees form a green idyllic atrium. meals can be taken in the atrium or in a wintergarden. all staff very helpful! very recommendable

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Business and Leisure, Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Brussels1108
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel for both business and leisure (I combined the two). It has a good atmosphere, Hotel Staff was very polite, helpful providing a very good service. the hotel was not like the usual hotels that you find in the large hotelchains, it has a romantic individual and unique appearance

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with an excellent restaurant in beautiful og quiet surroundings on the Aventino.”
Reviews.Author: Romaelsker
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much staying here for 6 nights in september 2009. Having very busy days we loved the quiet surroundings and the delicious candle-light dinner in the evenings. Excellent staff. Five-star buffet breakfast. Busses nearby take you "anywhere" in 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel so clean and with such class and beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: chefdulce
Reviews.Content: This is a gem in Rome. Love it. The breakfast is so complete and very fresh. We will not think of staying any where else when we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “copy of our letter to the hotel”
Reviews.Author: 56chevylover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I & 7 friends we were traveling with stayed at the Hotel Villa S. Pio twice in January 2010, 2 days before our cruise & 2 days after. We want to thank all of you for providing us with the most wonderful experience in Rome. We have been raving to our family about our comfortable rooms (we had 3 between the 9 of us), your beautiful garden, your delicious breakfasts, your friendly and so helpful staff, your amazing cappachino, your charming neighborhood. It rained nearly the whole time we were there, and you even provided umbrellas for all of us - we were close enough to the Colosseum to walk! Thank you, thank you for helping make our first trip to Italy such an impressive one. If - when - we return, we would definitely like to stay at the Hotel Villa s. Pio again! J&B, Nebraska USA

Reviews.Title: “Great Chice in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Paulette6000
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Rome several times and without a doubt this is the best hotel choice I have ever made. I booked three rooms after reading the tripadvisor reviews and couldn't be more pleased. Beautiful, clean rooms. Safe, pretty neighborhood. Very good value. The breakfast was excellent and hotel staff very friendly and helpful. I plan on staying here every time I go to Rome in the future. You will not be disappointed. Rome is a very expensive city and this lovely hotel is a great value in great city!

Reviews.Title: “Our home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MASANDARC
Reviews.Content: We've been staying here annually since 2001. It is our favorite hotel in all of Italy, let alone Rome. Beautiful rooms, attentive staff, great breakfast in the outdoor "greenhouse" and all in a walkable, quiet upscale neighborhood. AND, when we stayed here in summer (late August, early September 2009) we paid a few dollars less than we had paid for a beautiful room in 2001! Go for the lower season rates but, whenever you go, it's hard not to be happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Best Continental Breakfast in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: kcbenz34
Reviews.Content: If you're going to be on your feet for 12 hour sightseeing bootcamp days, then you need a restful night and a great breakfast to get you going! While the location is south and out of the way, the atmosphere and service were truly memorable. You can't go wrong staying in this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quiet Hotel, Nice Retreat when busy Sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: johanneskraw
Reviews.Content: Nice air-conditioned hotel! Rooms good, except jacuzzi bath which didnt work, delicious breakfast and even more special when having it in the garden! Lovely area. 5 mins walk to metro! Slightly expensive rates!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Sarducci
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Italy for two weeks to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. We were looking for a really nice hotel in a quiet neighborhood to enjoy the Roman leg of our third trip to Rome since we were married. My family is Italian and my wife loves to cook my favorite food so were very much looking forward to our trip . We used tripadvisor to narrow down the choices and settled on the Aventino Hotels Group part of Grupo Pirolli. We checked on the site for availability for the and found rooms for our time frame and "10% discount" as part a 2009 rate pricing special for all their properties on the Aventine Hill(Villa San Pio, The Aventino, and the Sant’ Anselmo) . We made the reservation at the Villa San Pio by selecting our dates and giving them our credit card information on line. So far so good.... The site confirmed the transaction with "You will receive the confirmation to the email address ______@____ It detailed the dates, price and type of accommodation reserved. It close with “If you do not received the confirmation email within 24 hours please contact us at [--]..... “. I had checked on several other properties and emailed several others that didn't have online reservations. Since I had made reservations at the Villa San Pio I answered back from these other properties when I got responses the next day that I had accommodations already reserved. About a day later I this email from the Aventino Hotels informing me I didn't have a room: ("THIS IS NOT A CONFIRMATION (WE HAVE TO CHECK THE REAL AVAILABILITY) Dear Guest,thanking you in advance for your choice, we are pleased to inform that your request has been correctly registered. You'll be contacted as soon as possible by email, for the final confirmation. Please do not reply to this email account. This is an automatic message. For any other question or information please contact [--] I was surprised and checked with the other hotels I was interested in Rome by phone staying up until 3AM. They were now booked for doubles like we were seeking. I emailed the Aventino Hotels ASAP for clarification and they made it clear I could not get the pricing I had reserved by that I could still get a room at the full price and that they had not made an offer but rather offered me an opportunity to apply for a room at a certain price. I indicated the initial wording indicated I would indeed get a room but that the email confirming it could take as long as 48 hours. There was no doubt in their on line system. After several emails and two days they restated the full price offer and my wife suggested that we check the pricing and availability on their site. Would you believe it they had the same pricing we had been offered and also the showed the rooms to be available at the Villa San Pio for the same time frame. Be ware of this company!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a quiet neighbourhood, not too far from all the city's attractions”
Reviews.Author: Mutley_Oxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Spent two great nights here at the start of our vacation in Italy and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Our room (515) was excellent - elegantly decorated and furnished, and extremely clean throughout. Being a corner room it had plenty of light and also had a small balcony overlooking leafy streets. The en-suite bathroom was beautiful, although the bath with combined shower looked a little tired (our only critisism, and a minor one at that). The hotel grounds whilst small, were very nicely maintained. The restaurant and outside seating area were very pleasant and peaceful, and were a nice place start and end the day. The staff in the restaurant were excellent and very friendly, whilst the staff on the front desk were pleasant and efficient and our booking was well handled. We booked a family room (double bed plus good sofa bed) directly with the hotel and were offered a special price of €216 for two nights (that's total, not per night), which also included an excellent buffet breakfast. Having researched hotels in Rome extensively prior to booking this one, I suspect this is possibly one of the best value hotels in Rome! The hotel is a 5 minute (€7) taxi ride from Roma-Ostia train station. If you're flying to/from Rome Fiumicino (Leanardo da Vinci) airport ,you can easily get a local train from the airport that takes about 25 minutes and costs less than €6 per adult (kids are free). The local trains we used weren't crowded and it was a hassle-free experience. Finally, for sightseeing, the hotel's location is great too. Everything we wanted to see was within walking distance (we like walking!), and there's a Metro station a few minutes away although we never needed to use it.
