From the hotel we managed walk to the Colosseum/Forum (15 mins walk), before heading up to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps(+25 mins), then visiting the Vatican(+25/30 mins), before returning to the hotel via the Trastevere district. Plenty of nice places to eat in Trastevere too (approx 20 mins walk from the hotel). We'd go back to this hotel without hesitation and would thoroughly recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice service - overall very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Moscow2009
Reviews.Content: Location: 15-17 mins walking distance from Circo Massimo metro station or 1 bus stop ride and 5 mins walking (take care about the bus tickets in advance - the driver does not sell them and the kiosk which sells them might be closed). The only "-" is that the road goes uphill, making it difficult to climb it under the hot sun. Hospitality: the staff was friendly and helpful, already at the booking stage. Room: the room was rather small, but cosy, and it was more than enough for one person. Very good cleaning service. Relatively big bathroom - comparing to other hotels. I also enjoyed the breakfast - it was better than I had seen in other italian hotels, and even included fresh fruits. Having the breakfast in a garden was a nice supplement to a tasty food. Overall, I have a very positive impression of the hotel, and would recommend it to those, who'd like to have a nice sleep in a quiet district, but still be close to main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A Luxurious Oasis in Room”
Reviews.Author: Kwazimotosan
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel because I needed a place to park a car. I'll come back for the fabulous rooms and charming (if slightly out of the way) setting. San Pio is located in the middle of the Aventine Hill neighborhood - a leafy, residential area located 15 minutes walk from the Collosuem and just above the trendy Testaccio district. We walked several evenings to Trastavere for dinner. The hotel is made up of three converted town houses and a lovely garden courtyard where a lavish breakfast buffet is served. Our room had a huge balcony overlooking.

Reviews.Title: “Superb and beautiful boutique hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: Pandalad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Aug 2008 with a bunch of friends for a large car club event held outside of Rome. Loved the hotel, quiet residential neighbourhood always felt safe and was very close to various tourist spots including the collosium which was not far as was nearest tube stations! My double single use room was ultra clean and superbly furnished and although small was air conditioned and very pleasant. Other rooms I saw were similar but larger.Beds were comfortable, breakfast was very good and coffee excellent. Staff were, generally courteous helpful andf friendly. The overall ambience wss very pleasant and the lobby particularly nice. We all ate in the hotel one evening, nothing great but small portioned perfectly edible food.Notcheap though... I recommend this as being a nice place to stay and very good value compared to other hotels. I shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, now its resting on its laurels.”
Reviews.Author: UKSanT
Reviews.Content: This was once truly a hidden gem in Rome, but that was years ago. This was our fourth stay and, unless the owners emerge from their complacency, it will be the last because perhaps other hotels simply have a better offering for the price. We had a quadruple family room. Everything was OK apart from unsightly marks on one of the walls, mould growing around the aircon vent, water ingress during a storm (admittedly it was one hell of a storm!) and the tiniest tv I've ever seen (seen but not heard as the speakers were shot). I've always thought that the front desk staff really could do with smiling just a little bit more, too! I would now only recommend Villa San Pio if the price is a lot more modest than the rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Really Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Georgeous12
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Villa San Pio was not what I expected, especially for the prices the hotel charges. The hotel has a lot of potential but I found it to be a little dirty and worn and everyone needs to be aware of its location before they book it. My room was on the top floor, it was very spacious and it had a wonderful balcony with a gorgeous view. We spent a lot of time on that lovely balcony because our room reeked of sewage!! We had to keep the bathroom door shut as much as possible otherwise the stench was unbearable, however, trapping the smell in the bathroom made showering a terrible experience. I usually look for boutique hotels with a little character, but this one was just plain run down. The bed/bedding seemed to be ancient and the tv was ridiculously small, maybe 13 inches? Definitely did not look like the pictures on the website. I didn't really like the location of this hotel either. It wasn't really close to anything and walking to any points of interest really is an arduous task. I thought it would be a little off the beaten path but it felt more like staying in the 'burbs. Another problem that made me crazy was trying to take taxis back to the hotel. Previously we stayed at a hotel near Piazza Barberini and it was much easier to tell the cab to drop us off at the landmark, but there are no landmarks anywhere near the hotel and most of the cab drivers had never heard of it, so just getting back became an ordeal. However, they do offer a fabulous breakfast; do take advantage of that if staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: nakedman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on recommendation of friend. We loved it. Quiet neighbourhood, great restaurants closeby (don't eat at hotel - not worth it). Find the keyhole, the oramge grove park, and head down into town.

Reviews.Title: “Even better second time around”
Reviews.Author: seabreezeIreland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Villa San Pio for 3 nights in May 2006 and loved it so much we returned in May 2007. We enjoyed it more the second time as the first time the weather was a bit overcast and not warm enought to eat in the garden thought the conservatory is very pleasant. Breakfast in the garden was a lovely experience. There is a buffett breakfast and the waiter brought our tea or coffee to the table, whatever type of coffee you wanted. We requested a room with a balcony on our second visit and it was lovely sitting out on the balcony unwinding after a busy day walking around Rome. The hotel was within walking distance of the sites of ancient Rome and we got a taxi to the Vatican city on our second visit as we had prebooked a tour and needed to be there at 9.30 a.m. The previous year we caught the open top bus at the Circus Maximus and got on and off at the Vatican. We found the staff to be helpful and pleasant and would love to return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good on our second visit”
Reviews.Author: lawd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and loved the hotel for its location and beautiful, peaceful gardens. This year we returned with some friends - always a risky thing to do, but we were not disappointed. Our friends loved it as much as we did. It's such a relief to come back to such peace and greenery after the chaos of the city centre. Again, despite being in our mid-sixties we did not find the walk to the main sights any problem at all. In any case it's easy to get a bus if you feel like a rest. The staff were very pleasant and helpful at all times. Re the previous review - yes, the mattresses are very firm, but it wasn't a problem. There was nothing wrong with the pillows at all. I would have no qualms at all about the cleanliness of the bedding! As regards cosiness - there are very heavy curtains and a bedspread if it's needed. The floors are just wood with no rug. In the winter this might be a slight disadvantage, but then I imagine you'd have the central heating on. Certainly when we were there the weather was gloriously warm and there was no lack of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “did not love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanelizabeth4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 days in Rome and Florence and stayed in three hotels total. The Villa San Pio was our first hotel and we were there for three nights. I feel like it has been over-rated on Trip Advisor. Granted, it is in a beautiful building, the grounds are peaceful, the breakfast/bar area is inviting and the food very good; however, the staff is courteous but indifferent and distant; the room we had was very large but not cozy or welcoming - the bed was hard as a rock, the blankets/bedspread were not covered for each guest so you weren't sure how clean they were, and the pillows were very uncomfortable. The marble bathroom was beautiful though! The area was nice and the distance was not a problem - we walked everywhere, but if you don't want to walk extra distance this may not be your cup of tea. Just think for the price it was very overrated.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterHelsbells2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 2 night stay in Rome and stayed at this lovely hotel following recommendations in Trip Advisor. We left the children with their auntie and had a romantic weekend away for our anniversary. Firstly, the hotel staff were all helpful and couteous. They even provided us with a bottle of champage on our arrival for our anniversary! Our room (which was on the 4th floor) was very elegant and had a balcony with a table and two chairs - where we drank our champagne and listened the the evening church bells. We managed to see Rome in just over 2 days - time we will never forget. Everyone must go to Rome in the life!! But, so lovely to come back to our peaceful, charming hotel. As people have previously said, It is so close to the Colleseum and then there are several buses close by to get you into the centre of Rome. We ate at the hotel on Saturday night and the food is absolutely wonderful!!! We just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Villa San Pio, a 5 Star B & B”
Reviews.Author: hmspcl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this charming hotel located in Aventina, one of the 7 hills in Rome last August 21-25, 2008. Accomodations are decent and average, not a 5 star luxury hotel more like a 5 star B&B. On the plus, this hotel provides a wonderful breakfast spread & complete bathroom amenities, including robes & slippers. The staff is warm, friendly and eager to please! Tip: If you want peace & quiet, this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: afds
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, clean and welcoming hotel in a peaceful and safe area. We chose it because of its proximity to the Caracalla Baths because we were going to a performance there, but would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome who wants to stay away from the noise and bustle of the city while being within reach of major sites. The restaurant is excellent, really good food and very quick service when we told the maitre d'hotel that we were in a hurry because we had to go to the ballet. Just make sure you book the parking space (if you have a car) in advance because it fills up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis in Rome”
Reviews.Author: aerolosangeles
Reviews.Content: The Villa San Pio is an oasis in Rome. Tucked away in the Aventine Hill neighborhood, it is a five minute walk to the Palatine through a pleasant residential neighborhood. We wanted tranquility and accessibility, and this was an excellent choice. The room was large and gorgeous, the bed extremely comfortable. If you want to be in the thick of things, stay at the Sofitel, but if you want quiet, comfort and relaxed elegance, Villa San Pio is perfect. The restaurant serves delicious food, service is charming, and it is walking distance to many good (and very local) dining spots, as well as the subways and bus stop. The only downside would be that there are no amazing views, and the 'jacuzzi' tub wasn't very functional, but overall really terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Refuge in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cynthcore
Reviews.Content: We called the hotel the day we wanted to arrive there in June. The rooms were greatly discounted (90 Euros for a double), so we booked two rooms for our family. Service was impeccable. Breakfast was outstanding - fresh juices, meats, cheeses, pastries. This is our fourth stay in 3 years. I really won't stay anywhere else in Rome. Even when rooms aren't discounted, this is the best place to be. Proximity to Centro Storico sites is more convenient than many hotels on Via Nazionale. High points are service, aesthetics, cleanliness, the greenery on the property, and the proximity to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Located in a residential area called the Aventine, might not be the best choice if you don't have a car. Other than that, it's still one of the best choices in Rome, where hotels of much lower quality can be fairly expensive. Very calm, reasonably priced (the average room rate is around 150 euros), with nicely decorated rooms and elegant common areas, it's an excellent choice for families and tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Pick this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: tahudantempe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel though booking.com. We paid 150 euros per night, breakfasts included. Our room was spacious, clean, marble bathroom has jacuzzi ! The hotel is romantic with garden and nice smelling jasmine flowers. Breakfasts are great with various choices and good cappucino! Staffs are courteous too. The hotel is located in a residential neighbourhood called Aventine Hills, so it was quiet ,a good break from chaotic and dusty Rome. The Circus Maximus station is 7-10 minutes walk from the hotel. While you walk to the station, don;t forget to stop by the orange garden which has a great view of Rome from the hill , and the lovely rose garden ! If you're planning to take one of the hop and off tourist buss, there's a station just across the Rose Garden. Otherwise, we reccomend buying the Roma Pass. It gives free access to 2 first museums or attractions you visit , and discounts for the next. It also gives you 3-day pass for Rome public transports. The pass costs 20 Euros. We got in the Colosseum ( 11 euros ticket) and Villa Borghese ( 14 euros!) , so the Roma Pass is totally worthy. Especially in Rome , when the metro is not so helpful in getting you to the destination, oftentime , you have to take the metro and the buss to get to a place. A metro ticket costs 1 euro per trip. To get to the hotel from the airport, we prefer taking the shuttle bus for 15 euros per person. The bus takes you to the hotel door ,saving you the uphill experience. The leonardo da vinci train to roma termini costs 11 euros , and from there you have to take a metro to either piramide or circus maximus station. If you buy the Roma Pass , save yourself from walking to the station by taking the public buss . There's one station just down the hill , and almost all numbers (no 75 including) will bring you closer to piramide station. That can save your energy in hot Rome. To go home, do the opposite. For a good dinner, go to Trasvetere , it's a neighborhood close by the hotel, just across the river. There's a direct buss to go there (ask the hotel). Many restaurants there serve good food at good prices ,compares to other touristy areas. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. After a long day walking and touring Rome , it's always a joy to come home to a good-looking hotel with great room and jacuzzi :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: UK352
Reviews.Content: It's been a while since we stayed there but we still talk about how much we loved it. Rome is incredibly chaotic and loud, and this hotel is located in a lovely, quiet residential location with a beautiful garden. The room was very comfortable and nicely decorated, the bathroom was really spacious and nice too. Breakfast was generous, varied, and tasty. In fact, we filled up each morning and skipped lunch. Since the hotel wasn't exactly in the center of the hustle and bustle, we ate there almost every night because we didn't feel like dealing with taxis. The restaurant is quite good and the chocolate orange tower dessert was amazing. No problems with the staff. The only thing that is inexplicably bad is the size of the elevator. Hardly a big deal but slightly annoying when everything else is perfect and you're struggling to get all your luggage in. Overall a fantastic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peace & quiet!”
Reviews.Author: Carpediem1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 4 nights from TripAdvisor reccomendations and were thoroughly delighted with it. Having such a peaceful location made such a difference to our stay. Central Rome is pretty much just mayhem all the time and incredibly noisy, so having somewhere within walking distance to retreat to at night was brilliant. The room was lovely, nicely decorated with a great spacious balcony, we sat out for a little while each night and also dried clothes out there overnight which had got soaked in the rain storms! Our bathroom again was really nice, great big overhead shower and everything in marble. We didnt have a jacuzzi bath but the balcony was worth missing out for. The restaurant was small but cosy. We didnt get chance to sit outside but that wasnt really a problem. Food was nice and probably cheaper for the level of service and food than you would be in a restaurant bang in the city centre. Service was ok, nothing spectacular and a little dissapointing on check in. The guy checking us in spent half his time on the phone and half his time with us - a little annoying and he gave no information about mealtimes or anything like that. As the room had no information we had to guess at meal times and where things were. We got by but as I said, a little annoying. Overall though I'd thoroughly reccomend it for the sheer tranquility of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect garden area!”
Reviews.Author: MarkNewham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel for the run up to our wedding in Rome with Wed-In-Rome. We wanted somewhere where all our parents could stay in the same hotel as us with lots of outdoor seating / eating and a little quieter than the majority of Rome hotels - This hotel could not be more perfect for this. It is in a lovely quiet suburban area of Rome , just 5 mins walk to Circo Massimo so not too far out but away from the traffic and noise and with space to allow for a fabulous garden area. Our whole family loved the hotel, breakfast and drinks are all served in the garden and the setting is both beautiful and relaxed. Not typical of Rome hotels in that respect but ideal for those that want to get a good night's sleep and be able to relax in comfortable surroundings. Our room had a small balcony, altho very little view it was good to sit out in the sun. The room was well sized and had a nice bathroom altho a couple of the other rooms had better bathrooms as it appeared they had been renovated ahead of ours. No complaints tho - Internet access is paid for on the front desk - about 10e for 24h and is then available in the room. Staff were all very friendly - one of the front desk ladies (red haired woman!) was a bit more abrupt than the rest but nothing too bad - we would highly recommend this hotel when visiting Rome as on previous visits the size of the room and the noise at night was a little off-putting. The garden here is the real bonus tho - its like a little haven away from the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Burns08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa San Pio for the first three nights of our honeymoon in Italy and also the last night before we headed back to the US. We has a beautiful room with a large wrap-around balconey. The staff was pleasant and the breakfast decent. This hotel is located very close to the Metro station making it accessible from Termini and also very close to the Forum and "old Rome". We loved walking through the neighborhood of the Aventine and had no problem maneuvering through the entire city on foot from the hotel. Highly recommend the Villa San Pio to all couples.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in Quiet, Lovely Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler08
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel set a kilometer or two back from the touristy area surrounding the Collisseum and Roman Forum. Attractions are still available via the Pyramida metro stop, located within a reasonable walking distance from the hotel. Staff is sufficiently helpful, and the bathrooms are large and luxurious by European standards. Unfortunately, the jacuzzi feature in our bathtub didn't function, but it did not deter from the other appealing features.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: twinklesplodge
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night stay here with my sister in September 2007. We had originally booked another hotel but due to having to change our dates we rebooked and booked Villa San Pio. What a great decision. The staff were all very pleasant at the front desk and were happy to call taxis , recommend local restaurants etc. Some of the local restaurants we tried were excellent if I can remember some names I will add to the post. The hotel has a lovely garden and reception area all italian style with lavish marble and a lovely walkway through to the restaurant area The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the colleseum and based in the Aventine Hill area. We used the green hop/on off bus to get to most of our other destinations and didn't use the subway so the location was just perfect for us. Our room was on the first floor with a large balcony, we were over the reception area it was decorated in traditional Italian style( I think?) . When booking the room I asked for a room with a balcony I was told this would be 50 euro per night extra, so we decided to take the room without the balcony. On arriving we had actually been assigned a room with a balcony for no extra charge so was delighted we had not offered to pay the extra! Room was spotless and balcony area was lovely. Only gripe was the tiny bathroom and lack of tea/coffee facilities. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious both mornings with a good variety, sitting in the conservatory area with the sun shining in was a pleasure. The hotel was very busy for dinners and the menu looked lovely although we declined to eat there TIP: Use the metered taxis to get to the airport not the hotel "taxi" as they will charge more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quiet Hotel on Aventine Hill, Jan. 31-Feb 3, 2008”
Reviews.Author: Reets7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent three nights in this charming small hotel. When checking in we were asked if we minded being on the ground level. We were shown a room in a lush garden with our own little patio and wrought iron table. The room had a comfortable canopy bed, stenciled wall paintings and an arched brick ceiling. Very charming! Shower, toilet was fine and all was very clean. There is a lovely glass conservatory where the large, fresh breakfast buffet is served and this is also a restaurant in the evening. There is a fixed price menu of Euro 20 PP as well as other a la carte menu choices. We found the staff extremely helpful and efficient. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Via Marmolata, an area with restaurants, bars and shops. Another 10 minutes walking takes one over the bridge to the Testevere neighborhood. The Metro station Piramide is also 10 minutes walk and we walked back from the Colosseum area in about 20 minutes. I booked this hotel through this website for 89 euros a night through hotel.com in the "Check Rates" dropdown menu. It was the off season though.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jayarthur
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel is tucked away in a quiet up-scale residential area on the Aventine Hill, just a short walk from two metro stations, the ancient Roman Forum and many other sights. It's about 2 miles from the Vatican. (The hotel is on a hill so you need to be able to comfortably walk at least 2-3 miles a day up and down hills!) It is also within easy walking distance of over a dozen restaurants and some decent shopping. The hotel provides a handy list of nearby restaurants and their locations on a map of the area. The staff, with few exceptions, were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was served in a charming on-site restaurant, and had plentiful fruits and assorted other breakfast foods. You can settle in and really feel at home; the location for archeology lovers couldn't be better!

Reviews.Title: “A taste of real Rome! Close to everything in a great neighborhood!!!”
Reviews.Author: Racecar666
Reviews.Content: Located on the historic Aventine Hill, this beautiful hotel sits right in the middle of a beautiful upscale neighborhood in "Real Rome". Far enough from the touristy areas to feel comfortable, but still close enough to see the sights with a short walk or ride on the metro. We stayed here over the christmas holiday with family and loved every part of our trip. Rome is a fantastic city and the Villa San Pio is a great place to call home while visiting. P.S. The breakfast and staff are great and really make it hard to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back - an incredible value! Beautiful location...”
Reviews.Author: Shannon2007
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Italian vacation a few days ago. We spent three days in Rome at this hotel. We booked directly through the hotel based on the reviews from tripadvisor and we are so glad we did. We obviously stayed in the off season and were able to book a quadruple room for only 180 euros a night. The room was spacious and luxurious. I can see how some would say the beds were a bit hard, but we like a firm mattress and were very pleased. The hotel staff was helpful, especially the service in the restaurant. We were able to have cocktails or coffee and any hour, even when the "restaurant" was closed. The answer to our every question was always "YES". Just a wonderful staff. Our room was always clean and well provided for. The location was perfect! A 15 minute walk to the Colusseum, The Roman Forum and the Arch of Constantine. The hotel recommends several restaurants in the nearby area, which were very excellent. Definitely go by their choices, as some of the other places are touristy and the quality is not there. I read complaints about the long walk up the hill. It is definitely hard after a long day of sightseeing. We are a "fit" family with two teen-agers and they were even moaning a bit. Don't let that stop you - grab a cab if you need one. We did not and we were just fine. The neighborhood is a beautiful, upscale, residential neighborhood. It is lovely to walk around here. Let this hotel be your first choice in Rome. I will always come back to it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good selection”
Reviews.Author: marioOttawa
Reviews.Content: Web site is accurate Breakfast above average Room spacious and comfy Well located competitive price Would return anytime

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful hotel away from the traffic”
Reviews.Author: tigerbo7
Reviews.Content: a great location and wonderful hotel. We had a wonderful view of Rome and the garden and restuarant was great also. Although the rooms were small...the quietness at night was well worth it. This hotel is in a residential area and it a little bit of a walk into Rome but it is no problem for healthy tourists and it is nicely out of the mainstream of tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Scammed on canceled reservation”
Reviews.Author: Klondikemike1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in the past and have recommended it to several friends who have also had good experiences. On our recent trip to Italy I booked three rooms at $330 per night each. When this turned out to be a budget buster for some of our group the reservation was canceled within days by email two months before our arrival in Rome. It was with great surprise that a charge for nearly $1000 was submitted to my credit card by the hotel for a "no-show". Since I clean out my emails and sent items monthly I did not have documentation of the sent email to the hotel. When contacted directly the hotel tone had changed to unfriendly and blunt that there was no way that they were going to rescind the charge or any offer of compromise. It is interesting to note that every other hotel we booked in Italy sent confirmatory emails right before our arrival, the San Pio did not. As further warning our credit card company states they will contact a merchant to mediate a dispute in the US only and politely declined to help. I should probably feel fortunate that in decades of frequent travel I have never had a problem with a hotel, but be warned to save all documentation when dealing with these folks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place!”
Reviews.Author: bezalel1
Reviews.Content: Villa San Pio was wonderful! It couldn't have been better. We started our trip in Rome, and it was one of our favorite hotels. Ask for a room with a balcony, and a room in the main house. The breakfasts are great, and the restaurant was wonderful (we are vegetarians, and they had many options for us). The staff was friendly and corteous, and the location couldn't have been better. Far enough from the center that we got some privacy, but still an easy 10 minute walk to get to the sites. Thanks for a great start to our wonderful honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Colby21
Reviews.Content: Up-scale hotel. More than my wife and I were used to spending compared to our stays in Venice and Florence. But the hotel was worth it. Hotel is located up a sizable hill. Nice tree lined, quiet neighborhood. Feels like you're in the better suburbs outside Philadelphia. The hotel is built as hotel and not a converted mansion or b&b. Missed the personal touch of owner/managers like in b&b's. But employees were efficient and friendly. After checking in at the lobby, went to our room. It was a short walk through a pleasant garden, lined with trees, to another building. Up a modern elevator to our room. Room was sizable, clean and modern. Bathroom same with a nice shower/bath combo. Bed was large and comfortable. Had a small refrigerator (charge for stored items). Didn't have my laptop so I couldn't check for internet service. The hotel has computer stations where you can get on the internet (at a charge). Got a local map at the desk (a must have). A number of restaurants recommended on back of the map. Needed directions to get to attractions. Hotel is close to the antiquities, a bus ride away from the Vatican and a taxi ride away from the Borghese. Nearby Piazza provided local entertainment in the evening. Excellent breakfast at the hotel. Buffet style except for coffee and tea which is served by efficient waiters. We dined al fresco in a garden setting. Good experience. . All in all, the hotel promised to be up-scale, clean, modern and quiet. It delivered. If you can afford the cost, well recommended. It is not in the center of museum areas but Rome is a big city and maybe no hotel is. The trade off is you get a quiet pleasant neighborhood with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rag714
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome where we enjoyed a five-night stay at the Hotel Villa San Pio. It was a lovely hotel and provided just what we wanted after a day of sightseeing: a quiet location, comfortable accommodations and a friendly staff. The rooms are clean and relatively large (we were in room 528 which is on a back corner and has a nice balcony), the restaurant is perfectly acceptable, and views out over an upscale residential neighborhood are quite nice. The only cautions I would have are that the beds are extremely firm and you must be prepared to either walk fifteen minutes of so to reach the closest major sites or take the metro or a taxi. We walked everywhere including to the Vatican and to the Borghese Gallery which are the major attractions that are the farthest away. When we return to Rome, we will certainly be staying at the Villa San Pio again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: Aeschi96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Villa San Pio and had a wonderful time. I'll start out by saying that peace and quiet are high on our list of important things to look for in a hotel and this is not easy to find in Rome, but the Aventine Hill is primarily residential so it's not noisy at all. Having said that, this place is not for you if you want to be in the middle of the night life or if you don't want to walk the 20 minutes to the Colosseum or the 15 minutes to the Pyramid metro stop. Even though we're in our late 50s, we didn't mind the walk; it's the price you pay for the quiet. We had a very nice, comfortable room and if you'd like to see it you can do so on the following web site: [----------------] Here you can find a picture of the lovely breakfast room as well. I've read one or two bad reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor and I'll just say that you can have a bad experience anywhere, but I do know that my wife and I will never stay anywhere else when we next visit Rome and that's the highest compliment I can pay the place.

Reviews.Title: “best holiday so far!!”
Reviews.Author: ROME_antics
Reviews.Content: having arrived at Ciampino airport, we took the direct coach transfer to Termini station in the centre of Rome, where we were able to take the metro line B to Circus Maximus. From here the hotel was easy to find (although my boyfriend had his sat nav in his suitcase!!), and upon entering the hotel we were pleasantly surprised and refreshed by the much welcomed air conditioning in the lobby. the staff were friendly and helped us to our room with our luggage. the room was clean, with good air conditioning and a wonderful view from our balcony. breakfasts were extremely enjoyable with plenty to choose from and set in the beautiful hotel gardens. location was fantastic as hotel san pio is situated in a quiet residential area which, however, never left you isolated from the rest of the city as the metro station was a 5 minute walk away! wonderful staff, wonderful hotel, wonderful location!! would recommend it to anyone looking for a ROMEantic break well worth the money!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tranquil hotel”
Reviews.Author: Millyam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and thought that it was beautiful. We really liked being slightly away from all the hustle and bustle of the centre of Rome and found the residential area very attractive and peaceful. We estimated it was about 15 minutes walk from the Colosseum and managed to walk everywhere else - Spanish Steps, Fontana di Trevi, Vatican etc without any trouble. The hotel is also near to the foodie Testaccio area - we loved looking at all the delicatessens, wine and pastry shops. Back to the hotel itself - our room was of ample size and attractively decorated. The bathroom was marble and spotless. We loved the breakfast which kept us going well into the afternoon. The staff were on the whole friendly - particularly the waiters/barmen. I would certainly recommend this hotel - especially for those who prefer a 'haven' to return to at the end of a day's sightseeing. Regarding getting there - we flew into Fiumincino airport, took the train into Termini and then the B metro line to Circo Massimo then a short walk to the hotel- much cheaper than booking a transfer - although we did only have hand luggage which made things easier.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: cecerose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa San Pio with our one year old daughter based on the reviews here, but I must say that I was disappointed in most aspects of the place. Our greeting was unfriendly if not rude, the reception room stank of smoke every time I went in there, the dinner was overpriced and not tasty, and breakfast was average. Distance-wise, it truly did feel like quite a hike to get off of the Aventine hill for us with the stroller. 20 min to the Colliseum was the estimate for us. Worst of all, the room was tiny. It felt like a cubicle with no wiggle room whatsoever. We spent a couple of uncomfortable nights with the baby there. The bathroom tub smelled of mold. I would label it under pretentious with not much substance underneath.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in the air”
Reviews.Author: Bibawi
Reviews.Content: We have been in Rome for the last 3 days in our honeymoon! The hotel is in a peaceful district in Rome yet not very far from Rome attractions and the action. The staff are smiling, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are elegant, big in size and the bathroom had a jacuzzi. Breakfast is excellent in a fabulous garden with nice plants and statues. Dinner is so romantic in this garden. Food is very tasty and not expensive. Villa San Pio is the place to be while in Rome! Will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: music015
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my daughter in a twin room at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is situated in a pretty street, very quiet and with a very nice entrance with doorman. The lobby is very attractive. Unfortunately our good vibes were short lived as we were met with a very frosty reception. After being hurried through the checking in process by two people one of whom couldnt even be bothered making eye contact with us, and forget about a smile or greeting, we felt we were not off to the best start. The room was not as nice as I had hoped from the reviews I had previously read. It was smaller than expected and needed maintenance. A brass floor strip buckled at one end and quite dangerous had been left loose on the floor between the bathroom and bedroom, and the room looked as if it could do with a bit of a freshen up. The balcony, however, was lovely. The best feature of the hotel is a very pretty garden area. We found the hotel too far from the major attractions. Older people or those not wanting to walk perhaps 20 minutes in the heat may prefer to stay somewhere closer. Certainly this hotel is too far away from any but the ancient sites (e.g. Forum) and requires transport to get to the main area of the city such as the Spanish Steps. Breakfast was average, but dinner one night was of good quality and price. Overall, we were left with a somewhat disappointed feeling. Perhaps we expected more from reading previous reviews, but I did realise on looking at signs near the hotel that it is only a 3 star, and for that rating, it is quite a nice hotel. At E 240 a night, however, I would probably go elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Charming w/ Old Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Villa San Pio (hereinafter referred to HVSP) for two nights during the second week of September. After an extensive online search for our hotel accomodations in Rome, we settled on HVSP because of it's high TA rating, as well as a great deal (130 euros/night) on venere.com. We typically prefer to stay at boutique hotels with modern/contemporary furnishings, but thought we'd give HVSP a try for the two aforementioned reasons. We arrived at Roma Termini from Florence around 1pm in the afternoon. We took the B line to Circo Massimo, crossed the street, and purchased a map from the magazine stand on Aventino. We ended taking an out-of-the-way route, but got to see the U.S. Consulate (as well as a few other foreign consulates) and the beautiful upscale residences, which reminded us of the homes in Beverly Hills and Larchmont Village in Los Angeles. Check-in at HVSP was quick and simple. We were escorted to our room by Agapito, an immigrant from the Philippines, who confirmed that Rome boasted a huge Pilipino population, something we'd noticed by the sheer amount of spoken Tagalog heard at Roma Termini. Our room was smaller than we expected and was, in fact, the smallest room on our trip (we stayed at five hotels in Italy) and the smallest room we've ever had in Europe. We did have a small terrace, which we never had the opportunity to enjoy because we didn't have the time and because I had already suffered numerous mosquito bites in Venice and Florence that gave me no desire to keep our terrace doors open. The bedroom decor lived up to the photographs featured online. I wonder now whether the size of our room was in direct relation to our "great deal" from venere.com. The bathroom featured a reasonably-sized shower. We thought that the towels on the rack directly adjacent to the toilet was a potential sanitary disaster. The stopper in the sink had to be manually inserted if you wished to use it. Amenities were a bit lacking as we had shampoo, shower gel, and lotion, but no conditioner or hotel slippers. We never had the opportunity to fully enjoy the included buffet breakfast as the first morning, we had an early tour pick-up, and on the second, an early train out of Roma Termini. However, we managed to grab croissants the first morning, and saw the delicious spread of standard breakfast fare. We did have dinner at the hotel restaurant on our first night. The ambience in the dining room was set by the glass walls looking out into the garden patio, as well as the beautiful glass chandelier hanging in the center. We were given complimentary glasses of champagne (or prosecco), as well as a plate of croquettes and bruschetta. I ordered a seafood risotto, which was amazing, but something I could have at eaten at home from Macaroni Grill. Previous guests have made note of chilly encounters with various members of the front desk staff, but we did not have that experience. All staff were professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in Rome”
Reviews.Author: traveltimetoo
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Villa San Pio, an incredible slice of pampered tranquility in busy Rome! This is a wonderful hotel for those desiring peace and quiet at the end of the day. The option of an excellent garden dining venue enhances the facilities. Although a bit remotely located, it serves travelers well. We stayed in late August while it was quite warm and opted to use cabs to central areas for sightseeing, which worked well and was not that expensive. Cabs appear in 2 minutes! It was relaxing to return to our lovely room, beautiful surroundings, and a refreshment in the garden. The desk personnel is quite helpful and the restaurant staff charming. Breakfast is a welcoming feast. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! By the way..do NOT miss the walk to the churches, park, and the 'keyhole' view of St. Peter's a few blocks up from the hotel. (Go left out of the hotel, take the first street left straight up to the top of the hill. Incredible views and sights!) . Also, if you take a right out of the hotel down to the main big street...go across the street to the fresh market in Testaccio. Amazing stuff! Villa San Pio is a delightful rare find in busy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: AyrshireSandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my husband after a weeks cruise and would definately stay again. I picked this hotel purely because of the rating on tripadvisor and was not disappointed. A lovely american/italian woman who we asked for directions at the Circo Massimo station told us we would probably not find the hotel but she knew where it was and most kindly gave us a lift. We were so greatful. A wee tip......get a taxi, in fact, never mind messing about with buses and trains etc, when you arrive at the airport, for about 30-40 euros you can get a taxi direct to your hotel. Any other way is a nightmare and if there are two of you it will cost about 20 euros anyway. We ate in the restaurant both nights and the meals were wonderful. The only thing I would say is that the photos do the hotel a lot of justice. Its a bit tired and could do with a lick of paint but apart from this, it was absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: motiv8matt
Reviews.Content: We loved the Villa San Pio so much we came back to stay there on the second half of our trip to Italy. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were beautiful and very spacious. Our bathroom even had a tub with a jacuzzi! It was within walking distance to the Colosseum. It was a bit farther from the spanish steps, but that made it even better. It was like staying outside of the busy area, but still being able to enjoy the sites. The breakfast was amazing. They had fresh fruits, breads, and many other items. We ate on the patio every morning. The rooms near the street can be a little noisy during the day (we had one the first time there), so we recommend asking for one not on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellows
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa San Pio is a beautiful hotel in a quiet residential area located about 15 minutes walk from the Coliseum. It has a lovely garden and breakfast in the conservatory is a great start to the day. The hotel is very quiet and provides everything you need as you will not spend any time in your room when in Rome, the air conditioning was very good as outside it was reaching 40C, the room was the smallest of our trip in Italy and some might find it too small but it was ok for us. If you are only in Rome for one night then I would stay in a more central location as when returning by foot at night I found the hotel a bit remote. As we stayed for 3 nights it was great to be busy all day and then return to a quiet hotel for a good nights sleep. The only problem we had was when we checked in the receptionist tried to move us to another hotel (an upgrade) but after we refused they found a room, also I think overall the reception desk were less than welcoming when compared to other hotels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oktane
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two nights in the early September. The hotel is located in a quiet, very nice residential area. It's not very close to all the major sites but definitely walking distance to some (perhaps a 15-20 minute walk). The staff was definitely helpful. The breakfast buffet was quite good. The rooms, however, are in need of an upgrade. The bed was very uncomfortable, the pillows and blankets flimsy and all the furniture just old and more dumpy than old-fashioned. Overall, however, not a bad place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: anywhereeverywhere
Reviews.Content: Great location - only five minutes walk from the Metro and then just one stop ride to Colleseum area. Very peaceful, garden-like setting. Staff polite and helpful. Good breakfast in delightful setting. Only drawback was that we had to complain twice to get the non-functioning air-conditioner to work. When it was first looked at we were told (incorrectly) it must be on a timer and would come on soon. It did not. When we complained again in the evening we were told it would have to wait until the next day when a technician could look at the conditioner. While waiting to make the second complaint there was another gentleman complaining about the air-conditioner not working in his room. The problem was fixed the next day. I'm assuming alll of ther air-conditioners are equally old and need replacement. When/if this occurs I would not hesitate in rating this establishment five-stars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: virden61
Reviews.Content: We loved the Villa San Pio. Our room was large and very clean, and we had a large bathroom with both shower and bath. The staff was GREAT and booked all of our tours. The only down side was having to walk back up Aventine Hill everyday after sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “2nd worst hotel experience of my travelling life”
Reviews.Author: Dedun69
Reviews.Content: From Sicily we went off to ancient Rome and got there pretty late. We had had some mix up with our booking by the booking site, but we had been assured that everything was fine and we should come on over. Getting there at about 1 a.m we got the keys to our room and the site that awaited was one of the worst of my life. The rooms had mosquitoes, the toilet was terribly stained and the floors had not been cleaned since only God knows when. The table in the room was unstable and I thought it was going to fall over my son. My son was traumatized. When we asked for a different room, I was told they were full and that we should be grateful that they were able to provide us with a room at all. I told the guy that he should have told us from Sicily that they had given away our room, and we would have understood. We did not have a choice but to pass the night as it as very late and we did not have a clue aboutour bearings or if there were any other hotels around. In the morning we asked for the manager, but the manager was on vacation. The front desk lady apologised and gave us 25Euros off our room rate, but our visit to Rome was ruined. She went on to explain that the room is their emergency room, which I told her that I understood, but they could have at least swept and mopped the floor. It was totally filthy.The night clerk 's attitude was terrible, and I believe that was what made it worse for me. For the fact that I ended up paying over $140, made me once again say, God bless America. It was based on the reviews at tripadvisor that I booked this hotel and it was a disaster. I have pictures to prove how nighmarish this hotel was. We did not sleep a wink all night.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Villa S.Pio”
Reviews.Author: KenKLM
Reviews.Content: The tranquility of this hotel more than compensates the 15/20 minute walk to the Colosseum / Forum from which you can easily move on to other major attractions . There are several bus services at the bottom of the hill (5 minutes easy walk ) to all of the major sites including the Vatican on bus 23 . You need to get tickets for the buses - they do not allow you to pay as you board . These can be bought quite easily and we now wish we had just gone for the 3 day ticket so we could use the buses as and when. Taxis are not expensive - about 5 euros to the Colosseum and 10 euros to Spanish Steps & Vatican areas . The room was perfection ; windows and shutters allowed us to filter sunlight into the room and get a breeze . Bed was enormous . Breakfast is more than adequate but do not expect bacon and eggs . We had dinner the one night which was good and again not too expensive at 57 euros for starter / good quality main and drinks . If you are going to the Vatican you must wear appropriate clothing and ladies must cover their shoulders / etc. Be warned you will be turned away and this will be after you have queued and clear the first security checks ! The hotel is quite convenient for Santa Maria in Trastavere which is a must for those who appreciate old churches and elaborate decor . Trastevere area itself is not worth spending much time as it is covered in graffiti and litter but around the church is fine. Have a great time - we did .

Reviews.Title: “tranquility in the city of rome”
Reviews.Author: p_oGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with children aged 13 and 10. This hotel was excellent value for money. We had a quadrupple room and breakfast for a total of €129 per night .It was away from the heart of the city but within a reasonable walking distance to the Colleseum and other ancient sites. The row of shops at the bottom of the hill had a super gelateria [ ice cream shop ] , pizzeria and bars.We found this area to offer much better value for money than the centre. The hotel was spotless, breakfast delicious and plentiful and the staff were efficient and friendly. We will definitely return to Villa San Pio.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BermudaFossie
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. The only thing that kept me from giving the Villa San Pio a higher rating was the firmness of the beds...they are really hard! Otherwise this hotel is really a gem; an oasis after a hard day of sightseeing. Beautifully appointed rooms (ours had a balcony with table and chairs) lovely gardens and a great breakfast to start your day. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven ...”
Reviews.Author: Iona007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on a very wet Whitsun week - without this hotel the visit to Rome may have been a washout! We felt the hotel, with its charming restaurant and very helpful staff , to be well deserved its 'little gem' status. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KMichigan
Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel within walking distance of some of the major sites in Rome. Our room was very spacious and elegant. The grounds were very beautiful with a nice continental breakfast in the gardens every morning. I agree with some of the previous reviews that the beds are hard, but we didn't have any trouble sleeping since you're so tired by the time you get back to the room! Although within walking distance of major attractions, it was in a nice, quiet residential location which we loved. The only drawback to that is that is that you had to walk about 10 minutes to get to any restaurants. In spite of that, we would still highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, adorable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lcn728
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our honeymoon and we loved it! The setting is peaceful and quaint, and the room was lovely. The bathroom, shower, and jacuzzi were particularly nice. Breakfast was delicious and the garden setting in which to dine is delightful, as well. We also had dinner at the hotel one night and were not disappointed. (Chocolate lovers should definitely order the chocolate souffle -- it's amazing!!) The staff was very friendly and we had a wonderful 3 night stay. It's about a 15 minute walk to Palatine Hill and the Forum area, and we walked to town several times from the hotel. If you don't mind walking a bit to get places, the location is great. (We found it very nice to come back to a peaceful neighborhood at the end of a busy day.) It's also convenient by metro and the bus system. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: PeteWM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple of nights in July and then, following a cruise, for a further four nights in August. We booked this hotel solely on the strength of the Tripadvisor reports, and we can fully and wholeheartedly endorse every positive report that is on this site. But first - and don't let it put you off ! - be aware that Rome is a big, sprawling, noisy city, with a lot of traffic and a lot of tourists. There IS litter, there IS graffiti, there are a lot (too many!) itinerant street traders selling the usual fake designer gear, and there are beggars and vagrants. On both our stays at the Villa San Pio, we were in Room 269 and although this didn't have a balcony, it was a corner room with four sets of windows, some looking out over the garden, and was a delightful room. 'Though admittedly with a somewhat quirky jacuzzi and a rather underpowered hairdryer! The Aventine Hill is undoubtedly very charming and a very quiet and upmarket neighbourhood. You will read (or have read) other reports that say that the hotel is at the top of a hill. Well, from our point of view ( coming as we do from the Pennines in Yorkshire) this is just a gentle gradient! Certainly, we were able to walk everywhere, and on our last day we walked from the hotel, via the Circus Maximus and Collosseum, and then on to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, before arriving - more by accident than design - at the Borghese Gardens which we then walked around and then into the Zoological Gardens. We then walked back to the hotel via the Piazza de Popolo and the Vittoria Emmanuelle. The point I would make is that for anyone who's reasonably fit and active, the major sights are all accessible; and the fact that the hotel is away from the hectic and frenetic hub of the city was, for us, a major advantage. We didn't make many demands on the concierge service as we knew what we were looking to do each day and part of the fun is finding your way around - and there's quite a bit to see in the immediate neighbourhood - Saint Sabina, the Orange Gardens, the Keyhole, etc. But the hotel did book us onto a Vatican Museum and Sistine Chapel trip and although this might seem expensive, it's well worth the cost. We found one or two of the front desk staff to be a bit distant and slightly reserved. Certainly, when we were discussing something with one of these gentlemen and he broke off to take a 'phone call, we felt that it was a bit discourteous not to say "excuse me a moment" before he took the call, and not to apologise when he returned to us; and a smile wouild not have gone amiss!!! But apart from that, no complaints whatsoever. And the little guy who seems to have 10 jobs - from Porter through to troubleshooter - is always very friendly and smiling and a terrific asset to the hotel. The room was always immaculately clean. Food? We ate Roman one night, but I found the meat a bit too stringy for my tastes. We went to a local Pizzeria another night. The other evenings we dined under the stars in the beautiful hotel gardens. The food - we had the fillet steak on two nights - was first rate, and the service friendly and attentive! A couple of times for lunch, we went down the "hill" to the Barberini (lovely pastries, pizza slices, and espresso) where the prices are exceptionally reasonable. Would we go back to the San Pio? Yes, without doubt. Tomorrow would be nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: QueenOfTravels79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 4 nights in July and found it to be a wonderful retreat in busy, hot and tiring Rome. Getting to the property upon arrival into Rome by train proved more difficult than it should be. The directions given by the hotel staff on how to walk from Circo Massimo metro stop do make sense and do work if you are able to find the side street required! So, be careful... and don't walk too far like we did! Should have only taken maximum 15minutes and after nearly 1 hour we bumped into a Welsh man going on a jog around the neighbourhood who helped us out. Even though, by the time we left, we had mastered the correct route we still caught a taxi direct to Termini when we left - maybe something better to do upon arrival also! The hotel rooms were very spacious, the biggest we received in all our travels and to be honest, I wasn't aware hotel rooms came so big in Europe! The bathroom had a whirlpool bath and whilst we didn't actually make use of this, the shower was also great. The bed was quite hard, however, and ours squeeked everytime I moved! Breakfast was good - coffee was very bad though. I was starting to love the coffee in Italy and was very disappointed when I first ordered my coffee at breakfast. Didn't drink most of it - then another morning I ordered another to see if the first day was just an 'off day', but nope, again, I could not drink it. Beware of sitting at the outside tables for breakfast during summer, unless you don't mind sharing your breakfast with a wasp and bee or two. The hotel is in what appears to be an upmarket residential neighbourhood - very green and quiet with what I can only imagine to be expensive properties lived in by people who drive flashy cars. The park behind the property also offers great views over Rome. Restaurants are plentiful if walking down the hill toward the tram line from the hotel aswell as a great gelato place, called "Ice Blue" I think..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base for Seeing Rome!”
Reviews.Author: arteffects2
Reviews.Content: Small, elegant Villa San Pio on the Aventine hill is so charming and comfortable that it's hard to leave the gates and venture on a walk to the nearby Forum and Colosseum! The staff is kind, helpful, and unobtrusive, the breakfast plentiful and delicious, and wonder of wonders, there was even a whirlpool tub in our bathroom! Heaven after a long day of plodding the streets. The place truly felt like home, and merely sitting in the lovely lush garden was a treat. One would never suspect a huge bustling city lay just beyond the walls; the location in a mostly residential area is perhaps the reason for that. If you stay, do walk to the Taverna Cestia a couple of blocks away (the concierge can direct you.) Probably the best food we had on the whole trip, and frequented by locals. We sat next to a darling couple (both 80 if they were a day) who spoke zero English. They told us that they had been coming to this little restaurant once a week for years (I didn't catch the number, but it was a lot, apparently!) If you want to spend more euros, try Apuleius (also very close to the San Pio). Elegant, with fabulous reproductions of Pompeian murals on the walls, and absolutely divine seafood. When we reluctantly checked out, I wanted to give the hotelier flowers---just as he had done for me when we arrived! Can't say enough in praise of this lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Heydehi
Reviews.Content: Wonderful secluded hide-away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas. The rooms are elegant, with a relaxing outdoor sitting/dining area between the different buildings. Baths are adequate in size. The price is comparable to similar hotels in Greece and Italy. The morning breakfast is good, the evening restaurant meals excellent but pricey. Other restaurants can be found going south and east towards Viale Aventino, about 15 minutes away. Circus Maximus is about 20 minutes walking north. (Everybody carries a compass, right?). Or going downhill and south, the #23 bus goes to the Vatican. Catch it on Via Marmorata. Tickets are one euro, purchased at the tobacco shop by the blue T sign on the other side of Via Marmorata. Don't get on without a ticket - can't pay on the bus and the fine for not having a ticket is 30 euro. Certain front-desk staff may seem unfriendly but you've got to work with them, so I have no beef there. Internet is available but you are paying for elapsed clock time, not internet time used. Restaurant staff is great. What my wife and I liked most was the quiet seclusion and garden-like sitting area for meals and just lounging. Yet we still felt close enough to the attractions. Walking from the Vatican back to the hotel along the Fiume Tevere was enjoyable on a cool day

Reviews.Title: “quiet and secluded”
Reviews.Author: Traveler133
Reviews.Content: Some say there's no place quiet in Rome, but this hotel must be an exception. There is a beautiful quiet internal courtyard for dining, and the breakfast is outstanding. It is a bit of a hike (maybe 3/4 mile) to the subway stations and nearest restaurants, though from these stations you could get wherever you want, and it's actually not too far a walk if you wanted to go all the way to someplace like the Colliseum on foot directly from the hotel. The hotel offers instructions for getting from the airport to the hotel in terms of taking a train to Rome Termini, a subway from there to Circo Massimo, and then on foot. The subway connection costs 1 euro per person, and then it's a fair walk from there to the hotel if you're carrying suitcases. On the way back, we decided just to take a cab directly from the hotel to Rome Termini, which was only 11 euros, so that would have made more sense for us as a connecting strategy.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, green, and incredible!”
Reviews.Author: brooklyncouple
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here 2 weeks ago and were totally impressed. I would have loved to stay for much longer than our 3 days allowed. We booked online at Venere.com and I reserved the standard, "cheap" room. I also emailed the hotel to ask if they had any rooms with terrace or views and was informed that these rooms generally cost about 100 euros more. We were therefore pleasantly surprised when we checked in and were given a 5th-floor room with an amazing wrap around terrace! No views of any landmarks, but incredible vistas of the leafy garden courtyard of the hotel and the other villa properties that make up the Aventino neighborhood. It was magical. The room itself was quite spacious and rather extravagantly designed in an over-the-top Italianate style... a real change from the ultra-modern hotel we had just come from in Athens! The grounds of the hotel are lovely... totally green and secluded and quiet. An oasis in a blistering-hot city. The free breakfast was a nice spread and much appreciated before heading out into the city (the nearest places to eat are about 10 min walk into the adjoining Testaccio neighborhood). The location is great, if you don't mind walking or the occaisional taxi ride. The Aventino neighborhood is totally lovely... gigantic villas on lushly-landscaped estates and the odd apartment building. Views from the bluff overlooking the Tiber river are incredible. Take some time to walk around the neighborhood and to soak in residential Rome... it's a welcome change of pace from the crowds thronging the Forum.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CathyL
Reviews.Content: My husband, 17 year old daughter and I stayed here for 4 days before going on a cruise. I had stayed in Rome before in a much busier location, and really wanted a quieter place away from the congestion of the city. The Villa San Pio was perfect. I can only add to what others have said: beautiful neighborhood, wonderful breakfast setting, large room with grand patio, close to the bus stop and easy to find a taxi. FYI, we booked a tour of the forum at [--] which provided a fantastic tour guide of the Palentine Hill and the forum for small groups of six. It was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis in a busy city”
Reviews.Author: StuartStockbridge
Reviews.Content: We found the San Pio a very pleasant hotel. The room, while quite small, was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was served in a conservatory annexed to the hotel with a view over an small, but attractive courtyard garden. Breakfast food was simple, but excellent and it was great to be able to get a good Cappuccino brought to your table. The hotel is a little set apart from the city centre, in a fairly afluent part of the city. This made it a little hard to find and also meant either a taxi or about a 25 minute walk home from, say, the Piazza Navona, in the evening (writers were reasonably fit, but a little boozy at the time of walking). Staff were pleasant and helpful in ordering taxis, giving us our bearings etc.

Reviews.Title: “a "B-" grade”
Reviews.Author: Sincerelyput
Reviews.Content: Booking here was tricky. Two days were done with hotels.com and two days were with rome.by. Rome.by only had two days, and hotels.com prices were almost double the rate. The hotel gave us a small room because they said that our rate was cheap with rome.by so ignored the $333.34 a night with hotels.com on the other two days. Beware that if you book at a cheap rate you will get the smallest rooms with no view. The staff was not friendly at all, and in the evening the older man at the counter had a pat answer to all who had inquiries..check with the management in the morning. it is wise to ask when booking if there is a large tour group staying at the hotel. Our first breakfast included listening to a lecture and "housekeeping" comments by the British group...this was not the quiet idylic breakfast we envisioned. However, the other three breakfasts were better, with one including a serenade by a loud saxophonist playing American tunes. The location is a bit of a trek to the major sites and cab rides added to the expense. If one is adventerous, the buses and metro can be utilized, but beware of rush hour on the metro. On the other hand, the location is in a quiet, lovely residential area on the Aventine Hill, and the garden path to the breakfast area is flower-strewn and lovely. The breakfast staff (non-Italian) were pleasant and fast. If you take a late breakfast, you may not have much of a choice of food, for the food is not replenished. The offerings are typical Italian fare, but there are also hard-boiled eggs and cold cereal. My rating is above average only because of the breakfast area and the quietness of the area (no vespa sounds).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful San Pio”
Reviews.Author: QVO-VADIS
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent five lovely days in Villa San Pio. This romantic hotel is located in a quiet part of Rome but it is only a short walk to Colosseum, Foro Romano, Giannicolo and other historic attractions. The room we were given was large, clean, nicely decorated and had a huge terrace, where we often enjoyed a evening drink under the orange trees before going to the nice restaurants nearby. The breakfast-buffet was impressive and was served in the beautiful patio of the hotel restaurant. We will certainly come back here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonWanderer
Reviews.Content: On the sidewalk wall in front of the hotel is a sign; "One of the most romantic hotels of the world." Believe it. Our room for four was one floor above street level at the back corner overlooking the garden. It came with a patio larger than our room. Most every afternoon of our four-day stay was spent on the patio reading, sipping wine, nibbling on some cheese, seated in the shade of many tall trees in a very quiet Aventino neighborhood. It was dreamy. The property consists of three buildings situated at all but the front left corner of an imaginary square. The fabulous continental breakfast is in the tree-shaded garden in the center of the "square" or inside in a sunroom. The staff was very helpful with good English. The bus line is a 5-minute walk downhill, a subway stop about 3-minutes farther. The Colosseum is a 15-minute walk in the other direction. And a 5-minute walk behind the hotel is the Basilica di Santa Sabina, a 1500-y.o. church. Next to that church is a small park which has a fabulous view of the city---maybe that's why it attracts young lovers!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: awannaventure
Reviews.Content: Wow!! We stayed here 3 nights with 9 people in 4 rooms. All of our rooms were amazing, large, clean with fantastic bathrooms and they weren't even the best rooms in the hotel! My daughter went a month before us and asked to see the 4 rooms and was shown all 4 rooms (not the rooms that we ended up with) by the staff who were very friendly. The rooms she was shown were much larger but the rooms we ended up with were by no means any less fabulous than the ones she was shown. The location although not in the thick of things is still very central. My elderly parents were able to walk from the hotel to Trastevere in 25 minutes (although my daughter after her viewing was able to walk to Trastevere in under 10). The locations is wonderful, you feel like you are in a quiet town but really you are only minutes from the Colosseum, the forum and Trastevere! The breakfast is great, fresh cappuccinos, fruit, meats, cereals and cheese! One of the best things about this hotel is the free secure car park. We were able to park 3 cars here which was a great bonus!! I would stay here over staying on Via Cavour (where we usually stay) any day!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect oasis, charming & lovely”
Reviews.Author: gwitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Rome part of our honeymoon and this was our favorite hotel by far. The staff are very friendly, the location is perfect to get away from the noise and traffic, our room was huge and very nicely furnished. Breakfast buffet (buy this with your room rate) had something to please everyone. The coffee is out of this world! Our room had a big patio attached which was the perfect place to sit in the early evening and enjoy some wine. We even had enough chairs to invite friends over one night. We saw the room/hotel our friends stayed at (near Piazza Navonna) and ours was much more comfortable. If you don't mind the 10 minute walk up some hills, this is the place for you. Don't miss the beautiful churches just up the street and the view from the park.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: drifters5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful-quietly tucked away from the hustle and bustle of downtown Rome. The rooms were decorated with large antique pieces and our room had a beautiful view of the Aventine Hill while our daughter’s room had a spectacular view of downtown Rome. The staff is helpful, friendly and ready to recommend restaurants and aid with directions. The Aventine neighborhood is full of ethnic restaurants, bakeries, gelaterias and delicatessens and is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast is served in a beautiful courtyard filled with orange trees. We spent 2 nights at this fabulous hotel and would go back in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Wonderful Service, Fantastic Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: lmarino12
Reviews.Content: My family of three stayed at the Villa San Pio in June 2007. We had a triple room. The room was huge and very well appointed. Once we got our bearings the location was fantastic. The hotel is in a residential area of Rome situated among very expensive homes. However it is a short 10-15 minute walk to the Subway, to Circus Maximus or the Coliseum. We never had a problem getting around Rome from our destination. If we had a distance to go we just hopped a cab. The hotel is probably 10-15 mins from the Vatican by cab. The breakfast provided with the room was excellent and the service was first rate. If possible take the time to explore the neighborhood surrounding the hotel. It is on the Aventine hill. If you walk 5 minutes up the hill you are rewarded with an amazing view of St. Peter's from the Keyhole, and it is well worth having an evening picnic with a bottle of wine in the Orange Tree (?) park. There i a great little deli down near the cab stand at the bottom of the hill that will help you put together a great picnic with a small bottle of wine for about 25Euro. The park has an amazing view of Rome, St. Peters and the Tiber river. Very Romantic. Downsides I must emphasize that the downsides are very minimal, but in the interest of fairness, here they are. . . * Our room as a little noisy in the morning, but not too bad. * The third bed for our daughter was more of a converted couch and would slide out from the wall from time to time if you sat on it wrong. * The mattresses were new and were hard * The taxis sometimes had a hard time finding the hotel, it is in somewhat of a maze of one way streets.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis on the Aventine”
Reviews.Author: norfolkteacher
Reviews.Content: Got a recommendation for this hotel from my mother. My daughter and I had a terrific experience. It is on the Aventine Hill in the middle of a lovely residential district. After spending the day in the hustle and bustle of Roma it is a welcome oasis of quiet. The first three nights we were in the main building and had a balcony with tables and chairs where we spent the early evening relaxing. Our final night in Italy we were in one of the back buildings in a beautifully appointed large room. Breakfast outdoors was excellent. We had two dinners- they were good but not the best meals we had on the trip. We did have the pleasure of watching the construction of the beautiful Murano chandelier that now hangs in the "greenhouse" section of the dining room. Staff was polite and helpful. Do not miss the opportunity to walk the two blocks up to the Knights of Malta door to look through the keyhole at St Peters. Stunning sight especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden calm retreat in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerInDenver
Reviews.Content: The Villa San Pio is a hidden retreat in this big city. We drove right to it and were pleased to find that it's in a calm region with very easy access to all of Rome's sites. We parked directly in front of the hotel, which was a surprising convenience, even though we elected to take taxis into the city every day. (It's a hidden gem even to the taxi drivers, not all of whom knew where it was located, so keeping the address handy is a must.) The front desk can summon a taxi which arrived within literally 4 minutes of the request. The room was exceptional, with air conditioning that made even the hottest days comfortable. Breakfast was in a pleasant greenhouse and was delicious -- cappucino, croissants, yogurt, juice, and more. I wouldn't hesitate to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Surfer08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in April of 07'. The hotel was very nice the rooms were very good sized (even by American standards.) The bathroom was great. The room and hotel were very clean, the staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was a nice ten to fifteen minute walk to the Collesium. We used the hop on hop off bus to see the rest of the city. The hotel is located is a very nice residential neighborhood a little away from the busy city interior.

Reviews.Title: “Nice One!”
Reviews.Author: Krizz00
Reviews.Content: Reading such enthusiastic reviews for Villa San Pio on Trip Advisor made choosing our hotel in Rome a very easy task indeed. We stayed at the villa for six nights arriving Monday 28th May 2007. Whilst it was a good choice we did, unlike some other reviewers, have some issues with it. The trip didn’t get off to the best of starts and we arrived in a rather foul mood at the hotel. The taxi driver from Ciampino airport charged us a fare of 60 euro and said that, as a road was closed, he would have to drop us just around the corner from the hotel. ‘Just round the corner’ turned out to be over 2km from the hotel and we ended up having to lug our suitcases the entire distance across major roads and along uneven pavements. We weren’t aware that the hotel has it’s own Mercedes car. We booked this for the return journey at a cost of 40 euro. Alternatively the reception will book you a fixed price taxi for 30 euro. With hindsight we’d have used the Mercedes on arrival, rather than line the pockets of rip-off airport taxi drivers, but unfortunately we weren’t to know. The receptionist and the member of staff who took the luggage to our room were very cheery and friendly and our mood began to lift. The villa is located on the Aventine hill. It’s a built up suburb but it has a nice to feel to it with leafy tree lined roads, little traffic, walled gardens and large villas. The hotel reception is located in the building next to the main entrance gate. A path leads through a small garden area to a second building containing a ground floor dining area and, above that, a number of rooms (four per floor) including our one (no. 267). Don’t rely on the numbering system to find your room – 267 is rather strangely located on the third floor. Forget that feeling you get when staying in a large chain hotel. The villa has oodles of character and, thankfully, you feel like an individual guest rather than part of a faceless crowd. The room was mid-sized with twin beds, wooden floors, a safe, and imitation frescos on the walls. All tastefully done. The bathroom had marble walls and floors, giving it a rather grand feeling, with somewhat unexpectedly a Jacuzzi bath. Apart from the occasional sound of footsteps from the room above there was no noise from the surrounding rooms.
