Soundproofing of the windows could have been a little better though and the sounds of people talking outside would occasionally intrude in the evening. I hate the sound of barking dogs and unfortunately one of the neighbouring properties has one such dog that would bark for ages each evening. Each day we were impressed by the thoroughness with which our room was cleaned. Unfortunately the cleaners had a habit of not looking carefully at which complementary shower gel and shampoo bottles we’d used and we would end up with lots of replacement shampoo ones but nothing else! Breakfast is a buffet affair. No cooked option was available. In contrast to the way we were greeted upon arriving at the hotel, the staff at breakfast, although efficient, seemed humourless and distant. Although we’ve had better breakfasts elsewhere it was perfectly adequate although on one occasion the bread seemed less than fresh. The breakfast area (which is used for dining in evening) consists of three parts: a glass conservatory area, an outside patio area and an inside dining room. All very pleasant. Take your pick. If there’s one thing you need to weigh up then it’s the location of the hotel. True, the hotel is located away from the hustle and bustle of the city but the downside is that the central attractions aren’t right on your doorstep. The Aventine Hill is south of almost everything you’ll want to see in the city (apart from attractions outside the city walls such as the Apian way and the catacombs). You’ll always therefore invariably find yourself travelling North. We love walking and we found the distances no trouble at all (there are delightful ruins around almost every corner that you’d easy miss when travelling by bus or taxi) but for some it may be too far to walk and you’ll need to think about the practicalities of other forms of transport. The Circus Maximus (10-15 mins walk away) will begin to seem like an old friend as you’ll find yourself passing it on every trip. Skirt its eastern end if you’re heading for the Colosseum (about 25 mins walk from the hotel) or the palaces on the Palatine Hill. Skirt its western end if you’re heading for the River Tiber, The lovely Forum Borium, The Roman Forum and the Monument to Vitto Emanuele II. On a couple of occasions we walked to the Vatican along the (very scenic) banks of the Tiber and this took around 75-85 mins. For us the tranquil location far outweighed any distance we had to walk. Would we stay here again? The issues we raised above are minor and yes we’d certainly book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Major Problem”
Reviews.Author: mart031
Reviews.Content: I agree that the location, appearance, ambiance, etc. at the San Pio is very nice. There was a very major problem. The beds are as hard as granite. I asked for another room, was allowed to go test several others, and found them to be virtually the same. The one I picked was marginally better than the original. Also, there was disco music blaring all night from a near-by club, but the folks at the San Pio have no control over that. The mediocre diners served in the courtyard are edible, but only because the setting is so beautiful you can forgive the rather meger attempt at diner.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of quiet luxury in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWoodlands
Reviews.Content: Spurred by a Financial Times Weekend article back in 2004 about the joys of staying on the Aventine Hill and confirmed by Trip Advisor Reviews, we booked the Hotel Villa San Pio (its sister property, the San Anselmo, was full). If noise, nightlife, the incessant roar of scooters, and a distinctly urban feel are your thing, this hotel is not for you. But if you enjoy feeling like you’re in a country village while just a couple of bus stops from all the major sights of Rome, then this is the ideal hotel. We did not have the experiences other travelers cited such as taxi drivers who couldn’t locate it. Nor did we find the walk up the hill from public transport to be daunting, although it did require tapping those last energy reserves after a day of walking around the city. We concur with other reviewers enchanted by the fragrance of orange, jasmine and lemon on the walk to breakfast and in the area as a whole. The staff all spoke English, were highly knowledgeable, and unfailingly gracious despite a full house. Common areas were tastefully decorated with antique furniture and provided a cozy feel. The room (525) was large but a bit Spartan, with upholstery beginning to show signs of wear. Could have done with a rug and a comfy chair for the limited time we spent in the room other than sleeping. Other reviewers bemoaned the small television set but we never turned it on and didn’t feel we were missing anything. Bathroom was a good size by European standards although the ancient hair dryer leaked more hot air out the hose than ever got to the nozzle. After resolving our confusion over the controls, the air conditioning worked flawlessly and was essential, even in mid-May. The breakfast buffet featured a lavish assortment of fresh baked goods, cold cuts, cereals, and fresh fruits – different selections each day. At the bottom of the hill, just across the train tracks on via Marmorata is a marvelous pastry shop/coffee bar (Barberini) and a gourmet shop (Volpetto) that will prepare a picnic complete with bread, cheese, ham and wine plus a map of how to get to the Garden of the Orange Trees and other not-to-be-missed spots on the Aventine Hill. We concur with other reviewers about visiting the Church of Santa Sabina at the top of the hill. Dating from the 5th century, it is stark and a humbling contrast to St. Peter’s Basilica. After three nights at this hotel we moved to another for a conference and were so thankful we had experienced the Villa San Pio -- an oasis by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic haven in a BUSY city!”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamBecs
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel in a nice relaxing part of Rome. Although it was a bit of a walk to get here, we didn't mind as it gave us chance to explore and see things we wouldn't have otherwise. The hotel was beautiful and all the staff, especially the waiters and porters, were helpful and polite. It was a perfect place to spend our wedding anniversary

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Freeway12
Reviews.Content: You won't be sorry staying at this gorgeous hotel. It is located in Aventine Hill residential section. The grounds are beautifully lined with lemon and orange trees. We can't say enough about how helpful and friendly the staff was. Buffet breakfast was great too. Villa San Pio is away from the madness of downtown Rome but not far enough that you can't walk to all the highlights. We loved our stay here and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kenmeyerLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at Hotel Villa San Pio from May 8th through May 13th 2007 and our hotel stay was nothing less than Excellent! I am a bit picky but also don't expect too much from hotels in Europe in general because most of the time they are small and just very expensive for what you get. Hotel Villa San Pio was worth every penny. I picked this hotel based on the reviews posted on Trip Advisor and the price. Here is a true and honest evaluation of the hotel and my familys experience in Rome. The hotel is approx. 1 mile from the collosseum and the ancient Roman Ruins. This is a nice walk but will take you 20 minutes to walk there. You will need a cab for the Vatican Museums and the Sistine Chapel. The hotel is in a residential area but believe me with the surrounding gardens and piece and quite you will be glad to be away just a little from the city. The hotel staff was very helpful and spoke english just fine. They even had a doorman. This hotel is rated as a 3 star but I think it should be a 4 star. Hotel rooms have a terrace in some if you ask. I did look at one with a terrace but we picked one without on the second floor. Our room was large and accomodated myself, my wife and my 21 year old daughter. The room had a tapistry on the wall that had to be 10 feet long by 5 foot worth thousands. The room had a king bed and a sleeper bed for our daughter, both firm but comfortable. Our room was number was 266. It had hardwood floors and the bathroom was all marble, very beautiful. The room also had a hair dryer and tv. This was a top notch room even for an american hotel. Each morning we got up to a complimentary breakfast that had coffee, tea, rolls, pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, juice and on and on. Very very nice and a great start to the day. This was better than many breakfasts I have had in American hotels. Rome Itself Tips: From the airport take a white cab (the true Italian cab company) to your hotel. It is 40 Euros plus a tip. Most sites you can do on your own but the Vatican Museums I would suggest a tour because there is so much to know and you will not know what you are looking at with out a guide plus it helps get you through the lines faster. We used Angel tours as recommended by other travelers but our guide "Lorin" was not very good. She spoke perfect english but it was so noisy most of the time you could not hear her. I think you can do better with some other company. Many other had listening devices as they went through and Angel tours did not have these. We took another tour of the collosseum with a different company who were just there and it was fine. We also went to a flea market on Sunday and beware of pick pockets. Three gypsy women came up to me asking the time. One grabbed one arm to look at my watch and one grabbed my other arm and one went for my pocket which I felt and I was on to them and ready so they did did not get anything but this was the only place I had this expereince. My family and I wondered all the streets around rome. Everone spoke some english and we had no trouble getting around or seeing all of the sites. I found the cab drivers to be friendly and did not try to take advantage of us. My recommendation is to stay at this hotel, go and see all of the sites and don't put it off. We cabbed it everywhere, bought everything under the sun and took evey tour and saw every site we could in 6 nights and spent less than $1,000 Euro's plus we ate at just about every pizza restraunt in Rome. Go and enjoy. We loved it and had a great time with no problems at all and stayed at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fab spot in rome”
Reviews.Author: cquinn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent in all aspects. The hotel is located about 10-15 mins stroll from the coliseum and the palantino and constantines arch. You dont have to walk it though as there is an excellent bus service located within 5 mins walk of the hotel. The 30 bus will bring into town for other tourist sites - spanish steps, forum etc. The hotel is beautiful. Rooms superbly decorated, very large bed and lovely power shower. Breakfast was very nice too - good selection which changed daily. It was my wifes birthday while we were there and when we arrived for breakfast on the morning of her birthday, the staff congratulated her and brought us champagne and a cake with candles. We couldnt believe this as neither of us had said anything to anyone about this birthday. Overall this is the place to stay when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: NormOregon
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with great service. Our room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Byebyegolf
Reviews.Content: I selected this Hotel thanks to the many good reviews other travellers have filed. The Hotel lived up to my expectations in all aspects. Beautifully decorated with good service in a tranquil location in classy Rome, who needs more? We were given room 525 for the first night, but wanted a room with a balcony so we changed to 521 for the last 3 nights. The staff handled everything with no fuss. This room is a bit smaller with only a small wardrobe and a shower and not a bath/shower, but the balcony was superb to look out in the mornings or evenings over the rooftops facing south. Try to book room 522, this seemed as big as 525 and had a similar balcony to 521, the best of both worlds. Beds were hard as described, but the high quality bed linen was changed everyday and extra pillows were provided as requested. The Hotel is in a great location, away from the hectic centre but in a good residential area with good links to Circo Massimo and Pyramide metro stations. Breakfast was served in the conservatory with a good continental choice and good service. We had dinner there on the second night. The food was ok, but despite a few table candles the room was still a conservatory with little atmosphere. Eating out is to be recommended unless you are exhausted after a day's sightseeing. The Hotel recommended several restaurants in nearby Testaccio down the hill, but we ate in Trastevere and in the centre near Piazza Navona both easily reached by bus/taxi, again the hotel will provide transport details. The Navonna Notte restaurant behind Piazza Navona can be recommended, it's not much to look at, but the service and food were by far the best we had in 5 days. Ostia Antica is a must if you can get out of Rome for a day. 2 Euros return train ticket from Pyramide, these are fantastic ruins of the old Port of Rome. Hire a mP3 player to provide multi lingual guides to the ruins, this brings them to life and is a great day's excursion and compliments busy Rome. The Angel Tours guide (Anne Marie) was fantastic for the Vatican, St Peters and the Sistine Chapel well worth the 25 Euros guide fee. Another good tip, buy the combined Palentine Hill/ Colosseum tickets at either of the Palentine Hill entrances and walk straight through the ticket queue at the Colosseum, great feeling. Great break, thanks to all the Tripadvisor members who provided hotel and forum reviews that made the visit special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mom7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel and absolutely loved it. It is in a wonderful neighborhood ( the American Embassy is near by), the breakfast was delicious, and we ate dinner at the restaurant every evening. The rooms are large and clean, with a good sized bathroom, and have shutters to make the room very dark. It is within walking distance of the coliseum, but very quiet and residential. Be sure and see the "keyhole" at the church about a block away. It is a beautiful view of St. Peter's. The hotel staff will give you directions.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little hotel”
Reviews.Author: alicat84
Reviews.Content: I spent many evenings trawling through websites to find the perfect hotel for a romantic Italian break with my boyfriend, and I certainly found it. After reading the fantastic reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked 3 nights at the Hotel Villa San Pio from the 15th to the 18th of April through a great website called Secretplaces.com. This website offered great rates, even at high season, and including breakfast. Following the advice of a previous reviewer here on TripAdvisor, we booked a very nice Mercedes from Touringcar.it, who picked us up from the airport and dropped us at the hotel for the fixed price of 44euro, a great bargain. The hotel itself looks stunning from the outside, surrounded by trees and shrubs in full bloom in the Spring, and the street is wonderfully calm. The staff at reception were very friendly, and as we had arrived before noon, we were a little early for check-in so they offered to keep our bags in the office, while we went exploring for a little while. They also supplied us with a map of the city and some recommended restaurants. Only a few minutes walk from the hotel, you find yourself already in the heart of Ancient Rome, with the Circus Maximus, Colosseum and Roman forum right in front of you. Upon our return to the hotel, our room was ready with the porter waiting to bring our bags up. We were placed in room 522, an elegantly decorated room, which may have been a little small were it not for the balcony outside that we had requested when booking. The bathroom was clean and modern, with a jacuzzi bath which was very much appreciated at the end of a long days touring through the city. The huge bed was firm but very comfortable. The restaurant, conservatory and gardens were very pleasant and peaceful. Breakfast was delicious, a selection of fruits, breads, yoghurts, juices and coffee. The evening meal was also impressive, a full four course and my boyfriend adored the steak! The menu was mainly in Italian but the waiters were quite happy to translate and describe anything we were unsure of. If you prefer something a little cheaper for dinner, head down the hill to the local restaurants, of which the favourites are marked on the map supplied by the hotel reception. "Perilli" do a delicious fillet steak for only 12euro, a steal! Il Cantinore was another lovely little local place. I would advise able travellers to try the Metro for getting around the city, it was cheap and very efficient, but keep the hotel map with you so you know which direction you should be heading! Also, the Italian drivers are crazy so crossing the street is a bit of an adventure. Do as the Italians; find the pedestrian crossing and walk determinedly, but carefully, to the other side. Don't dither! Lastly, be aware at all times where your handbag/wallet is! Gentlemen, keep your wallet in a secure inside pocket where you can feel it at all times, and ladies, use a handbag that closes securely and keep your hand on it. Luckily we had no problems with thieves but there are many reports of unfortunate tourists having their wallets/purses stolen from right underneath their noses. One Italian man did try to trick us at the top of the Spanish steps, by asking us to place a finger inside a loop of string he had, his plan was to catch our finger tightly in the loop and refuse to let go until we gave him money or a colleague robbed us, a common swindle apparently. If you decide to walk back towards the hotel one day from the city, I would highly recommend following the banks of the Tiber, a peaceful stroll in the evening sunshine. The hotel organised a car to bring us to the airport on our last day, at a fixed price of 40euro, which was great but not as nice as the new Mercedes on our arrival(!) That was the end of our trip, but it was our faboulous experience at the Hotel Villa San Pio which made it so memorable. I will be recommending it to any and all of my friends and family who are considering a visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WHTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Villa San Pio is a small hotel in an upscale residential area on the Aventine, a leafy retreat from crowds and bustle, but still walking distance to the ancient city center and with good access to mass transit to get everywhere else. We used both buses and the metro successfully. Our room and bath were clean and comfortable, the staff courteous and helpful. The hotel occupies three small buildings surrounded by lush landscaping, with the excellent restaurant housed on the ground floor of one. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious, with particularly good crusty rolls. Dinner was also fine, but there are a number of good, less expensive places down the hill in Testaccio if you're in the mood for something less elaborate. We particularly liked Il Cantinone, which is billed as a pizzeria but offers much more, and Remo, which is bare bones with terrific pizza. Rome is a big, busy city and staying at the Villa San Pio is a great way to be near its heart but away from it all at the same time. We found this hotel on TripAdvisor and are very grateful to the people who reviewed it before us. It's a real find and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - and only a little out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: PDCork
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, and very good value. Yes, it's a little out of the way - ca. 1km south of the Colosseum - but it has many benefits to outweigh this. The hotel can only be described as tranquil. No hustle and bustle, no stress, no noise and no 'city-centre' feel. The rooms are large and airy, and the terrazza is a lovely place to eat al fresco. Staff are pleasant and helpful - the local map they provide with local attractions etc marked is very useful! We didn't eat dinner in the hotel, but breakfast was quite good. This is certainly one of the better Italian hotels I've stayed in and I recommend it wholeheartedly. Thel local Ristorante Villetta (marked on the local map provided by the hotel) was a very good mid-priced restaurant. Staff, food and wine were very good and very good value (€45 for 2 starters, 2 main course and 1l wine.) Compare this to the disaster that is Caffe Bernini in the Piazza Navona! We waited 45mins for the 1st course and 30 mins for the second. We complained on several occasions, and my friend's steak arrived very undercooked (he asked for medium/well and got rare!). The poor service was complimented suitably by the extortionate prices (service charge, cover charge etc - €6 for a GLASS of wine), and topped off by the incorrectly cooked food. We eventually paid about half the bill in protest, and left in sheer disgust! Finally, we stumbled upon an excellent private car service which guaranteed a fixed price from Fiumicino to our hotel (any hotel in Rome) of €42. we searched the web and found several otions, and decided to try 'Touring Car'. The service was impeccable and well worth the price. Having been 'ripped off' by taxis before, this was a real treat - well done Giuseppe!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Allimac1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February, 2007 with my husband and 2 children aged 10 and 2 - booked based on the reviews on this website and we were not disappointed. I booked this hotel mainly because of my 2 year old - I wanted a hotel that was not in the centre of things and where there might be some outside room for him to run around. This hotel is fabulous - we were given a room on the first floor of the main building with views over the garden and a huge (I mean huge) terrace that wrapped around the building. The walk through the covered pathway amongst the lemon trees to the conservatory for breakfast was lovely. The room was a great size with plenty of room for the 2 extra beds for the children. The staff were very friendly and I apologise for forgetting the name of the porter, a lovely asian guy with a huge smile who always addressed the children by name. As others have said this hotel is in a residential area, about 2 metro stops from the colosseum. We found the area to be very pleasant and strolled down to the main street in the evenings and ate in the local restaurants where the Italians themselves were eating. The food (and wine!) were great value. By staying in this hotel, slightly out of the centre, you definitely get more for your money - I think this 3 star hotel should be given a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romantic Hotel, but beware...I awoke racked with pain every morning!”
Reviews.Author: jonsie7
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second trip to Rome where we stayed at the Villa San Pio. I agree with many reviews...great hideaway and yet central. Close to the Metro. And very quiet with a beautiful garden filled with lemon and tangerine trees. A great place to have a drink after the long walks in Rome. The service is friendly and the included breakfast is very good. BUT...after my second stay, I am afraid it will be my last. Both rooms had the HARDEST beds (including the hardest pillows) that I have ever slept in. (Perhaps I just had the bad luck of having the only 2 hard beds in the hotel.) I would wake up in the night and think I was sleeping on an ironing board. No joke! Absolutely no give at all. Not the slightest padding. I used to be an international flight attendant for 10 years, so I have lots of travel experience and have had to sleep in many beds not my own. But these beds are murder. I woke up every morning in pain and agony. I am surprised not more feedback about the beds is posted. Even for lovers of hard beds, this is really like sleeping on a floor. Otherwise, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, central but off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: s_neill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the Circo Massimo stop on the Metro. It is also 10-15 minute walk from the Roman Forum and Colosseum. The hotel itself is in a residential area, which is a good thing if you wish to get a real taste of Italian food (and not the drivel served by the well known tourist spots) as there are a lot of local restaurants. All of which served food of the highest order - I never want to eat the Italian 'food' served in the UK again. Inside the hotel, I found it to be clean, tidy and well-kept. Rooms are of a fair size and include a digital safe. The bathroom is clean and tidy, towels are replaced daily, and beds are comfortable. Unfortunately, visiting in March, the air condition was turned off due to it still being winter, so I found the room to be warmer than I'd like. Being from England, Italian winter is more like May-time weather in the UK. Breakfast, of the continental kind, is tasty and of good quality. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: Cody-Anne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at the Hotel Villa San Pio after browsing for a reasonably priced hotel on Trip Advisor. Our transport to the hotel from the airport was an adventure on its own. We attempted to take the train into the city centre and then hoped to sort ourselves out at Termini. Unfortunately we weren't well prepared, and couldn't wrap our brains around the metro, and how to get to the hotel. So... we took a taxi from Termini - the driver had no idea where to go, got lost several times, but eventually delivered us to our destination. The entrance way is impressive, and we were welcomed very warmly by the reception staff. We booked the standard double room, and were very happy with the room. It was clean, large, and comfy. Our little terrace looked out on the front street, and had the weather been nicer we would have spent more time sitting out on the chairs gazing over the rooftops of the charming neighborhood. But let's face it, you don't go to Rome to hang out in your hotel. My very favourite part of the hotel experience was the breakfast (which was included in the price). You actually leave the hotel and walk through a gorgeously landscaped fantasy - an enclosed and seemingly exotic pathway that leads to this fantastic solarium. The food selection was better than your average fare, and the quality was excellent. Plus sitting in that solarium (in our case with the rain hitting the panes of glass) surrounded by greenery and flowers, just made us feel cozy and inspired. By the end of our weekend, we had figured out the metro (two closest metro stops are Circo Massimo and Piramide on line B) and pretty much walked the entire city. If you are ambitious, walk it all. You'll see so much more of this amazing city. The best and the worst thing about this hotel for us was it's location. And by worst I mean that there really wasn't anything wrong with the hotel at all. The location is out of the way, so it is quaint and charming and quiet. It's also hard to find, and a bit of a hike to get to if you are walking like we did. We thought being a km away from the Colosseum would make this hotel ideal, but the truth is that the Colosseum is also a little out of the way, and that the hotel is up on one of the 7 hills. If you are like us and usually like to be in the centre of things, then still consider this hotel, but consider yourself warned!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Roma”
Reviews.Author: MDN-24
Reviews.Content: What a great property! We came across it on line and booked based on Tripadvisor recommendations. We were pleasantly surprised. As a family of four, 2 adults and 2 teens, we had a large quad room with a private patio lined with lemon and orange trees, and a wonderful whirlpool tub in a beautiful marble bathroom. We felt we were guests in a private villa!. Some of the reviews complained that the TV had a 13" screen, but who cares, we were out touring all day! Being located in a residential neighborhood we left the windows open at night so we could hear the birds in the morning. Breakfast was served in the solarium. The Food was tasty, plentiful and assorted -breads, cheese, and fruits. Don't forget to ask for cappuccino. The staff was friendly and mulit-lingual. Easy walking distance to the ruins - 20 minutes tops. The worst parts of our stay was the uphill climb at the end of the day and the fact we had to leave after only four days.

Reviews.Title: “Positive reviews accurate”
Reviews.Author: Ricktap64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel San Pio for 4 nights in February after reading reviews on TripAdvisor. I'd been looking for a nice hotel, competitvely priced and within walking distance of the city. It was great on all counts. Lovely spacious room, huge comfortable bed, clean and crisp linen every day, generous and tasty breakfast, quiet and peaceful location. We either walked to the Colosseum (15 mins) or to Piramide or Circus Maximus metro (10 mins). Highly recommended - would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LeighCali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely LOVED this hotel! Very beautiful, spacious, and clean. It's right outside the city, yet still within walking distance of the Colosseum...so it's not chaotic and loud. Very peaceful. We will absolutely stay there if we are in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trumpeter1
Reviews.Content: This hotel offered great rooms, very large bathrooms and wonderful foods.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Garden Retreat in Busy Rome”
Reviews.Author: misskitty71
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel following reviews on Tripadvisor and were not dissapointed. The area is just beautiful, you walk five minutes from the bustle and noise up the Avantine Hill to an area of peace, it is such a pretty area, if you can get a balcony you can have a wine while looking over Rome and hear nothing but bird song. If you dont get a balcony make sure you go up to the terrace and check out the view. The gardens, bar and restaurant in the hotel are lovely and the breakfast is more than adequate. We had room 529 which had a wonderful wraparound balcony and a massive bed. The room was nicely decorated, basic in the way of amenities but spotless with a huge shower (no bath). I am now surprised that many people were disappointed by the staff, all the staff members we encountered were extremely helpful and friendly, if you are unsure of where to eat they will provide you with little maps and a rundown of the type of restaurant and will even phone ahead to make the reservation for you. The location is a good ten min walk from Pyramid or Circo Maximus but that was no problem, and we loved the fact that 15 mins and you were right in Ancient Rome. We discovered a beautiful garden at the top of the Avantine Hill, it has a superb view of the Vatican and is a lovely peaceful place if you have had a hectic day. Definately get a guide at the Colleseum you will get so much more from the experience. We went on a weekend when the Vatican Museum was free - avoid this day at all costs, I have never seen a que so long it wrapped around three of the city walls, I would rather have paid but it was our last day and there was no way I was wasting it in that huge que. We went to St Peters instead, paid our respects to Pope John Paul II and climbed the Cupole (DO NOT do this if you are claustraphobic, I had a few tizzy moments luckily the top was worth it) We dined in a few of the local restaurants but our favourtie was Buccatino - dont go if you want peace and quiet, this is a noisy Roman trattoria, if you want fab food (lamb to die for) and a fantastic atmosphere make sure you visit, it was our favourite place to eat even though the hotels restaurant served superior food. I will definatly be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of rest in a loud city”
Reviews.Author: ChrisU
Reviews.Content: Booked our honeymoon here, based on the good reviews on this site. Stayed a week in a very nice room, lager than the one we booked, for a reasonable price (€137/night incl. very good breakfast). The free upgrade included a Jacuzzi, two large cupboards and a couch. Unfortunately the Jacuzzi and airconditioning didn't work and weren't repaired when asked. Staff is correct but not very friendly; their English is sufficient but not that good. Both typical caracteristics for the people Rome as we found out... Best thing about the place is that is is an oasis of peaceful rest in a very loud city. Great historical sites within minutes walk around the hotel. Won't go back though. Not because of the Hotel S. Pio but because of the unfriendly nature of the people of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Truly molto bene!”
Reviews.Author: lbmetcalf
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa San Pio is located in a wonderfully quiet residential area in the Aventino. The rooms are large (by European Standards) with wonderful faux tromp l'oiel decor and re's the well appointed up-to-date marble bathroom (large shower only). The hotel is nestled in a wonderful small wooded mediterranean garden with terraces and balconies for everyone to enjoy. Since it was winter time, most of the furniture on the terraces had been taken in, but there were heatlamps outside on the restaurant terraces that made my evening Lemoncello cozy. The restaurant (open evenings only) is 4 star, but take a taxi "downtown" and enjoy the local flavor. The positive and negative to this hotel is it's location on the Aventine hill which requires a short site filled cab ride to the Pantheon, but, as I mentioned, it's a very quiet oasisi in a very busy loud city. The staff is very helpful and taxis are readily available and quick. The staff speaks English and the hotel is maintained impeccably. My husband and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/Good location/Indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: smilingtravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of the reviews contained on Trip Advisor. Two couples were spending a few days in Rome to celebrate a 40th birthday. The birthday boy emailed the hotel a week before to request rooms close together but received no reply. When we checked in we explained we had emailed but were advised no email had been received. The receptionist was uninterested in what the email said and when we asked for rooms close together was told there was none. On checking into the rooms, one did not contain a bath. The birthday boy returned to reception, requested a room with a bath and was placed only a short walk from his friends room! Despite the above the hotel was lovely, breakfast was excellent - one of the nicest choices of buffet we have had in Europe and the location was great in a peaceful position. The gardens were beautiful and I can imagine they would be a great place to relax in the summer. The metro is a short walk away and very reliable. When we did use taxis they were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: peterad
Reviews.Content: Perfect room with a lovely balcony. Great breakfast. 5 minute walk to bus or Piramide stop. Would definetly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kon1979
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for 3nights in the middle of Dec. The hotel is lovely,clean,beautiful gardens,friendly staff and excellant breakfast.I had spent quite some time searching trip advisor for a decent hotel, not costing and arm and a leg! Alot of the hotels in rome didnt appear to be of good standard or far to expensive. The bedroom was large and en-suite was large. Only had a shower though, a bath would have been nice after a long day tracking Rome!The shower did have hot water,clean towels daily. The hotel was in a quiet residential area. It was within walking distance to many of the wonderful sights in Rome. The hotel was quiet and we had no problem sleeping. PS bed was massive!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could be more central if you're a tourist”
Reviews.Author: peterelk
Reviews.Content: My travel agent picked this hotel because it was close to FAO headquarters, where I had a meeting. I was happy to notice that this hotel had got great reviews in Tripadvisor. Villa San Pio is a nice small hotel located in a quiet, green neighborhood. The room was impeccably clean, and the bed was absolutely huge (and firm). Breakfast was very good indeed. Service was pretty average, courteous, but nothing spectacular. The location was perfect for my purposes, but I'm not sure it's so great if you're a tourist. Most major attractions are pretty far away and it could be a little tricky to get to the hotel by using public transport especially at night. There are, however, several nice restaurants at the closeby Viale Aventino that are much better than the expensive and bad tourist traps somewhere further downtown. Would recommend if peace and quiet is what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: digidds
Reviews.Content: Picked this beautiful place after researching TA reviews and forums. We were not disappointed......Stayed 3 nights. Location was excellent...especially with regard to seeing the sights and navigating Roma. Close to all transportation....actually dropped the car at the airport after driving up from Sicily; took the train to the metro stop and the metro a few stops to the Pyramid stop. We could have walked to the hotel from there, but instead took a taxi (several euros with bags and all.). After checkout, the hotel had an early am cab waiting and we reversed the route to the airport via the train. No hassels. Busses are convenient right down the street from the hotel, as are several very good restaurants. Safe easy pleasant passagiata at any time. Staff are seasoned and you will marvel at the lack of tourist activity...it really is a business persons hotel...a class act. Nice large terraced rooms with great views. An excellent in city hotel. Wish it was in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Poor booking experience”
Reviews.Author: decwes
Reviews.Content: Contrary to what is written in the other reviews, I found the customer service lacking here. We attempted to book at the advertised 'special rate' for January, only to be told that it didn't apply...why put it on the website? Furthermore, those who dealt with my booking request then offered me a rate nearly three times that advertised applicable for 'high season' rather than what is classified on their website as a 'low season' period. Don't be drawn in by false promises of special rates here.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning oasis in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: groovyposhchick
Reviews.Content: What can I say but it was simply perfect. My partner and I spent his birthday weekend in Rome and stayed at the Villa San Pio. I had read the reviews before booking the hotel and I have to agree with all of the positve comments mentioned. The staff were really kind and friendly and incredibly helpful. The location of the hotel was perfect and Rome really is walkable as we found out. When I booked the hotel I mentioned it was my partners birthday and I'm not sure whether it was this or whether they noticed the birthday cards in our room but on returning after a busy days site seeing we were presented in the bar with a bottle of something cool and sparkly. The barman insisted on bringing it to our room and it was accompanied by nuts and chocolates and a card wishing my partner happy birthday. It was an incredibly thoughful and appreciated gesture. the room was huge and very clean and comfortable and the breakfast was fab! All in all a great place and I would definately stay here again when I revisit. The only blot on what was a fantastic weekend was the taxi driver that picked us up from the Termini and took us to the hotel. We were charged just over 30 Euros and the hotel told us that it should have costed 12-15. The journey did take along time but as it was our first visit we didn't really know how long it should take. When the driver dropped us off (up the road from the hotel!) it was quite dark and he managed to switch the notes my partner gave him from a 20 euro to a 5 euro. We actually ended up spending about 60 euros on this one ride without realising it until he had gone. He was very clever to say the least. We have since found out that this is quite common in Rome. I would recommend that if you take bus transfer from the airport to the termini don't use one of the taxi's that gather around the drop off point but walk to the main termini entrance and get one from there, no guarentee but propbably a better option. I would also recommend the public transport. the hotel can tell you which bus to catch and where it stops and also we used the metro to get back to the termini.....it cost us one euro each!

Reviews.Title: “Sanctuary in Rome”
Reviews.Author: speckster
Reviews.Content: Take my advice if you are (or are travelling with) a princess such as myself. The San Pio was a lovely and quite neccessary retreat from the craziness of Rome. My husband and I spent 3 days there in April. Despite being a girl who loves a bustling city (New York and Paris are delightful to me) I found Rome to be a bit overwhelming at first. While it is one of the great cities in Europe and a neccessary stop if you want to do Italy justice, I was surprised to find that it was not the hospitable Italian experience I was expecting. It was, in fact like other major cities I have visited, fast-paced and no nonsence, noisy and a little dirty. Caught me off guard I guess, because everyone I talked to before my trip had me expecting all italians to be like those little old ladies in the Prego commercials. I am grateful for the reviews on trip advisor that lead us to stay at San Pio. The hotel is tucked away in a lovely residential neighborhood just out of range of the chaos of the city, but still walking distance from the forum and colluseum and wonderful restaurants (try buccatino, fabulous seafood risotto). The staff at the hotel were superb. Excellent service, and when the mouse on my computer wouldn't work and I was about to have a mini meltdown because I couldn't check my dog-sitters daily weblog (I told you I was a princess) my husband asked the concierge for help and he gave us the mouse from the front desk computer to use. After a lovely dinner at the hotel restaurant the next night, our laptop wouldn't work at all, so the gentleman behind the desk let us use his computer to check the blog as well. All with that famous italian hospitality that I had been told about. The room was lovely. Decorated traditionally, but not in that over the top tacky italian renaissance way that you run into if you're not careful. Impeccably clean, and spacious by european standards. The grounds are well manicured as well. Overall, a lovely respite from the crazy city down the hill. I will most certainly reccommend this hotel to my friends and clients (two who have already stayed there since my return).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoxyLA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Villa San Pio for 2 nights at the end of our Italy trip, and it couldn't have been more perfect for that. We were both tired and had seen most of the major sites, so we didn't need to be too close to everything. I wouldn't recommend it for someone who wants to be in central Rome, close enough to walk to all the sites - because it's pretty far out. But, if you don't mind taking the bus, a stop is nearby. The area the hotel is in is beautiful and quiet. Tons of trees. It's a short walk (through a kind of shady area) to get to the Metro station, so we just took the bus anywhere outside of walking distance. There are some really great restaurants within walking distance, but I would not recommend the hotel restaurant. Breakfast was a little better than other Italian hotels, but dinner was overpriced and not as good as the other restaurants that are a 5 minute walk away. The bathrooms was big and comfy, with a jacuzzi tub. And, the room was super quiet at night. They even get a few more English speaking channels on the TV than other hotels. Overall, it was a great experience. And, the 40 Euro car to the airport is totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 Star in Italy”
Reviews.Author: sauction
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the 3 star rating, this is the best little hotel in Rome. Staff goes out of their way to make you feel special. Dining is an excellent experience....Breakfast buffet is top notch. Rooms are exactly like the photos, large, clean and beautiful. Location is great, close to shopping, attractions, dining, etc. We booked a great tour recommended by the hotel, it was much better than expected with a wonderful 4 course lunch included. This charming hotel is worth twice what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and quiet surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Pcoltrane101
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed her for 3 nights in November and loved every bit of this hotel. Its located in the affluent Aventino Hill area just south of the Palatino hill, which in reality is less than 10mins walk before you start to see the magnificent ruins of the classical period. In comparison to the rest of Rome this area is peaceful and quiet, Rome is non-stop traffic elsewhere. Although a little way out of the busy areas everything is in walking distance. Rome is surpsisingly quite small at its heart. I would recommend the Metro as the Taxi drivers will screw you and its a direct line from the Termini to the nearest station at the foot of the hill (circo maxismo). Would i return to this hotel, YES i would.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Villa San Pio!”
Reviews.Author: deadfish
Reviews.Content: It is a lovely little hotel in Rome about a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Colosseum. The room was not large but adequate, well appointed and clean. There is a lovely little courtyard inside the hotel grounds where one can sit at tables outside in nice weather and there also is a lovely glassed-in atrium for meals witha view of the garden. The staff were friendly and helpful and we very much enjoyed our stay. We would certainly recommend it to others and would return there ourselves if ever heading to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Villa San Pio Bellissimo”
Reviews.Author: AllentownTA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome November 9 - 13, 2006. As a travel agent I have travelled extensively throughout Europe, The Villa San Pio is one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed at. From the incredibly spacious rooms to the extremely courteous and helpful staff, it is truly a gem. We were able to have our window open at night and not experience any traffic noise at all. The location is a respite from the craziness of Rome and a peaceful walk to the bus or metro stop to get you to anywhere in Rome. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place (by 'Swedish family')”
Reviews.Author: Swede007
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel together with my family (wife + 2 sons of 10 and 12). We arrived by train rather late (after 9pm), but were offered dinner in the hotell restaurant (fairly good). The room was large - no problem to accomodate the 4 of us, and they had put in full-size extra beds for my sons. Rooms are nicely decorated - classic style. Bathroom is also large and luxurus (e.g. marble tiles). The reception was always very helpful - both in arranging taxi's and in booking restaurants. We wanted to try Osso bucco, and the man in the receptation probably called 15 restaurants to check if they had it on the menu -> excellent service. Unfortunately no restaurant serving osso bucco was found. Location was very good - Aventino is one of the nicest areas in the center of Rome and most places are reachable by foot (if you are ready to walk a bit), and taxi's are not that costly. 3 recommendations while in Rom: 1) get a guide at the Colesseum (it's worth it!) - plenty availble on the outside. 2) go see a fotball-game at the Stadio Olimpico (Roma or Lazio) to get a feel for today's 'colesseum' and 3) go up in the cupole of the St Petrus church - it's worth the wait and the climb up narrow stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Hotel Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: beverlyblvd
Reviews.Content: Overall the staff was friendly, the hotel was very clean, breakfast was great and the location was quiet. For people returning to Rome I would highly recommend it. For first time visitors or those staying in Rome a short time, I would recommend staying closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “hidden jewel in rome”
Reviews.Author: michaelpi
Reviews.Content: excellent peaceful location in heart of rome ;large rooms ;friendly and helpful staff ,majority non -italian though;large spacious rooms;close to circus maximus 5 mins by foot;

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dskeeles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an "island" of peaceful, leafy suburbs within the city, but still walking distance from the centre; 10 minutes' walk down the hill gets you to the S edge of the Palatine hill, and 25 minutes to the Colloseum. The area is a nice respite from the bustle of the city. The hotel itself is lovely - a blend of rustic Roman décor, with grander imperial furnishings, all within a maze of corridors and Ivy-lined outdoor passageways. It appears to be a large converted villa, and the restaurant/breakfast is in a conservatory on the far side of a well-tended garden. With little traffic outside, the hotel is certainly very relaxing. Service was OK - effective, but neither overly friendly or overly efficient. We waited 10 minutes for a beer and Irish coffee in a quiet bar, and were told there were no pizzerias that would deliver when the restaurant closed at 10pm. The breakfast the following morning was good quality, however. The room was large, certainly more so than any hotel in the centre would allow, with two large shuttered windows overlooking the fence and street outside, a king-sized bed, and a 14" TV that was barely visible from across the room. The furnishings were generally a little worn and dated, from the varnish on the wooden furniture, to the non-cable small TV, and frayed Ethernet cable for internet access. On this, our room was close enough to reception to pick up a signal from the Wireless Router at the front desk (access via a username/password from reception, for €4 for 30mins, up to €15 for 48hrs). The provision of a combined jacuzzi/shower in our room was unexpected, but welcome after 8 hours' walking around Rome. Overalll, the hotel is very nice for its quiet, peaceful location and setting - if you take the lack of modern trappings such as cable TV as a part of its charm, rather than a drawback, it's a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: AW25
Reviews.Content: The S. Pio was lovely, quiet, and clean. we had a wonderful room with our own private balcony. it does feel like an oasis in the middle of a noisy, bustling city, but it doesn't take long to walk down the hill into the heart of things. the courtyard is loely for meals and relaxing. i definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: longhorn13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in early June. What an oasis in Rome! Though not in the central part of Rome, we thought this hotel was well located. It is in a residential neighborhood, about a 10 minute walk from the Colosseum and Roman Forum. Being outside of the city center, it is quiet and has lots of trees (you don’t see any trees in the center of the city). The rooms were very nicely appointed and even had a nice balcony. They even arranged a car to the airport for us which was cheaper and nicer than any other option. We will stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the San Pio!”
Reviews.Author: Georgia-USA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the San Pio on September 15, 2006. What a fantastic hotel! We have nothing bad to sad about it. A couple of our friends recommended this hotel. Hotel is located in a residential area of Rome, very quiet with tree-lined streets. Good restaurants within walking distance. A section of the old Roman wall was nearby. Our room was spacious and very clean. The room opened up to a roof top terrace. What a view! Bathroom was very large and beautifully done in marble. Staff was extremely curtious and helpful (and they spoke English-we are from Georgia, USA). Breakfast was plentiful and served in an absolutely beautiful garden (and indoors). One tip when making a reservation, call the hotel directly. You may get a better rate. We used Expedia only to find out when we arrived we could have spent half as much if we had called the hotel directly. Without a doubt, we would stay at the San Pio again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: bevsar
Reviews.Content: An excellent quiet hotel yet only a five minute walk to the metro and a 5 minute walk to local restaraunts. Our room (513) was of a good size with a balcony overlooking the tree lined street and amazingly quiet. The bathroom was new with a whirlpool bath (very nice after pounding the streets of Rome) and a power shower. The staff were very friendly and helpful and most of them spoke very good English. I suppose if I was to have a gripe it would be that the bar was a part of the dining room overflow and had little or no character. The breakfast was Continental and as such was very good. My wife and I found the Il Cantinone Trattoria food and value very good and one of 5 local restaurants within a short walk of the hotel. A shuttle runs from the airport to the hotel and back again and can be booked with the hotel. Make sure that you visit the ruins at Ostia Antica which is a 25 minute train ride from Rome. Connect to the train via the Metro. All in all thanks in no small part to the hotel we had a great visit to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Green oasis”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Pio for three nights as part of a two week tour of Italy. Our spacious room was on the second floor. It had a large bathroom festooned with marble and a small terrace. Our room was quiet and relaxing except for a rather noisy man one morning calling on his friend in a neighbouring room at 8 am to discuss their plans for the day at the top of their voices in the corridor! It was wonderful to have a leisurely breakfast outdoors each morning in the garden surrounded by orange trees. The buffet breakfasts were good and the breakfast team welcoming. The hotel’s location was great to come back to after a hard day’s sightseeing, a green oasis after the bustle of the city. All the city’s sights were easily accessible from the San Pio, we used the metro to get into the city each day but mostly used taxis back at night. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou Trip Advisor for tyhe Best In Rome”
Reviews.Author: Steve12
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the reviews on Trip Advisor we decided on the Villa San Pio. The good reviews say it all for this Hotel and any bad reviews must have had some other problem they are not disclosing. We stayed for Five Nights from 10th September in Room 530 which is exactly as per the photographs on their web-site. We had a Balcony on the Fourth Floor and the room was so spacious you could almost lose one another. The Bathroom had toilet, Bidet, Wash Basin, Jacuzzi Bath and Shower with lashings of hot and cold water. The Air Conditioning worked immaculately and was left on all day so that a return to the room was so pleasant after walking around Rome. The Villa San Pio is in an upmarket residential area of Rome (Aventino Hill) and consists of three Villas with lovely gardens. The breakfast is served in the Garden conservatory as is dinner but for no extra charge you could have anything sent to your room. The breakfasts were filling with various juices, yoghurts, cereals, bread and croissants, cheeses, hard boilded eggs and ham. Coupled with this were a mountain of fruits, butter jams, honet and even British marmalade. Every tea or coffee imagineable was available and the staff so helpful and pleasant. As for dinner at night, well apart from being reasonably priced and good value, we had to come back. Our first dinner had the most delicious and huge medium fillet steaks. (That is saying something from one who's home is Aberdeen Angus Country!!) We had asked for veg and potatoes to accompany this (not the Italian Custom) and the veg arrived as the next course. This resulted in profuse apologies and waving of the Wine and Water from the bill. Compared to eating out in Roman restaurants this was the ultimate in quality, service and value so we came back a second night. The reception and general staff are so helpful even down to the chambermaids who supplied fresh linen and towels every day. Every last one spoke English, and some better than this Scot. If you're looking for restaurants outside the Hotel - ask Luigi - aq veritable mine of information. I'm not known for writing rave reviews but this hotel deserves every word of it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Villa San Pio in Aventino, Rome”
Reviews.Author: chris.travelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Villa San Pio on the Aventine Hill area of Rome mid August. It is a 5 minute walk from the bus route or 15 minute from the nearby underground station (which we did not choose to use). It is a lovely tree lined residential neighbourhood with very posh large homes and this gated, charming hotel with 3 buildings and lovely outdoor courtyards is truly beautiful. We loved our 2 large, clean rooms which were extremely quiet and tastefully furnished. The a/c worked perfectly and was quiet. The reception staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast in the atrium or out in the courtyard was a delicious buffet - the best we had in Italy - with lots of fruit, meats, cheeses and baking. The coffee was great. Other guests seemed very pleased with the hotel. The hotel has a dining room but we walked to small reasonable and very good restaurants in the neighbourhood marked on a map that the hotel provided. Its about a 15 minute walk down to Circus Maximus, then not far to the Forum and Colloseum. After being in the city all day the Aventine Hill was a welcome retreat. At the top of the hill are several very ancient churches to see and the famous Knights of Malta Church with the "keyhole" that is a must see. July and August is their low season they said and we found their rates very reasonable for such a lovely hotel. We will go there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukdobby
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, spacious, friendly and helpful staff, had a very god evening meal. Overall a nice retreat after a busy day sightseeing in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus g
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, and highly recommend it for romantic love trips. The service was excellent, and staffs were helpful. About ten minute walk to nearest Metro (Metro Pyramid), and less time for reaching the bus station. All you need is in walking distance (Banks, Public telephone to make long distance calls, and good restaurants). The hotel building is very charming and makes you feel you are in Italy. I love the back yard and very much enjoyed having my breakfast in there. Things I didn’t like were, there was no coffee maker in the room and only one English channel – CNN, which both appears to be very much standard in Italy)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ecossaise
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a room in the Hotel Aventino, the cheaper sister hotel to the San Pio, but on arrival were upgraded to the San Pio. It is a lovely place to stay, in a very quiet, leafy neighbourhood, but still only 10 minutes walk from the Forum, Bocca della Verita etc. We easily walked back from the Spanish Steps, but there are also good public transport links for those who don't fancy the exercise. The room was very comfortable and traditionally decorated without being over fussy. Great bathroom with jacuzzi. Excellent breakfast--one of the best we have had on mainland Europe, taken in the garden, which is lovely. Helpful staff. The real bonus was being being able to walk back at night from the Baths of Caracalla after the opera--given the lack of taxis, if you are thinking of going to the summer opera season, this, or one of its sister hotels, is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh.... Rome!”
Reviews.Author: MickeyAngelo
Reviews.Content: For our 30th wedding anniversary we took a tour of Italy. One stop for 4 days was Rome. A friend suggested we try the Villa San Pio. Our stay was as perfect as one can expect. Good food, good wine, good people, and, of course, wonderful sight seeing; beautiful buildings, art, and women. Ahhh.. the latter especially. The San Pio is convienently located in a wooded hillside above the noise and congestion of the inner city. Its an easy walk to the metro, which got us, with no problems, to the Vatican, the Vatican museum and other attractions in downtown Rome. We even took the Rick Steves nighttime self guided walking tour of Rome, caught the metro back to the hotel with no problems. Walking to the Palintine hill, and the Collesium is easy. There are a lot great resturants within a 10 min walk, we ate at all of them and had a superiously wonderful time. We were so busy exploring other places to eat, we never had a chance to try the hotel dining room, too bad. On the down side, there was a leak in our aircondiionting unit and water accumulated on the floor. The hotel staff quickly moved us to another room with no issues. I found the staff to be helpful but professional, but not overly friendly. But, hey, I just need clean towels and a clear room and Im happy I dont need a chattly desk manager. Everything we asked for they delivered. If I ever go to Rome again, I;ll stay here, its terrirfic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Villa San Pio Hotel is located above the hustle and bustle of Rome in the quiet, upscale, wooded neighborhoods of the Aventino Hill. It is within walking distance of the Coloseum and the Forum, but is somewhat distant from the other attractions of the City. The hotel itself is quite nice...we had a reasonably large corner room with a balcony and a distant view of St. Peters Basilica, so we were very satisfied with the accomodations. The included breakfast buffet was very large and nicely presented, and the dining facilities, both inside and outside were quite lovely. The problem was the front desk staff, which seemed more interested in its own gossiping than it did in assisting the guests. The Villa San Pio is a nice hotel and a good value in Rome, but management ought to provide some customer service training and oversight to staff. So if you don't mind indifferent service, Villa San Pio is a reasonable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant area of Rome, away from the hurly-burly”
Reviews.Author: Romaroma
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly because of the Trip Advisor reviews, and were not disappointed. We had a large elegant room overlooking the garden (didn't have a balcony though). Breakfasts were generous, and the garden setting delightful. Although the front desk staff were helpful, the person who made us feel most welcome was the friendly Filipino man - Adi? Aki? - who always had a smile and seemed to do everything from porter to maitre d'. The shower was a bit eccentric - handheld plus dribbles from above, but everything else was perfect. Had dinner there one night and that was excellent. Would definitely stay again, if money wasn't an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the San Pio!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the San Pio. We had a lovely room with an enclosed balcony overlooking the street. Imagine waking in the morning to the sound of the birds in the trees instead of the traffic in town! Situated on the Aventine Hill it is actually very close to many amenities and I enjoyed walking to and from the hotel to the tourist sites. A BIG plus is that the most exciting part of Rome, (for us gastronomic ones) the Trastevere is simply within walking distance. The room service was speedy, great and wonderful when you have a big smile that comes with the tray - absolutely free!! The staff are proficient in English and really friendly. The restaurant staff go out of their way to make your day start of on a good note in the mornings. The evening meals were of a high standard as well. Congratulations! I threw my coin into the Trevi Fountain and hope to be back in Rome again soon. I will most certainly use this wonderful hotel again. It has been voted as one of the "Most romantic hotels in the world" and I agree wholeheartedly. Keep up the good work guys.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom2dnz
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Villa S. Pio. The grounds are beautiful, the room was very large and immaculate. The staff was great. Breakfast was bountiful and delicious! I loved the little heart that was made in my cappuccino! We enjoyed the peace and quiet of this lovely hotel. It is a bit of a walk to the sights, but the added workout kept me from gaining any weight on this food and wine filled vacation! Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corbeiroa
Reviews.Content: Villa San Pio is a very good hotel. It was my fifth time in Rome and it is almost the best hotel I´ve visited in this city. The location is very good but not for the very first time in the city. For us, it was very very quiet, a little far of the center, but only twenty minutes from Trastevere, our favourite neiborhood. We had dinner in Trastevere and them we walked a little “paseggiatta” to the hotel. Perfect. The room was spacious enough and our bathroom was a little small but very pretty. The garden, where is located the restaurant, is the best of the hotel for me. In May is marvellous take breakfast in a table smelling the flowers of the oranges. The buffet breakfast was ok. The Ostiense Train Station is very near and the Piramide Metro Station too, only a few minutes. It allows an access to the center of the city without problems. Totally recomendable!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location and Peaceful Setting”
Reviews.Author: Epags
Reviews.Content: We had a garden room (number 283) with a small patio. Everything was very satisfactory except for ants in the bathroom and a lack of a screen on the bathroom window (potential for mosquitoes later in the year. Service was excellent as was the breakfast selection and setting.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikkikraft
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. It's wonderful to stay in a more residential area although it is out of the way for walking to sites. We took taxis everywhere. The dining was hit or miss with dinner - we weren't served everything we ordered. Breakfast was passable. The rooms were great. The location is what makes this one a star for me. Better than staying in the hustle and bustle of downtown Rome. The room is adequately decorated. If you spend any time in the room, the tiny TV's are funny. We were told you would have internet access but found that we had to pay for it. The front desk wasn't as helpful as other Italian hotels we stayed at - but answered all questions..although not going out of their way to do anything for you. Beds comfortable and the bathrooms are beautiful! Make sure you walk around the neighborhood and find all the cats as well as the wonderful church at the top of the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kiwi6
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hotel Villa San Pio. To start with the check in gentleman was most helpful (Luigi) We stayed in a room that was big enough for my husband and I and our two grown up children. Good sized room, with a good bathroom. Parking was provided in a locked-up area at no charge. Our only complaints about the room was that it was a little tired and really need decorating. The bed really needed to be seen to as it was very noisy when either my husband or I turned over. The bathroom door also needed some tender loving care as it didn't close very well. My opinion would be that this would be a 3 star hotel. It provided a very good breakfast included in the tariff. Nice quiet location. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “The Delightful Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: flosssy
Reviews.Content: A really charming hotel - beautiful gardens, elegant, spacious rooms and a nice location in a smart residential area which was close enough to the city centre to make you feel part of Roma. We felt like we were staying somewhere Italian, rather than in an Americanised version of Italy. We had a lovely room overlooking the courtyard. The bed was huge, if a little on the firm side! Staff, with the exception of one of the lady receptionists, were friendly and accommodating. A problem with the shower was fixed quickly. Breakfast was plentiful and served in the dining area - rolls, croissants, cold meats, fruit, cereals, yoghurts, fruit juice and, oddly, cake! Easy walking distance to the underground rail system and to local restaurants and taxis were inexpensive and plentiful. Make sure you have the address of the hotel written down and, if possible, it marked on a street map - we found lots of taxi drivers couldn't find it! Weather was glorious and it was a memorable trip. Have already recommended to friends and family who stayed here in February and loved it too. Excellent value for money - would be three times the price if it were in the centro storico.

Reviews.Title: “most uncomfortable stay for very long time in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok - so we booked last minute and the "rate" was reduced, but so was the size of the room!!! 296 - not a good room - extremely small. No functioning air con - they only had heating at this time of year, with temp at easter of approx 19-20 degrees outside, it was thus cooler and more refreshing outside than in our room. The mattress on the bed was appalling, every movement was amplified 10 fold, thus myself and partner had terrible nights sleep in this double bed. Oh yes, the gardens are lovely etc, but get the basics right first in your "3 *" hotel before you start feeling justified charging 200+ euros a night for a very uncomfortable room!! Breakfast is a bit "quantity over quality" at the buffet. I'm going modern the next time - at least u can get a decent nites sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: When_is_next_trip
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels that I have stayed in anywhere. The room that we had for my small family of 3 was spacious, spotless and quiet, with the largest double bed I have ever slept in. The included buffet breakfast was delicious. The position of the hotel is excellent, quiet, safe and very green - surrounded by the gardens of all the neighbouring large houses and villas, but within easy walking distance of the circus maximus and the colloseum.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Indy
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the Hotel Villa san Pio. It's location (Aventine Hill, a short walk from the Pyramid Metro stop) was convenient to all of the tourist attractions, yet set in a very relaxed and lovely neighborhood. We never paid more than 15 euros for a taxi ride to any of the tourist locations, all the way up to the Stadio Olimpico. The value is also excellent. There are two buildings in the Villa san Pio compound, sharing a short, winding walkway through a pretty garden area. We had one room in the main building, and one in the building set back from the street. The 2nd building also houses the restaurant - where the complimentary and very nice breakfasts are served. Rooms are VERY spacious, with plenty of storage space and very nice, clean, and well-appointed bathrooms. We were shocked at the low rates we paid for the quality of the facility. The room in the 2nd building didn't have a balcony, and was a little smaller than our room in the main building. The room in the main building had a wonderful, large balcony overlooking the oak and sycamore lined street. There are terraces on both roofs, although the one on the main building is far nicer and affords excellent views of Rome. The rooms are clean and well appointed, but appear to have gone about 3 or 4 years without being refreshed. The rooms could probably use a fresh coat of paint and the beds and bed linens were not quite top quality. They were nice - just not four or five star material. Internet connections are easily accessible (ethernet cables in the room, wireless connection in the main lobby), but cost about 12 euros per day. The service received was outstanding. Our stay here was part of a 3 week Barcelona & Italy 25th anniversary vacation. Our two children were to come to Rome to surprise my wife and to stay with us for the remaining 10 days in Italy. The staff at the Villa san Pio went well beyond the call of duty in helping me to arrange the surprise. Luigi purchased four (outstanding!) tickets for the SS Lazio v. Empoli soccer match, arranged for my two children to arrive at the Villa san Pio one night before we did, and for them to meet us at the stadium. All while preserving the surprise for my wife. Luigi and the Villa san Pio staff carried this off beautifully, adding touches that I hadn't asked for that helped make the surprise better (and easier for the kids to carry-out). And the surprise was complete! Thanks Villa san Pio! The Aventine Hill is a very calm, residential area, consisting of large luxurious appearing homes. The neighborhood reminded me very much of homes in the wealthier sections of Pasadena, California (the climate too ...). Walks down the hill to the Metro station (or the ATM or a pizza joint ...) were very pleasant strolls - the hill is not steep at all. Traffic in the immediate area is a very relaxing break from the crazed traffic of the rest of Rome. One warning, the elevators may be the slowest we've ever experienced (and are quite small). Fortunately, there are only five floors in either building - you WILL beat the elevators by walking, even at a modest pace. The complimentary breakfasts have a larger than expected selection of breads, rolls/muffins, cereals, wonderful selections of fruits, breakfast meats & cheeses, and a normal array of items that may be purchased (omelets, waffles, etc.). The restaurant area is very nicely appointed with views of the lush garden areas of the compound. Get a room in the main building with a balcony. The balconies are HUGE, and are a great place to sit, sip a beverage, and talk about what you have done or plan to do. Assuming the weather is nice, you'll only have the sun in your face, hear the chirping of birds and the rustle of leaves, and the occasional barking of a neighborhood dog or the sound of children playing. This is a wonderful hotel, a surprising oasis in amid the history, chaos, and bustle of Rome. And it is a shocking value compared to the other hotels we've stayed in. You'll pay low to mid-level rates for a 3+ to 4 star hotel. We heartily recommend it to all except those who are looking for the absolute highest quality accommodations - and this is only a notch down from that level.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing - Great place away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: Falcon20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after a 5 day business trip in Hamburg, Germany so I was looking forward to the 3 day vacation in Rome. We could not have been more pleased. It's a charming, quiet, clean hotel that's nestled in a residential neighborhood near the Pyramid station. It's very quiet at night and the accomodations (we had a double room)were perfectly fine. Rather large bed, new modern bathroom, high-speed internet connection yet the decor had a definite Italian flavor to it. There is a nice garden area with flowers ablaze as you walk to the restaurant for breakfast in the glass tea room. The hotel staff was very accomodating and spoke english fluently. Only drawback is transportation as it's a 5 minute walk to the bus stop or a 10 minute walk to either the Pyramid subway or Circus Maximus subway. All-in-all, a very, very nice stay and would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “The Weather was Cold”
Reviews.Author: pat2
Reviews.Content: This was really the only problem. The hotel was as good as everyone says, lovely residential area, 5 minutes walk to the buses with relatively little dog(--) underfoot compared to many European cities, about 15 minutes walk to Ostiense station to and from the airport (quicker and cheaper than a cab and you dont get ripped off). The hotel restaurant is in fact very good surrounded by orange and lemon trees and the included buffet breakfast has everything you could need and more. Great view from the roof, helpful multilingual staff who read these reviews and so are on their toes, reasonable prices, spotless. And a pleasant surprise Italy has gone no-smoking in bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but watch out.........”
Reviews.Author: numpty
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, I can see why it would be considered romantic, but watch out for ROOM 302, avoid it at all cost. The entrance door can't fully open because it hits the table, you have to walk sideways to get past the foot of the bed, the wardrobe door hits the bed and the window hits the wardrobe, but it's not worth opening the window because it looks onto the plant room and the staff smoking. I wanted a single room, and it would probably be okay if it had a single bed, but they have squeezed a double bed in so they obviously let it as a double. I would not accept this room if I booked a double room, I would go elsewhere.( But how much time do you want to spend in a hotel room when you are in Rome.....your call?) The new restaurant is okay, if a little pretencious and expensive, it looks more like an experiment. Location is good and nice safe area, some good restaurants within walking distance. I would stay here again but not the dreaded 302

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room, big bathroom, very comfortable bed, excellent dinner”
Reviews.Author: sheakettel
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of trip advisor reviews and once again found them to be exactly right. We were especially surprised at the size of the room and bath. Much bigger than we had come to expect from reading about Europe. Also a dinner there proved that Italian food doesn't just have to be about pasta. We had the best filet of beef we have had in a long time. A quick walk down hill brings you to many different bus options. Also you have a pharmacy to purchase any needed items. We went over to Testevere many times to eat and the bus lines make the trip very easy. We also walked to the Colosseum and Circus Maximus.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sn196
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a surprise for my wife on our 1 year anniversary.
