I told her that we were going to snowy Scotland but she found out the truth when we went to the Rome check in desk.....anyway. From the moment we stepped in the cab we knew we choose the rite Hotel. The cabbie told us that we choose the best part of Rome to stay in and said that the area was the quietest around. We arrived outside with a greeting from the very friendly Porter. Our room was not ready as we were to check in at 12:00 so we decided to leave our baggage and take a walk down to the Colleseum. When we got back my Wife was in shock at how nice the room was, Clean, Tidy and well equipped. The breakfast was OK but we only woke up for it once so cannot comment further. The hotel is in walking distance from quite a few of the major sites in Rome but if you don’t fancy walking the bus stop is not far. Try and have a meal at night in front of the Pantheon, it is the most romantic setting, live music, lovely food but a bit expensive. Also climb to the top of St Peters Dome, 320 steps but is a great experience, especially when you get to the staircase with the rope to help you out!! I definitely recommend the Villa San Pio and we will be going back next year. I have attached some pics we took, none of the hotel, that’s on our camcorder.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and quiet oasis in a chaotic city”
Reviews.Author: wine4more
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the quiet neighborhood in the Aventino area surrounding the Villa San Pio, we knew this was the type of hotel we were hoping for. I was traveling to Rome with my two children (ages 13 and 8). Our flight arrived mid morning and we went directly to the hotel to drop off our luggage. We were greeted with kindness and professionalism. We had a very nice, spacious room with three beds. Our room (503) also had a large terrace with a table and chairs and many plants all around. If the weather had been a bit warmer, we would have spent our evenings on the terrace. The breakfast was a cold buffett that was plentiful to start the day. Overall, the staff in every part of the hotel was wonderful. We can definetly recommend the Villa San Pio and will stay again when in Rome. The Hotel is approx. 8 blocks from both metro stops Circo Massimo and Piramide. Even though we were in a neightborhood setting, the hotel is only a few blocks from an area with several nice tratorrias and cafes. We were able to walk along the river into the city center easily. The Coluseum was within walking distance, with gardens and sites along the way. The hotel staff was helpful with bus tickets to the catacombs and the bus is only a few blocks away on the Viale Aventino.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Nice”
Reviews.Author: FerndalePeter
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for six nights and loved it. Spacious room, quiet, but with all the things to do in Rome within walking distance - more or less. They had just opened a restaurant on the premises and I had a delicious italian dinner one night. Breakfast buffet is included, plenty with a good variety of dishes. The best part, however, were the staff...friendly, acommodating from start to finish. Highly recommended when in Rome and you don't want to deal with screaming kids or loud tourist groups.

Reviews.Title: “A great option”
Reviews.Author: amm1u
Reviews.Content: As most other reviewers have said, this is a very pleasant and comfortable hotel, although it's probably fair to emphasise that it is NOT 5 stars - it is an excellent 3 star hotel with some luxurious aspects. The rooms are of an extremely high standard, being spacious and nicely furnished, as are the bathrooms. The breakfast buffet was excellent and the restaurant set round the garden is extremely pretty. The location is perfect if you want to be away from the hustle and bustle, but it's not too isolated. 15-20 minutes walk from the Collosseum, 10 minutes downhill from Metro and bus stops and about the same to a variety of good restaurants. We can agree with the recommendation of La Bucatina, although go before 8pm if you haven't booked, while the nearby Il Cantinino is more informal option. We found the best transport option was to take the 23 bus from Marmorata at the bottom of the hill - it takes around 20 minutes to follow the river into the centre of the city, before crossing to pass the Vatican and its museums. The only slight negatives are that the bar area is not that cosy, while although service is generally helpful and efficient, the staff can seem rather off hand at times. Overall though, a highly recommened option and we would certainly return if in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Quiet, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ageprof
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Hotel San Pio last August. We were looking for a quiet, charming hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Rome, yet accessible to everything. And that is just what we found! The room was large enough for our two teenage girls to have their own sleeping (and television) area, while we had ours. The gardens are lovely, and provide a much-needed oasis upon return from a day at the Vatican, etc. The extensive breakfast was accompanied by classical music wafting through the gardens, as we ate our meal sitting at a table amidst the trees. Everything about the hotel was just lovely, and an absolute steal at the 150-euro price we paid. This was by far the nicest hotel we stayed at in all of Italy, and the best value for the money. Also, there are great local restaurants nearby. As others have noted, Il Bucatino was terrific - particularly memorable was the extensive antipasto buffet, complete with dozens of platters of fish, meats, local vegetables, tomatoes, etc. Those who want to be in the midst of the Rome tourist scene can stay near the Spanish Steps. For the rest of us, there are special retreats such as the Villa San Pio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve&Ruth
Reviews.Content: The San Pio is in a quite locatation about a 15 minute walk from the Coloseum and central Rome. The property is well cared for and the public rooms and dining area are first rate. Breakfasts where good plenty of fresh fruit, bread,and cereals. We had a very good evening meal in the restaurant after a heavy days walking and can reccomend. Rooms and bathrooms are spotless and for the rate we paid 90 euros through venere represents great value. The reception staff could be a bit more warm, but the overall view is of a well run quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WTCS
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at very short notice and got a great deal for a one-night stay. Despite a few hitches in finding the hotel (which did, however give us an entertaining and informative tour of the ring road and suburbs) we arrived to a friendly welcome and joy of joys – free secure parking. This is on a first come, first served basis, but street parking is also plentiful. While the hotel is not in the center of town, Rome is fairly manageable on foot and the twenty-minute walk to the center of the city is a pleasant one taking in the Circus Maximus, Colosseum and Victor Emmanuel monument. Alternatively the Circo Massimo metro station (or Piramide) is only a five or six minutes stroll away. The Aventine hill on which the hotel is situated is a quiet and leafy residential area and after the frenetic center it is wonderful to get a good night’s sleep and wake up to birdsong rather than deliveries and what sounds like somebody repeatedly dropping a steel drum on the pavement just for fun. The restaurants of Trastevere are a ten-minute walk away and taxis are plentiful for the journey home when one is feeling well fed and a little less agile. The hotel itself is rather grand for a three star establishment and the rooms have large comfortable beds, mini bars and clean, well-equipped bathrooms. Some have balconies and although ours didn’t it was still light and airy. A final remark is that the breakfast is varied and plentiful which is most unusual for this part of the world. Despite being very fussy generally, I can’t fault the place – highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super, quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: no818528
Reviews.Content: Decided very late on to take the family to Rome. I done a little homework and ended up being housed at the magnificent Hotel San Pio. At first we were given a room with a balcony that was on the smallside, but views of the small courtyard made it work. The staff were all very pleasant, and spoke English very well. They could not do enough for us. I am fortunate that I get to travel to Europe on a regular basis. Should you be visiting Rome, I would strongly recommend the Hotel San Pio. My one down comment about the San Pio is that they have a sister hotel (Anselmo?) about 100 yards away which has just opened after refurbishment. The hotel staff gave me a guided tour and although it may be a little more expensive than the San Pio, I would try to stay there to enjoy the luxuries that it has. It is classy. Regardless, they are both magnificent quaint hotels that I would not hesitate to use in the future. You cannot go wrong by booking either of these hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ThatDavison
Reviews.Content: I booked the Villa San Pio as a romantic break for my partner and I. What she didnt know was I was going to go down on one knee in the Pantheon and ask her to marry me!!! We arrived on 29th Nov and used romeshuttlelimousine's for our transfers. They were brilliant. I totally recommend them. The drivers were professional, courteous, english speaking, aided us with our cases, were early both on arrival and departing and had good executive cars. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by the counter staff who were very friendly even though busy. We were taken to our room by the bell boy, who again was courteous and cheery. The hotel is set in its own lovely grounds and comprises of three seperate buildings ajoined by a covered walkway. Our room was 271 and was on the 4th floor of the 3rd building. The hotel has a lift(very new looking)thankfully. On opening the room the bell boy showed us how to work the airconditioner and the private safe. The room was tastefully decorated with stenciled fresco's and pastel colours. The wooden floors, antique style furniture and nice throws gave it a luxury feel. The robes were ample and lit inside. The bed was simply enormous!! The bathroom was marble and had power shower AND jacuzi bath big enough for two...... that was soooo nice after a long day on your feet. The location is brillaint. Its a 10 minute walk to the Circus Maximus and about 20 minutes to the Vittorio Emmanuel Monument. When you return after a hard days sight seeing and shopping its so quiet and tranquil. Its a very safe district and there are some nice restaurants within 10 minutes walk. We highly recommend Perrlli (very traditional Roman) and Il Bucatino (Fantastic menu, nice setting and great food). The hotel breakfast is as good as you'll get in any european hotel and the breakfast room is a lovely place to start the day. The hotel staff were really friendly and cheerful. We made a couple of requests of the concierge's that they need not have done, but they did it without question. I think in Britain or Paris you'd be charged or get a total look of disgust until you did it yourself! However, it was not 100% perfect. Our ONLY two gripes were that on arrival a patch of the bathroom floor was wet and on having our first jacuzi, the bath leaked quite badly, and that the bathroom window was broken. On reporting it, the maid was up within 5 minutes and left extra towels both days until it could be fixed. All in all this hotel was fantastic and we WILL stay here again. It is ideal for the independant traveller, the romantic and those that enjoy not having to rough it so much! Oh and the hotel cat is lovely....

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: BorisMcWhirter
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited Rome for the first time and stayed at Villa San Pio for three nights during November 2005. I chose the hotel based on all the reviews on this site. Our room was on the 4th floor, on entering the room we were very happy, it more than met our expectations. The room had double doors opening onto a large private terrace, we had a king size bed, the room was a decent size and well apointed, the bathroom was clean, modern and had good water pressure from the shower. The staff at the hotel were very friendly, in particular the bellboy who stands at the front of the hotel each day greeting guests and also the little guy with a big smile who works from 3pm-10pm each day at the bar. The location of the hotel is out of the city centre, we actually liked this fact about the hotel. On our first morning we walked to the Coliseum (about 20 mins walk) then through the Forum and up to the Trevi Fountain, we then walked back across to the Pantheon, walked around the Piazza Navona and then Campo de Fiori and then we made our way back to the hotel along the River Tiber. Now it was some walking but we both really enjoyed it. The next day we went to the Vatican, we got a bus ticket from hotel reception for 1 euro each and walked down the hill from the hotel and caught the No 23 bus directly to the Vatican and then back again later in the day, the hotel staff will point you in the exact direction for the bus, its a 10 min walk from the hotel. The surrounding suburbs near the hotel Testaccio and Trastevere offer very cheap and tasty meals along with well priced wine and beer compared to the city centre area of Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori. The hotel breakfast is typical of continental europe, breads,cereal,hams,cheese etc, not really my fancy, but their cuppachino's are fantastic! If/When we go back to Rome we will stay at the San Pio again. At 140 Euro per night we believe it to be the best value hotel we have stayed in Europe! (Although it was off-peak November rates)

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: lalyssa
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here during our honeymoon in italy in september. i felt the the hotel was just okay. it definitly had that business hotel feel, like it is a fancy hotel for those in Rome on business. it had a sort of cold feel to it and the front desk peaople were not big on polite customer service. i would say it is a good choice for someone who is not concerned about quaintness or pluch 5- star surroundings. that said the neighborhood is quite nice, yet far from all the sites. we rented a scooter in addition to the car we had rented--too far to enjoy walking anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rome and quiet?”
Reviews.Author: yankel
Reviews.Content: as many have said - this hotel is in an excellent location. a quiet residential neighborhood but a short cab or metro ride to the center or Rome. the quiet at the end of the day and the very attentive staff made hectic Rome almost relaxing. be sure to walk to the park at the top of the hill late afternoon or for sunset for views of the city including St Peter's. If you like adventure for Dinner, or you want to pick up a picnic, walk to Volpetti on Via Aventino. It's what a deli should be. the guys behind the counter are great salesmen - asking you to taste everything - which you then have to buy because it is all so delicious.

Reviews.Title: “the only place to stay in rome...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went in september on our honeymoon because we saw the wonderful reviews of this place on tripadvisor and wow was every comment right on the money!!!!!! It was the most romantic place to be in Rome for sure... we had our own terrace and were treated so well by the staff. There is a place to get wine and cheese down the hill that has been rated one of the best cheese/meat/wine in Italy... wonderful to buy after a long day in Rome and go to your terrace to enjoy! We loved this place so much that we stayed two extra nights there. We will go there again and again for sure;) the breakfast is free and wonderful!! You are just close enough and just far enough away from downtown Rome... It was such a pleasant place to be...

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a Hotel that is in a quiet location but near enough to the main sights. The Metro of Circo Massimo is only a 10 minute walk from the Hotel. The double room (266) that we stayed in, was well appointed and modern, but with an old world charm, with stand alone furniture and frescos on the wall. There is a mini bar and safe in the room. The room also has its own whirlpool bath and shower. Breakfasts were Continental and plenty of it. Fruit, cereals, croissants, toast, eggs, cheeses, meats youghurt jams etc. The dining room is in the conservatory. This is perfect for starting your day, as it is surrounded by a tranquil leafy glade. In fact the Hotel is situated in a leafy glade. You wouldn't think you were close to busy central Rome. The reception staff and waiters are helpful and speak good English. We didn't have dinner in the Hotel but the menu looked quite good. The setting once again is the Conservatory, which is also candle lit. There is a pleasant recepetion area and a small lounge come bar area, if you want to stay out of your room and read the papers. For those of you who are thinking about getting to and from the airports. The Hotel is more than happy to arrange a private transfer - all you do is pay the driver. A 10% tip is about the going rate. If you are keen on maximising the time that you have, and need a taxi first thing in the morning. Book it the night before. There is usually a line of people waiting to get one. You could end up waiting quite a bit, as the Hotels' location is out of the way. If I was to come back to Rome, I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Villa Hotel- Centrally located!!!”
Reviews.Author: torontosaurusrex
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing short of an oasis in the middle of Rome. We loved how the hotel was tastefully decorated with antiques and had a clean charm to it. The neighbourhood is great--the hotel did a nice job in recommending local trattorias which had great food and were not in the "touristy-part" of the city. In any event, it is a short walk (15-20 minutes) to the Colosseum and is only a 7 minute walk to the nearest subway stations (seemed to be closest to both Circo Massimo and Pyramide). Our only complaint was that it was really difficult to find from the Termini station, as many of the cab drivers did not know where the hotel was and were looking to charge 60 euros to go to the hotel. As a word of advice, we would recommend getting off at the Ostiense Station if you are coming in by train and taking the 5 minute cab ride (about 10 euros) to the station. It is much more civilized!

Reviews.Title: “101 Reasons to stay at Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: Saskatonian
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Villa San Pio, Rome, in late August this year. From the second we arrived, we felt pampered by the professional and fluent staff. We had requested a triple room with a terrace via email before we left, and the hotel promptly responded although they stated they could not guarantee a terrace. Well, the room they gave us was well beyond our expectation for a European hotel room. If you want the best room with a fabulous view of the neighbourhood and the basilica nearby, then request room 530. The terrace was wrap around, with tables and chairs to sit on outside to view the leafy street below. And we only paid $189EU / night when we booked online (this was the peak of tourist season) Even though it was technically a smoking room, we could not smell a thing. Why smoke inside there is such a nice terrace. The bathroom was spacious with marble and acuzzi tub. Unfortunately the jets weren't working during our 3 night stay. However they did sent someone to look at it and they didn't just dismiss our claim. We were so happy with the rest of the hotel that we didn't dream of kicking up a fuss. We had heard about Rome's famous heat, but we were treated to fabulous weather. It was warm, but not stifling, with only the odd shower that lasted for a few minutes. The air conditioning in the room worked extremely well, in fact it almost got cold when it was on. The A/C here was not just a fan, as we had discovered at other hotels. Also, a safe and a nice wardrobe. There was FREE internet access in the room! What a treat after being disconnected for the 2 weeks prior. Like many hotels the Villa San Pio offered a free breakfast along with our terrific rate. Wow, what a fantastic deal. The servers make your coffee/tea/cappuccino/hot chocolate to your taste, and it is just as good as that in any coffee shop. The food was a veritable bounty of croissants, buns, pastries, cakes, fruit, eggs, yogart, cereal, cheese, fresh meat, juice... We couldn't believe that they were able to offer such selection without charging the same inflated prices as the other hotels we stayed at in France and Italy. PLUS, one of the best parts about staying in this hotel was the dining area. You could eat inside or on the terrace under the umbrella to shield the sun. The garden was absolutely beautiful, and so calming. It felt like you were eating on your own patio at home, if your backyard if professionally landscaped. The resident cat, who we called "Francesca" because the server didn't know her name, was SO friendly and sociable. Who can resist a place that comes with a hotel cat? We dined at the hotel for 2 of our 3 evenings there, and there was a great selection of dishes (although no pizza, which we found at a nearby restaurant). Aside from the well-appointed rooms and lobby, the staff were unbelievably professional. All of them were fluent in English, which helped us with our minimal knowledge of Italian. They were able to reccommend the nicest little restaurant in the area that had terrific prices (especially compared to those in the tourist areas) and the treat of seeing how the true Italians dine. The concierge also helped us buy the $4 EU passes to take the bus/metro all day. Much better than spending individual fares. The bellhop was very friendly and jumped to attention the minute we were in sight of the hotel. You couldn't ask for better service here. If you want to stay in an oasis away from the noisy, crowded, overpriced tourist areas then book at Villa San Pio! The neighbourhood was gracious and very safe. We never felt scared even walking at night to visit the local restaurants and the bus stop a few blocks away. Walking along streets lined with lemon and palm trees is an experience unto itself. This is a destination hotel, not just a place to sleep. We will definitely be staying here when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Even better!”
Reviews.Author: Ealasaid
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for a trip to Rome. Wonderful location, away from the sirens and fumes yet within minutes of getting to the attractions Rome offers. Waken to the sound of birds in the garden and, if you are lucky, enjoy your breakfast in the sun on the terraces. Immaculate rooms, wonderful staff - and that includes the front desk. Luigi you are a star. Lucy, Donald and all the others who looked after us - thank you. Our 20+ daughter who hitched in at the last minute was originally unimpressed by our selection. 'Not in the centre? That's a mistake.' Spoken from her experience of a recent week in Rome in a 4* central hotel. Now ask her and she'll tell you the Villa San Pio makes Rome extra special and would never stay anywhere else. The 'Angels' were great too. Patrick took us to Ostia Antica - a fantastic trip. Jenny was our wonderful guide at The Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming & romantic..........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at Hotel Villa San Pio. It was my husbands 30th Birthday and the trip to Rome was a surprise I had spent weeks organising! I had e-mailed the hotel beforehand to ask for a room with a terrace and for champagne and flowers to be in the room on our arrival. The hotel were prompt with their replies but did say that they couldn't guarantee a terrace. When we arrived our room (530) was on the fourth floor with a huge terrace and a romatic view of St Peter's! Champagne and flowers were also there as requested. The room itself was large, beautifully decorated and very clean. The bathroom was marble with a beautiful jacuzzi bath which provided much needed relief after a busy day sightseeing in Rome. The location is a little way out of the centre of Rome but taxi's were only 5-10 Euro's. The hotel is in a nice quiet residential area but local shops and bars are only a few minutes walk away. Our friends who came with us were staying at a hotel right in the centre which was more convenient for the sights but was much more noisy at night. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and their restaurant recommendations were fabulous! We didn't eat at the hotel except for breakfast - which is served on a beautiful terrace. Breakfast was the usual - fruit, cereal, cheses, meats, bread etc with as much coffee as you can drink. Rome itself is a fabulous city with so much to see and do and Hotel Villa San Pio is a romantic oasis - a perfect place to stay to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Oro
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at this hotel 2 nights. What a great place and the owners & staff were fabulous! We stayed in room 115 on the 2nd floor right across from the dining room. The room included breakfast which was wonderful, great omelets and the fruit and cappuchino was excellent. This hotel was right next to Peggy Guigenheim Museum(sp) across the water a little ways from San Marco Square. It is best to hire a private water taxi from the airport and go direct to the hotel instead of using the main boats, otherwise you have to drag your luggage around several times. We ate at a restaurant call Lineadombra on the water. Go out the front entrance, up the stairs and walk across to the first alley on the left. The sunset, food and wine was great, but a little pricey. We found a little cafe that had beer, wine and food to the right of the hotel called Bar Abbazia, very resonable and the waiter was very informative. I would highly recommend this jewel of a hotel to anyone. It was in a quiet, nice, safe residential area.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimramtrout
Reviews.Content: I am a regular user of the trip advisor review site and again I was not let down. I took my family here..adjacent rooms just €100 per night each room. Room decor was excellent with hand painted furniture and frescoed walls. Bathrooms were marble and beautiful. One room smelt smokey but both were very clean. Hotel staff friendly and helpfull. Good quality buffet breakfast in open air in the courtyard or dining room if raining. €5-10yr cab fare into town..with cabs appearing promptly at the Front desks request. Walk to colleseum in 20mins. hotel set in a suburb similar to London's hampstead..wealthy,quiet and leafy. Hotel-recommended local restaurants were excellent and good value. Travertine dining area full of life but felt a bit threatening at the edges..similar to any big town. I have no hesitation recommending hotel Vila san Pio.

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Villa Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pegasus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 nights in the Villa San Pio, last week of August '05. This romantic Hotel consists of several four storey villas in a beautiful common garden, it is a very well run hotel of three star quality. There are several charming rooms with balcony or small terrace some of which offer excellent roof top views. Rooms are furnished in a period style and linens are excellent although no robes are provided. The bar/restaurant staff are exceptionally pleasant and cheerful, the breakfast, served on the garden terrace, is an above average italian cold buffet with a particularly excellent range of fresh fruit dishes. Room service is available without charge. The Restaurant serves an 'a la carte' menu in the evening, useful if you want to relax, the fare is average however the wines and deserts are very good. The Hotel location is in a maze of residential streets on the Aventine Hill between the river and Circus Maximus, it is possible to wander into the centre of the city (Piazza Venizia 20 mins) or across to Trastevere on foot, but a taxi (average 10 euro) is essential in the evenings. It is always a good sign when a Hotel such as this, is of a standard to enable you to take a day off from sightseeing and spent it pleasantly relaxing, with a romantic dinner in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: charlievic
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel based on all the reviews posted on this site - the hotel was excellet value for money - the staff were very heplful and pleasant - the room was decorated to a high standard. It was approximately a 5 min walk from the pyramide metro station - the beauty of this hotel was that it was in a residential area which was very quiet and made a lovely change from the hussle and bussle of rome during the day. At no time did we feel unsafe walking the side streets and there are some lovely areas close by to visit. Will be recommeding this hotel to any friends who will be visiting rome.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Wimbledontraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in August and loved it. When I booked the hotel, I requested a room with a view and a large double bed. When we checked in we weren’t disappointed! We had a huge balcony complete with table and chairs to sit out and enjoy. The room was a very good size and well equipped (the mini bar prices were even reasonable!) We loved the location. It’s in a very residential area but on a lovely tree-lined street and there are a number of excellent restaurants in the area away from all the tourists! The hotel is also a short walk to the metro station (Piramide) and convenient for getting the train in from the airport (Ostiense station). The hotel gardens were beautiful and great to have breakfast in in the mornings or to enjoy a drink in the evening. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the hotel felt really quite unique. We felt that this hotel was very good value for money and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Location, Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our first night in Rome. We were on our honeymoon. While the hotel was fine (smoky smelling but that's Rome,) the location was awful! It is in the middle of a residential area and it is easy to make a wrong turn around a corner and suddenly feel as if you are in a very bad neighborhood. Considering some of the nearby neighborhoods we walked through, Hotel Villa San Pio's surrounding neighborhood wasn't *that* bad, but there was still a lot of trash on the sidewalks and graffiti on the surrounding buildings. We had a short stay in Rome and taking our first walk-about with this place as our starting point left a very bad impression of the city on us.

Reviews.Title: “Definition of tranquil !”
Reviews.Author: Balraj
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay and were grateful to the pleasant room and the peaceful surroundings, with the convenience of being very close to the centre of Rome. The breakfast was excellent and the staff very helpful. As I stay in hotels very regularly for my job I was very pleased to get something different to the usual 'corporate' style hotels, and there was a real feeling of being in a 'villa' especially with the lemon trees and other beautiful plants in the garden. We will certainly stay here again next time we visit Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Villa San Pio- best hotel on trip”
Reviews.Author: rihoward
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks travelling around Italy and Hotel Villa San Pio was the best hotel for our euro. Excellent sized, clean rooms, internet access, good breakfast, excellent quiet location, yet only ten minutes on the bus tot he city centre and above all their staff were as friendly as could be. The only point I would say is that we found it hard to find the first time and I'd recommend getting a taxi to it, when you first arrive in Rome as it can be hard to carry bags in that kind of heat. Will definitely stay there when in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to all the great reviews!”
Reviews.Author: GabyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a short stay at Hotel Villa San Pio, and all the other reviewers were absolutely right! Our rooms were lovely, breakfast was great, and we loved the location- close to major sites, but still a pretty, quite neighborhood. The staff was helpful, and parking was easy. On the whole, it was a great stay, and probably the best value of our two week stay in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: AgathaP
Reviews.Content: Single female stayed in the hotel for in July 2005. Hotel is located on the Aventine hills, so its a more peaceful, green location than the city centre. Its a nice walk from the "centre" of Rome, along the river, or alternatively, the metro stations are very close. Room lovely, well decorated, but only shower, no bath. Best feature of the hotel is definitely the gardens, beautiful, and the outside dining in the evenings by candle-light is wonderful. Food excellent too! As stated by other reviewers, staff can be somewhat unfriendly, but I only found this in terms of the reception staff, restaurant staff were very pleasant. Overall, I would stay there again, and will certainly be recommending it to all friends.

Reviews.Title: “As good as everyone says.”
Reviews.Author: JB1350
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend and walked our socks off. What a pleasure therefore to return each afternoon to such an oasis of peace and calm. Beautiful gardens to sit and relax with a cold beer and rest our weary feet. Good restaurants within easy walking distance ( We'd recommend Il Cantinone on Piazza Testaccio- ask at hotel reception and they'll provide a map of recommended restaurants nearby) This is a very very good 3 star hotel that would satisfy even the most fastidious customer. And while I remember we used romeshuttlelimousine for our transfers.Booked and confirmed over the internet, 35 Euro each way. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and an even better value!”
Reviews.Author: Stroopwaffel
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old son and I just spent 4 days at this wonderful hotel. I won’t repeat all the good things that have been said about it (which were all true by the way) but I will try to add something new. The Hotel is ideally situated on the Aventine Hill. I say ideally because if you care for peace and quite after a long day of sightseeing – this place is what you are looking for. While it’s not in the center of town – it isn’t far from the usual tourist attractions. You can walk to the Spanish Steps or the Vatican in 45 minutes or pay the 8 euro cab fare. Yes the restaurant is a little on the expensive side (yummy tiramisu) and yes the showers are smaller than your average two door refrigerator (by US standards) but you will be hard pressed to find a better value in Rome than this Hotel. The front desk staff was helpful and the cleaning crew paid attention to detail. At 100 euro per night, in July, I have nothing but good things to say about this place. I look forward to the day when we return and to the wonderful evening views of Rome from the Hotel's terrace.

Reviews.Title: “The standard by which Rome hotels should be judged”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How do my wife and I love the Villa San Pio? Let me count the ways: 1. Location: The Aventine Hill is a quiet and beautiful part of Rome just south of the Circus Maximus and the Forum. No traffic noise, just peace and quiet. After a hard day's walking and sightseeing, it was a joy to wander back through the Aventine Hill and relax in peace at our hotel. The Testaccio, with its restaurants, bars and market is also 5 minutes down the hill. You can pick up your lunch from the Testaccio market or from Piu Volpettis and save money instead of lunching at tourist spots. We enjoyed eating at Da Bucatino and Augustarello's and also had a truly memorable (but pricy) meal at Checchino dal 1887. 2. The Hotel: Beautifully restored, spacious and well-appointed rooms, excellent AC and wonderfully clean bathrooms. Free Internet access too. The hotel has a restaurant which is a little pricy compared to places nearby in the Testaccio, but nevertheless an excellent place to eat, especially if you arrive tired and jet-lagged and can't be bothered to go out on your first night. The sister hotel, Villa San Anselmo, is currently being restored just round the corner, and if the end result is the same, will also be an excellent place to stay. 3. The staff: Without exception, everyone was friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the maids and the bar staff. English was generally spoken very well. Americans might find the staff more reserved than in the US, but this did not bother us at all - we found the staff a delight. 4. Access: OK, it isn't 2 minutes from the Spanish steps..... but we could get anywhere we wanted by cabs (the staff will call cabs from a nearby cab station for you) for about 10-15 Euros, or the Pyramide metro 10 minutes walk away. 5. Price: It is not a budget hotel. We paid 220 euros/night at the height of the tourist season, but for the location, rooms and service, we felt this was a real bargain. If you want to stay in a centrally located, noisy bargain basement flophouse with no AC, rude staff and crummy rooms, go ahead. We'll be going back to the Villa San Pio.

Reviews.Title: “Villa San Pio was the best thing about our stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Whatscreennamehasnotbeentaken?
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best thing about our trip to Rome. Rome is exciting, but it can be loud and stressful and at the end of the day, we felt grateful to go back to our beautiful hotel in a beautiful, quiet, leafy neighborhood. The room we stayed in was spacious with tall ceilings, a large bathroom, and a balcony overlooking a quiet tree-lined street. The cost of the hotel was more than we originally intended to pay, but after staying there, we both felt it was a bargain. Although we stayed here in October of 2002, a friend stayed at the hotel this past Winter and told us San Pio was the best part about his trip. I have only two minor negatives to add: (1) The employees that worked behind the reservation desk at the time of our stay did not appear to enjoy their jobs in the least. They were not aggressively rude, but we were glad we did not have to ask them for anything. The rest of the staff, however, from the bell-hops to the maids, were great. (2) The complimentary breakfast was a little too sweet for my liking and the coffee a little too watered down. However, we still enjoyed it just because the setting was so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great oasis”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Pierre D
Reviews.Content: I found the quality and the location to fit my expectations. While it is reasonably close to some of the sights, it is in a residential area so it is very quiet. They have elevators - which is nice after a day of sightseeing; breakfast is reasonably extensive. It is also walking distance from two subway stations. I should mention that when you arrive they give you a list of restaurants from the area. This is a very good list. These restaurants are mostly visited by the locals so the food is good and the prices reasonable. One evening we had dinner at a top rated restaurant (top 25 rom Zagat)., it cost four times the price for the same food. We quickly returned to our neighborhood restaurants for the rest of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Rome Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We absolutly loved this hotel!! My husband and I could not have asked for a better sanctuary at the end of a long day of seeing the sights!! From the rooms to the gardens to the best ever Cappuccino we've had ( they make a heart out of foam on top) this hotel was perfect!! There is no reason to stay anywhere else in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Villa San Pio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with this hotel we hated to leave. The five of us (all ladies ages 35 to 65) spent eight nights at Villa San Pio and enjoyed the lovely rooms, wonderful baths, excellent breakfasts and the very cordial, extremely helpful staff. The location within a few minutes walk of a bus stop and taxi stand was ideal and we could actually walk to many ancient sites. We all enjoyed returning to the quiet neighborhood and lovely gardens at the end of the day before preparing for an eight o'clock dinner. We usually took cabs at night...staff always called for us...they arrived in a few minutes...not expensive. This was my third trip to Rome and the longest. Our stay at this charming hotel was far superior to the Hilton. Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GardenQ
Reviews.Content: I write this review with some hesitation because I want this hotel to be my secret but it looks like the word is already out. My husband and I went to Italy on an anniversary trip last March and stayed in at the Villa San Pio for several days. The staff was helpful, the rooms were wonderful and the food was great. Loved every minute. Would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to all the rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: apearson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa San Pio early march. Very pleased with everything... as others say. Actually the breakfast, though unvaried in total, offered enough choice to keep most people happy & was the best of our Italian trip. The garden setting was outstanding. Affordable & good restaurants are about 8 mins walk away in the evening. In room email is slow but there is a public facility on which you can send & receive emails

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, charming, romantic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer of 2004 for a few days and absolutely loved it. The room was beautiful, we had our own patio, and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was delicious! We loved staying in this part of Rome--it was convenient but offered a neighborhood feel that we really liked. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the villa san pio and found this truely charming hotel great value for money. The staff were attentive and friendly and for breakfast you had a lovely choice of food. It is in a beautiful part of rome only about 10 minutes walk to the forum and palatino. At night it is very peaceful and relaxing, it's hard to believe you are so close to the centre. We thoroughly enjoyed rome and would highly recommend it for a city break. A magnificent place to eat next to the trevi fountain is "Nonna Papera" Bruschetteria with the best bruschetta and pasta (homemade) in Rome, it is small, friendly and the best value for money we found and had to go back!. It is situated in vicolo dei Modelli. After a hard days sightseeing to go back to the villa san pio and have a relaxing jacuzzi bath was just the best. At night Luigi would get us a cab and off we went again. A taxi cost about 8 euro into the centre and more after midnight. If i were to return to Rome i would not hesitate to book this hotel, in short its charming, has professional staff, very clean, traditional and what makes me review it as excellant is the location and above all the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Probus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Villa San Pio around Valentine's Day and found it to be exactly as described - delightful atmosphere, friendly staff and exceptionally good value. I'd emailed them in advance to see if we could have a "room with a view" and they came up trumps with a lovely room (529) that looked out across the city and had an enormous terrace. The latter would be a real advantage in the warmer months. I'd also asked them for some flowers for my wife and a lovely bouquet duly arrived. The location is great for Ancient Rome - Circus Maximus, Forum and Colosseum are 10-20 minutes walk - but for the Vatican, Piazza Navonna, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain probably best to use taxis. Given that it was Valentine's Day, the hotel was fairly quiet and most of the people at breakfast seemed to be Italian businessmen. Perhaps this is another sign of its quality? Thoroughly recommend it and would love to come back in June/September

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ness219
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 5 nights in Sept. '03 after reading the reviews on this site. I was so glad to have the recommendations from Trip Advisor's site. The hotel was beautiful and tasteful. The staff, though reserved, were very nice and accomodating. My room was supposed to be single and they gave me a lovely room with a queen size bed and a veranda with potted lemon trees. My family's rooms were even nicer with full sized terraces. The doorman and the barman were especially helpful. The barman made and delivered cappucini to my room several times. The complimentary breakfast was done very nicely and if you don't make it to the breakfast, they will deliver whatever you want from there to your room at no charge. The neighborhood is peaceful and not filled with tourists, yet close enough to the city center and all of Rome's attractions. You can walk to the Colliseum, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill and Rome's famous flea market. The cabs cost about 7 euros to most of Rome's attractions. Down the hill from the hotel is a salumeria called Volpetti's that was outstanding. The host at Villa San Pio also recommended an excellent local restaurant called Luna Piena which was within walking distance. My family and I all loved our stay here and would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable Roman experience”
Reviews.Author: bathtraveller
Reviews.Content: We booked the Villa San Pio for a week's stay in August, following the excellent comments on this site and others, and it exceeded even those. The service was efficient, friendly and professional, with exceptional procurement of taxis! The room we had was fantastic, with beautiful decoration and a balcony which was great to come back to after a long day in the Roman sun. The garden and conservatory bar and breakfast area were enchanting, and the service and food was excellent - you really felt valued as a guest (coffee orders were remembered one day to the next!). We especially enjoyed the morning opera and piano recitals over breakfast, which gave it all an extra something. A great place for a romantic break! Location was wonderful, in a great, quiet area with easy walking access to most places you'd want to get to if you intended walking around Rome and aren't in a great rush. However, no taxi journey was too long or very costly. Also, within close distance of some great 'Roman' restaurants in the Testaccio market area, full of locals and authentic food. Couldn't recommend the hotel more, and can't wait to get back there!

Reviews.Title: “Generally good”
Reviews.Author: dl1us
Reviews.Content: Just got back too. The shower did not drain sufficiently with the water on full-blast and did overflow also. Also tried the internet and had the exact same problem. The staff was standoffish, but I attribute that to the fact they serve an almost entirely english-speaking clientele and they seem (sort-of) sick of dealing with us. Is this a problem in other places in Rome? Hell, the city is overrun with foreign tourists, it'd get on my nerves to if it was my job every day. That said, the hotel was very nice. The breakfast was good. We ate one night at the restaurant and it was good. The Aventine location is very quiet and cool for those who have already stayed in Rome in the usual locations (those others even more overrun with non-Italians). The hotel is very well-run, the staff speaks English and it has every modern convenience. Room service was good, and every question we asked was satisfied. They sell bus tickets at the desk, you can buy stamps, they have free umbrellas to borrow, they have restaurant recommendations (La Vitella excellent), they know directions and transit routes, etc. I'd recommend the place. The location is off the beaten path but not too far, which is a plus for non-first-timers who know Rome. The buses run easily(23, 280) up the Tiber and the subway is reasonably close. Taxis from Via Corso are about 7 Euro. Discovering Testaccio was cool. The hotel is quiet, but I did hear some door slamming in the morning, I don't know exactly what doors these were, but it is a minor complaint. The shower had awesome hot water, I guess Rome never has had water problems! Overall, I'm glad I stayed there. I thought is was nice, and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: kth73
Reviews.Content: We originally booked 3 nights at the Hotel Aventino, but upon arrival, we were told that the hotel was full and we were moved the Hotel Via San Pio, which we were told was an upgrade. Although, I had confirmation of my reservations, the staff questioned us several times and generally made us feel uncomfortable for our stay - as though we didn't deserve to be there. While we appreciated the upgrade, I would have preferred staying at a lesser hotel with friendly staff. At all other hotels we stayed at during our 2 week vacation in Italy, hotel staff were friendly and offered suggestions to improve our visit. Not so at Via San Pio. About the only question they asked, was when we'd be leaving. The room was good size and generally nice, but we had some problems during our stay. Our room must have been located near the laundry room, because we heard noises very early in the morning that sounded like washing machines. Also, the shower leaked every day leaving the bathroom with a large puddle of water. This must have been common, as a towel was already laid next to the shower upon our arrival. The room also had webtv, which was a plus, but unfortunately didn't work very well. The keyboard didn't include a mouse, but did have a small toggle which I think was partially broken. I should add that the breakfast was very good, probably the best hotel breakfast we had during our stay. In retrospect, I would have preferred a hotel closer to the city, but that is not the hotel's fault. We also stayed at the Hotel Nazionalle in Rome, a more centrally located 4 star of comparable cost, for an additional few nights and found the accomodations, the location, and the staff to be much, much better. Would not stay at the Hotel Via San Pio again. Beware, I read all the stellar reviews and was really disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: balena
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable hotel in Rome, Villa San Pio is where you should stay. We had read some not so favorable reviews of the staff, but found them not true! The staff went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. We loved the location and walked everywhere. We especially like the local trattorias where you could get a great meal at a reasonable price. We would definately stay at Villa San Pio on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie.Northbrook
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct. 6, 2004. We chose this Hotel from the reviews posted and location. Since we only had one night in Rome before our 12-day Mediterrean cruise, we wanted to see the Colloseum. The Hotel set up a driver to pick us up at the airport. That worked out great. We walked to the Colosseum and were given excellent directions at the front desk. We also took a taxi to Trevi Fountain. The breakfast was provided in their atrium which was quite lovely. We also had a driver to take us back to the airport in the morning to catch the shuttle to the ship. The accommodations were satisfactory, the combined shower, tub was a bit cramped. The view from our balcony was picturesque. The two person elevator made for an intimate experience. We both couldn't fit in with all our bags (6). All in all the Hotel more than met our expections from the reviews posted.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: migolfergirl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our elderly mother to Europe in October, 2004 and while in Rome stayed in a triple room at the Villa San Pio. The room was great: quiet, roomy, nicely appointed, comfy beds (even though we were all in twin beds!), GREAT bathroom (marble with a superb shower/jacuzzi combo tub). We had some problems getting our internet connection to work in the room (they subscribe to some weird internet service that is unwieldy and difficult...never could get hooked up to hotmail, for example....), but nevertheless...excellent place to stay. The location was quiet and in a beautiful residential area with several gorgeous Catholic churches (and a convent across the street) within a 3-5 minute walk (lots of weddings going on Sunday mid-morning). The site is just up the hill from the Circus Maximus, which is on the outskirts of "Ancient Rome." All of this translates into peaceful, no throngs of people, beautiful neighborhood, etc. etc. with a major bus stop just a 5-7 minute walk down the hill (Circus Massimo? stop). (Great little neighborhood restaurants down the opposite side of the hotel. Ask the night staff where to go in the area for good pizza...it's really a GREAT little restaurant...dine in (full menu) or take out (salad, pizza, pastas, etc.) The staff was great, breakfast was perfect, I would definitely reccomend this hotel to anyone. We did have a few negative surprises after using Trip Advisor to plan our trip, but this was a spectacular place to stay. I'd definitely stay here again! As a side note, Villa San Pio has a sister hotel, Hotel San Anselmo, which is just around the corner. This hotel is being completely refurbished, and the opening is scheduled for sometime later on this year. It looked GORGEOUS, and would definitely be worth an inquiry if your trip is in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Hustle-Bustle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Incommunicado
Reviews.Content: The Villa San Pio was wonderful. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed. The restaurant is great, and the grounds are lovely. It's in a residential area, which provides a nice break from the sightseeing. However, it's a bit of a walk to the nearest subway station, and you then need to transfer to another line to get to the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAnkeny
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a quiet area. Very clean and beautifully decorated with lovely bed linens. Hotel staff very friendly; front desk efficient. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming tranquility in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful 12day/11night stay in the Eternal City of Rome where we chose to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. We selected Villa San Pio as our hotel based on the reviews read at Tripadvisor.com. Having never been to Italy, or even Europe before, the comments from this site were most helpful. After a day of touring, it was a pleasure to return here-- a very peaceful retreat with a true Italian ambiance. It is a short metro or taxi ride from the city center, but it is quick and inexpensive to get to most sites. We found our favorite restaurant, bakery and deli to be within a 5 minute walking distance on Via Marmorata and Via Alessandro Volta. The staff was wonderful and truly made us feel "at home." We will stay here again, and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After several exhausting hours researching hotels in Italy, we decided to split our stay between the Aventino hotel and the Westin Excelsior. When we arrived at the Aventino, we were immediately upgraded to the Villa San Pio at no extra charge. (I'm not sure why, but we didn't complain!) The hotel was wonderful-it has the feel of a Tuscan house and we found the gardens very inviting. Our room was lovely - the 'alcove' that contained my daughter's bed was very inviting and made her feel like she had her own little room. We liked being in a neighborhood - after the hustle and bustle of staying in the middle of Paris, it was a nice change and we still found it easy to get around town. The staff was very accomodating and friendly. The hotel restaurant had a nice atmosphere but we found the food to be average. We also had no luck with the free internet in our room. When we were scheduled to move on to the Westin, we didn't want to leave. Although the Westin is a wonderful hotel as well, next time we'll spend our entire Rome vacation at the Villa San Pio (and at a much lower cost than the Westin!) One suggestion: when you make your reservation, ask about the price of a taxi from the airport to the hotel - we took a "private" taxi and got ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paul_W_7
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the San Pio in August, having booked on the basis of the many positive reviews here. All in all I have to rate the hotel as excellent, noting that this is a 3-4* hotel. Obviously if you stay in a 5* in the centre of Rome you will get 'more', but you will obviously pay a lot more too. In summary you get more than you pay for, at the expense of being away from the centre of town (which some actually see as an advantage). Good things - very quiet area, lovely setting for breakfast/dinner, exceptional restaurant staff and (contrary to the experience of some other reviewers) helpful front desk staff. Good food in the evening. Free internet connection in the room is useful and our room (a triple) was more than ample in size. It was lovely to have the balcony - well worth requesting. Very reasonably priced. Bad thing - it is a little way off the centre of Rome - 20 Mins walk to the Colosseum which is the closest major site, more than that too the other major tourist attractions. That said, we used taxis and the metro, both of which are much quicker and readily available.
